Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative: I am filing a complaint against Cash App ( Block , Inc. ) due to inadequate customer service and unfair practices, which violate the Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ). Specifically, Cash App failed to take timely and effective measures to prevent and address fraud on their platform, leaving my account vulnerable and unprotected. Furthermore, their dispute resolution process was unfair and deceptive, as they did not comply with error resolution requirements under the Electronic Fund Transfer Act ( EFTA ) and Regulation E. These actions have caused significant inconvenience and financial loss, and I seek appropriate redress for these violations.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative: I am submitting a complaint regarding the ongoing inaccurate reporting of information on my credit file by XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX. Despite my multiple disputes and submission of all necessary supporting documentation to the credit bureaus, they continue to report incorrect information in violation of federal law. XXXX XXXX XXXX is improperly reporting late payments, violating 15 U.S.C. 1681a ( d ) ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ), which prohibits the inclusion of transactions and experiences between a consumer and a servicer in a credit report. Furthermore, XXXX XXXX has now classified the account as a charge-off, which violates 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ( 4 ), prohibiting the reporting of adverse information beyond the legally permitted period, and this needs to be removed from my account immediately. XXXX XXXX XXXX is inaccurately reporting a paid and closed account, violating 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ), 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ), and 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ), which govern the reporting of outdated accounts, accuracy requirements, and obligations to investigate disputes. Additionally, I have no knowledge of the XXXX account, making its presence a violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681b regarding permissible use of consumer information. XXXX has also reported a student loan as late, despite it being in forbearance under the Biden Administrations federal student loan relief program, violating 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ). I have also provided proof of my exposure to a data breach, yet the credit bureaus have failed to address these issues appropriately. The credit bureaus ' failure to correct these errors continues to cause harm to my creditworthiness, and I request immediate corrective action to ensure compliance with federal regulations.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Problem with personal statement of dispute
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX horizon. CT XXXX XXXX XXXX New York XXXX XX/XX/year> Experian Information Solutions , Inc . 
XXXX Department po box XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX RE : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX under FCRA and XXXX XXXX To Whom It XXXX Concern, I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate information on my credit report. This dispute is submitted under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681i, which requires credit reporting agencies to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation of disputed items.

Recent findings by the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) have brought to light significant concerns regarding Experian 's failure to conduct proper investigations. Specifically, in a lawsuit filed against Experian, the CFPB alleges that the company engaged in sham investigations, violating consumer protection laws by failing to meet its obligations under the FCRA.

As per 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), Experian is required to conduct a thorough and reasonable reinvestigation of disputed items within 30 days. Furthermore, under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ), any information found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable must be promptly deleted or corrected. Failure to adhere to these requirements constitutes a violation of federal law. 
I hereby request that Experian : XXXX. Conduct a thorough reinvestigation of the following disputed accounts or item XXXX XXXX XXXX CHERRY TECHNOLOGY ES IN XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I would like you to remove all " NON-MAIL-ABLE '' addresses. I'd like to have XXXX address listed to maintain accuracy. 

If you don't comply I will file a CFPB claim stating sham investigations which ultimately lead to Experian being sued XXXX. Provide me with all documentation used to verify the accuracy of the disputed information. 
XXXX. Correct or delete any information that can not be verified or is inaccurate, as mandated by law. 
Given the recent CFPB findings, I expect Experian to handle this dispute with the utmost seriousness and compliance with legal standards. A copy of my identification and any relevant supporting documents are enclosed to facilitate your investigation. 
If Experian fails to comply with its obligations under the FCRA, I will not hesitate to escalate this matter to the CFPB and pursue any necessary legal action to protect my rights. 
Please respond to this dispute in writing within the legally mandated timeframe. I expect written confirmation of any changes made to my credit file. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Mortgage
Sub-issue: Escrow, taxes, or insurance
Consumer complaint narrative:
Recently I worked with Freedom Mortgage to partially release 2 dwelling units on my land. My original parcel tax account was segregated into 3 new tax account numbers. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I discovered my county property taxes that were due XX/XX/XXXX had not been paid. On or about that day I called Freedom Mortgage to report the issue and was assured by the agent it would be resolved soon. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, having not received any information, I called and sent a message to Freedom Mortgage through their secure portal about the status of the unpaid taxes. I was told the issue was " scheduled for resolution '' by XX/XX/XXXX. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I received a message from Freedom stating that my taxes were not due until XX/XX/XXXX and that this information was received from the county. 

On XXXX I sent a message instructing Freedom to pay the outstanding balance with penalties for my original tax account. I stated I had coordinated with the county that payment to that account would be applied to the 3 account numbers and email me when complete. I demanded the documentation Freedom Mortgage claimed they had stating my taxes were due XX/XX/XXXX. I provided a scanned copy of the county tax bill for the account. 

On XXXX I received email notification taxes had been disbursed from my escrow account for 2 of the new tax account numbers. No notification was provided for the 3rd tax account number. 

On XXXX I received a message from Freedom stating they would research the issue and reply by XX/XX/XXXX. 

On XXXX I sent a message to Freedom explaining that they did not comply with my instructions sent XXXX and instructed them to submit payment for the 3rd tax account by XX/XX/XXXX and email me when complete. I provided a PDF copy of the county tax bill for that parcel and stated if my tax was not paid by XXXX XX/XX/XXXX I would submit a complaint to the CFPB. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I received a message from Freedom stating their research " should '' be complete by XX/XX/XXXX. 

That same day I sent a message to Freedom again instructing them to disburse my tax payment to the correct account with a copy of my instructions from XXXX. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I received a message from Freedom stating their research " should '' be complete by XX/XX/XXXX. 

That same day I sent a message to Freedom instructing them for a 3rd time to remit tax payment from my escrow account. 

As of the date of this complaint no further information from Freedom Mortgage has been received.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Information belongs to someone else
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX PA XXXX XXXX XXXX Portfolio Recovery XXXX XXXX! XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX ACCOUNT XXXX ORIGINAL CREDITOR : XXXX  Cease and Desist Request for Deletion of Collection Account Dear COLLECTION COMPANY, I am writing to formally request that you immediately cease all reporting of the collection account associated with my name, which appears on my credit report. This request is made under the privacy protections afforded to me by 15 U.S. Code 6802. I have reviewed my credit report and noticed that your company is reporting a collection account that is inaccurate or incomplete. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I am entitled to dispute any information that I believe to be erroneous. If you do not cease reporting this account, I am formally requesting Proper Validation and Proof of Claim as per the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). I seek comprehensive validation of the alleged debt, including evidence establishing that I am the party obligated to settle this debt and that there exists a legally binding contractual obligation compelling me to do so. For clarity, I request that all communication be limited to written correspondence until adequate validation of the purported debt is provided. To assist you in meeting this request, please furnish the following required documentation : 1. A copy of the original contract or agreement under which the debt arose.

2. A detailed account statement showing the amount of the debt, including any fees or interest.

3. Date of Last Activity.

4. Full, accurate social security number that may help to identify me as the correct person you are trying to collect from.

5. Documentation confirming that you have the legal right to collect this debt.

6. Any correspondence related to this account that includes my signature or consent.

I demand that you take the following actions : 1. Immediately cease reporting the collection account associated with my name.

2. Confirm in writing within 15 days that this account has been deleted from all credit reporting agencies or provide the requested validation. Please understand that failure to comply with this request may result in further actions on my part, including but not limited to filing a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and seeking legal remedies to protect my rights. Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. I hope to resolve this issue swiftly. Please understand that failure to comply with this request may result in further actions on my part, including but not limited to filing a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and seeking legal remedies to protect my rights. Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. I hope to resolve this issue swiftly. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

This was clearly a billing error made my the company and is not a reflection of my payment experience which violates XXXXSC Code 1681eb. This error has caused severe hard to my reputation, my character, my mode of living and to my family!

I demand the late payment to be updated.

They are not in compliance with the following law. 15 USC 1666b and its requirements set the standards and the guidance for a creditor to treat a payment as late, yet they are reporting a payment as late and they did not comply with the law!

15 USC 1666b ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section XXXX ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. 


Never Sent the periodic statement along with the disclosures from section 1637 ( b ). 


I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered 21 days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule 1002 and It was never provided. 


This is unfair, illegal, fraudulent, and not equitable to me as a consumer! 


Update the late payments from my consumer reports

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports

Consumer complaint narrative:
. I am writing to bring to your attention a matter concerning inaccuracies in my credit report, specifically related to outdated personal information, including my name, address, and employment details. Also all three bureaus is reporting different information and accounts with different amounts and collections. I believe that this issue may be in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), and I am seeking your assistance to rectify it. 

Upon reviewing my credit report provided by XXXX, I discovered that the following inaccurate information is listed : XXXX. **Name : ** The report contains an old version of my name, which I legally changed on XX/XX/year>. The report should reflect my current legal name : XXXX. **Address : ** The report lists previous addresses where I have not resided for over 20 years. 

XXXX. **Employment : ** old employers are reporting along with current employer. My employment history is essential for my creditworthiness, and having outdated employment details can significantly impact my credit profile. 

XXXX. **Old accounts that have been disputed and have not been validated These inaccuracies not only misrepresent my personal information but may also lead to potential issues with credit applications, insurance rates, and other financial matters. I have contacted the credit reporting agency to dispute this information, following the procedures outlined in the FCRA ; however, I have not received a satisfactory resolution. 

Given the significance of this matter, I kindly request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigate the practices of the credit bureau in question regarding the reporting of outdated and inaccurate information. Furthermore, I would appreciate any guidance or support you could provide in resolving this issue and ensuring that my credit report is updated to reflect my accurate information. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response and assistance in resolving these inaccuracies in my credit report.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Information belongs to someone else
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX # XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XX/XX/XXXX To : Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, IA XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, PA XXXX Equifax XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX Subject : Request to Remove or Block Fraudulent Accounts Due to Identity Theft To Whom It May Concern, I, XXXX XXXX XXXX, am writing to formally report that I am a victim of identity theft. Fraudulent accounts have been opened in my name without my knowledge or consent, and these accounts are being reported on my credit reports. 

I respectfully request that the items below be investigated, removed, or blocked from my credit reports as mandated under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2. 

Fraudulent Accounts Account XXXX Account Number : XXXX Open Date : XX/XX/XXXX Balance : {$1200.00} Account XXXX Account Number : XXXX Open Date : XX/XX/XXXX Balance : {$71000.00} At the time these accounts were created, I was XXXX  and had no ability to apply for or access credit. These fraudulent accounts have caused significant financial and emotional harm, and I am taking all necessary steps to resolve this matter. 

FCRA Protection and Your Responsibility Under the FCRA, credit reporting agencies are required to block and/or remove fraudulent accounts from a consumer 's credit report once they receive proper documentation of identity theft. Specifically : 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 states that when a consumer provides proof of identity theft, including a police report or affidavit, credit reporting agencies must block the reporting of information related to fraudulent accounts.

Failure to act promptly can result in liability for damages, including statutory or punitive damages, as outlined in the FCRA.

Supporting Documentation I have enclosed the following documents to substantiate my claims : A copy of my government-issued ID ( drivers license ). 
Proof of my current address ( utility bill ). 
A copy of the police report filed regarding the identity theft. 
Documentation verifying my incarceration and inability to create or access accounts at the time these accounts were opened. 
Next Steps I request that the fraudulent accounts listed above be investigated and immediately removed or blocked from my credit reports. Additionally, I ask that any inquiries or associated collections related to these accounts be removed as they are unauthorized and a direct result of the identity theft. 

Please send me a written confirmation once the fraudulent items have been blocked or removed. If additional information or documentation is needed, do not hesitate to contact me at ( XXXX ) XXXX or via email at [ Your Email Address ]. 

Conclusion I trust that the CFPB, XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax will take the necessary steps to address this issue in accordance with federal law. Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am the victim of identity theft which has caused a great deal of issues in my personal life and financial background. I have accounts on my report that are not something I authorize and have been trying to address the issues for months. All I am able to get from the bureau is that they verified the debt/inquiry and they are valid. By invoking the Fair Credit Reporting Act Section 611 I thought that finally things were going to turn around and I would get some resolution. It has not been over 60 days and no reply.

Listed below are the items I am still trying to resolve : Public Records XXXX XXXX Reference Number XXXX Date filed XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  Charged Off Accounts XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Acct No XXXX Acct No XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Acct XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Inquires XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Equifax Mortgage Service XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Checking or savings account
Sub-issue: Problem accessing account
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am the executor of my Fathers 's account that he has with PNC Bank. I visited the branch in XXXX on XXXX XXXX XXXX, PA to be able to access the account and its funds. The woman told me that I needed the death certificate and a copy of the funeral expenses ONLY. I came back a few days later with that information only to be told I was not able to get the funds because the receipt I have doesn't state that the funeral was paid in full. I have a few worrying takeaways from this besides being frustrated with the experience : XXXX. Why is it that anyone can walk into this branch with the death certificate and a copy of the funeral expenses and receive the money from a deceased account? The law states that only the joint account holder or executor can access accounts. 
XXXX. An executor does not need to use any funds for the funeral. They can use it to pay off debts or handle probate proceedings. Why am I not able to access these funds without the very specific funeral expense receipt? 
XXXX. When I called customer service they clearly stated that I would need a court document stating I am the executor to be able to access the account but when I walked into the branch they didn't even care to see it. Who is PNC hiring to work at their branches? 
XXXX. The only way they said I could access the funds was to open an estate account with them. There is no law stating that I am required to do my estate handling with the same bank as the deceased. 

The frustration is for me but also for anyone else who could be going through a really difficult time. This type of negligence is simply unacceptable.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Information belongs to someone else
Consumer complaint narrative:
The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system.

So whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of my privacy with my consumer report, since I control what is listed and what is not. In the event that any accounts are reported without my written consent, that is considered identity theft.

This is a violation of both 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2. This leads way to civil liability against the credit reporting agency for negligent and willful noncompliance under 15 U.S. Code 1681n, which allows for {$1000.00} per violation, for account listed without my expressed written consent.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Personal information incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
I see that theres inaccurate information reporting on my consumer reporting that I would like removed. I have sent this request several times. Dear Consumer Department : I have recently reviewed a copy of my consumer report and unfortunately it has come to my attention that some of my personal information is incorrect. If you would please be so kind as to delete this inaccurate information from my credit profile within the next thirty days, I would greatly appreciate it. Ive listed the details on my personal information in which you are inaccurately reporting and must remove right away. 

Please see below : My name is : XXXX XXXX I DO NOT have any requisite OTHER NAMES or aliases, and I DO NOT desire any OTHER NAMES or aliases to be retained or reported. If there are any, please DELETE NOW or produce PROOF of your legitimate AUTHORITY to retain much less report without infringing my consumer rights. I have attached a photo of my ID which shows the proper and legal spelling of my full name. 

My current address is : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, VA XXXX I DO NOT have any requisite OTHER CURRENT ADDRESSES, and I DO NOT desire any OTHER ADDRESSES to be retained or reported, if ANY DELETE NOW or produce PROOF of your legitimate AUTHORITY to retain much less report without infringing my consumer rights. I have attached a photo of my ID and utility bill which shows my current address and the proper spelling of it. 

You are not authorized to report my Social Security Number on my credit report or sell any information containing my Social Security Number to any company. Reporting my Social Security Number on my consumer report arises a safety issue and opens me up to potential identity theft. Immediately DELETE any and all Social Security Numbers that your company is reporting on my credit report. 

My Birth Date is : XX/XX/scrub>XX/XX/XXXX I DO NOT have any requisite OTHER DATES OF BIRTH, and I DO NOT desire any OTHER DATES OF BIRTH to be retained or reported, if ANY DELETE NOW or produce PROOF of your legitimate AUTHORITY to retain much less report without infringing my consumer rights. 

I DO NOT have any requisite telephone numbers, and I DO NOT desire any TELEPHONE NUMBERS to be retained or reported, if ANY DELETE NOW or produce PROOF of your legitimate AUTHORITY to retain much less report without infringing my consumer rights. 

I DO NOT have any requisite employers and I DO NOT desire any EMPLOYERS to be retained or reported, if ANY DELETE NOW or produce PROOF of your legitimate AUTHORITY to retain much less report without infringing my consumer rights. 

I DO NOT have any requisite spouses nor roommates no co-applicants, and I DO NOT desire any TELEPHONE NUMBERS to be retained or reported, if ANY DELETE NOW or produce PROOF of your legitimate AUTHORITY to retain much less report without infringing my consumer rights. 

Thank you, in advance, for honoring my requests. Its my understanding that you have up to thirty days to follow through on my requests so if I dont receive any updates from you within that time frame, then I know that these inaccuracies must be removed automatically. Once you have removed the inaccurate information, I would like my full completed and corrected credit reporting showing these changes mailed to the CURRENT ADDRESS : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, VA XXXX Thank you, Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to address the ongoing inaccuracies on my credit report. Despite previous attempts to dispute the following items, they remain unresolved, significantly impacting my ability to obtain credit. I am entitled to monetary compensation under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 6 ), which requires consumer reporting agencies to notify consumers of the results of reinvestigations within XXXX business days after completion. You failed to correct these errors indicates noncompliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). 


Under the FCRA, if disputed items can not be verified, they must be removed from my report. As per 15 U.S. Code 1681n ( Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681o ( Civil Liability for Negligent Noncompliance ), your agency may be held liable for failing to comply with federal law. Additionally, 15 U.S. Code 1692k holds entities accountable for violations related to debt collection. Any continued failure to address these inaccuracies in a timely manner will result in further legal action. 


XXXX Accounts listed below must be DELETED IMMEDIATELY! due to violations of FDCPA Section 807 ( False and Misleading Representations ) and These accounts are falsely reported as charge-offs. 
Collection Accounts Collection accounts listed below is in violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( Permissible Purposes of Consumer Reports ). These must be DELETED in my report immediately. 
Unauthorized Inquiries listed below were made without my authorization, violating 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( 1 ) ( A ) ( B ) ( i ) ( 3 ). They must be deleted from my report. 

DELETE THIS ACCOUNTS IN MY CREDIT REPORT IMMEDIATELY!

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  To Whom It May Concem : Be advised this is not a refusal to pay, but a notice that your claim is disputed and validation is requested. 
Under the Fair Debt collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I have the right to request validation of the debt you say I owe you. I am requesting proof that I am indeed the party you are asking to pay this debt, and there is some contractual obligation that is binding on me to pay this debt. 
This is NOT a request for " verification '' or proof of my mailing address, but a request for VALIDATION made pursuant to 15 USC 1692g Sec. 809 ( b ) of the FDCPA. I respectfully request that your offices provide me with competent evidence that I have any legal obligation to pay you. 
At this time I will also inform you that if your offices have or continue to report invalidated information to any of the three major credit bureaus ( XXXX, Experian, XXXX XXXX ), this action might constitute fraud under both federal and state laws. Due to this fact, if any negative mark is found or continues to report on any of my credit reports by your company or the company you represent, I will not hesitate in bringing legal action against you and your client for the following : Violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act and Defamation of Character. 
I am sure your legal staff will agree that non-compliance with this request could put your company in serious legal trouble with the FTC and other state or federal agencies. 
If your offices are able to provide the proper documentation as requested in the following declaration, I will require 30 days to investigate this information and during such time all collection activity must cease and desist. Also, during this validation period, if any action is taken which could be considered detrimental to any of my credit reports, I will consult with legal counsel for suit. This includes any listing of any information to a credit-reporting repository that could be inaccurate or invalidated. If your offices fail to respond to this validation request within 30 days from the date of your receipt, all references to this account must be deleted and completely removed from my credit file and a copy of such deletion request shall be sent to me immediately.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Mortgage
Sub-issue: Escrow, taxes, or insurance
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I received an email from Newrez ( my new mortgage company ) that my insurance premium had been paid from escrow on XX/XX/XXXX. 
On Monday, XX/XX/XXXX, I received notice from my insurance company that my home owners insurance had NOT been paid. I called my insurance company to verify and to ensure that the correspondence/payments had not crossed communications paths. They in fact had NOT received payment for my homeowners insurance. I agreed to call back after the new year 's holiday to verify payment. I called back on XX/XX/XXXX, and payment had not been received. I called New Rez, and discovered that they did not send payment to the correct insurance company. ( Note : this is the ONLY Insurance company I've had homeowners with since purchasing this house. It has NEVER changed names or locations. ) In a XXXX way call with myself, New Rez argued that they would post date a check and put in in the mail today ; however, insurance company, the insurance company stated that there is NO grace period, and that payment MUST be received by XXXXXXXX XXXX. on XX/XX/XXXX or I would not have insurance, and that I would not be eligible for reinstatement. After some discussion and arguments quite frankly between the insurance provided and New Rez, New Rez agree to stop payment on check and that they would pay via phone electronically to my insurance XXXX before close of business. 
After hours on the phone and multiple call backs ( on recorded lines ) New Rez had not made payment by close of business on Friday, and I was promised that they would do so on Monday, XX/XX/XXXX. They did not, and as of XXXX XXXX XXXX, New Rez has still NOT paid my insurance premiums. I was forced to do so with money I do not have to ensure no gap in coverage. In a phone conversation on XX/XX/XXXX, I was informed by New Rez that they still hadn't paid my homeowners insurance!! During this entire ordeal, supervisors and management from New Rez have REFUSED to speak with me, and the customer agent on the phone has been unable to provide assurances that this matter would be corrected to prevent future reoccurrence or assurances that I could be provided a refund in a timely manner.

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt is not yours
Consumer complaint narrative:
The amount is {$1600.00}. I called Harris and Harris ( debt collector for XXXX XXXX ). They told me it was for internet at an address I don't know. This was in XXXX. I don't live there and I don't know anyone who lives there. They never communicated with my in any way. I just noticed that there is a collection/chargeoff on my credit report. 

I called them and they gave me a reference number and an email address where I can file a form. I did that. I called again to ask why it wasn't removed. They told me that they were mailing me a form that I needed to fill out. I never got a form. I watched carefully for it. 

I called again and got disconnected. Then I called again and explained. He put me on hold. I waited 30 minutes and then got disconnected. I called back and the office was closed. He must have know that he was leaving the office without helping me with this issue. They have ignored and ignored my attempts to fix this. IT is NOT my debt. It must have been fraudulent from the beginning and Harris and Harris know that but they aren't removing it from my credit report. Harris and Harris are not working in good faith when they lie to me telling me to fill out the form so that it can be fixed. And telling me that they are sending a form for me to fill out that never arrives ... .even after I filled out all the proper information that they requested.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

Consumer complaint narrative: Cash app closed my account several months ago accusing me of gambling. I have never used my cash app account to gamble. I have to block automated calls and text to this day and I believe that cash app is culpable for my sensitive information being made available through a third party that they privileged access to.

I am submitting this complaint to outline an ongoing issue I have faced with Citi Bank regarding a dispute I filed. The matter concerns a charge from a moving company that double-charged me. Despite my repeated efforts to resolve this issue, I have been met with inconsistent answers and no resolution. 

Heres a summary of the events : I initially filed a dispute with Citi Bank regarding the double charge. 
The dispute was placed on XX/XX/year>, but Citi Bank later reversed it without my knowledge. 
The dispute was closed because I had moved and never received their follow-up letter. 
I reopened the dispute on XX/XX/XXXX, as reflected in the communication records. 
Since then, I have contacted Citi Bank eight or more times, seeking clarity and resolution. 
Despite these efforts, the responses I receive from Citi Bank representatives are inconsistent, and no clear steps have been taken to resolve the dispute. Each call results in different information, leaving me frustrated and without closure on this issue. 

I am seeking CFPBs assistance to ensure that Citi Bank reviews this matter thoroughly, provides consistent communication, and resolves the dispute in a fair and timely manner.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account status incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
My account with XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX BANK SS was never late! I have had exceptional payment history witH XXXX XXXXXXXX and all payments were placed on Autopay. This late payment that is reporting is a result on a systematic error on their end processing my payment. 

This was clearly a billing error made my the company and is not a reflection of my payment experience which violates USC Code 1681eb. This error has caused severe hard to my reputation, my character, my mode of living and to my family!

I demand the late payment reported in to be removed.

They are not in compliance with the following law. 15 USC 1666b and its requirements set the standards and the guidance for a creditor to treat a payment as late, yet they are reporting a payment as late and they did not comply with the law! 

15 USC 1666b ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX never sent the periodic statement along with the disclosures from section 1637 ( b ).

I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered 21 days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule 1002 and It was never provided.

This is unfair, illegal, fraudulent, and not equitable to me as a consumer!

Delete the late payments from my consumer reports
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Information is missing that should be on the report
Consumer complaint narrative:
" The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence, which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system.

So whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of my privacy with my consumer report, since I control what is listed and what is not. In the event that any accounts are reported without my written consent, that is considered identity theft.

This is a violation of both 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2. This leads way to civil liability against the credit reporting agency for negligent and willful noncompliance under 15 U.S. Code 1681n, which allows for {$1000.00} per violation, for each account listed without my expressed written consent.

I looked at my consumer reports and noticed accounts I never gave anyone permission to report. Consumer reporting agencies have assumed a vital role and have a responsibility to report consumer information to the best of their ability with maximum possible accuracy like the Fair Credit Reporting Act clearly states. I did not provide written consent to report them. List all accounts : "

Product: Checking or savings account
Sub-issue: Banking errors
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX my debit card number was used to make several fraudulent purchases online at XXXX XXXX in XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX purchase was for {$XXXX} and another for {$XXXX}. Also on this same day my cellphone service was fraudulently changed from XXXX XXXX XXXX to another carrier. I had no service for the whole day. I called XXXX XXXX XXXX and found out what had happened and immediately got my service turned back on. During the time my cell phone was changed to new carrier someone was able to move money around in my different accounts with Wells Fargo. I have their mobile app and online banking. They took money out of all the savings accounts and moved it to the checking account that is tied to the debit card with the fraudulent charges. I immediately called Wells Fargo fraud department and reported everything. They opened a claim. I visited my Wells Fargo branch as soon as possible and sat down with a representative who assured me that I did not need to change my account and I just needed a new debit card. After XXXX  days Wells Fargo refunded the stolen money back into my checking account. I visited my Wells Fargo branch again and sat with the same representative. She now said that I need to change my accounts before they could let me back onto online banking. I did as they asked. On XX/XX/XXXX Wells Fargo took back the money they had provisionally given me and said that they could not prove fraud. No one had ever called to talk to me about it or get any more information from me. I have called XXXX XXXX and found that the address for the orders was in Florida. I have documentation from XXXX XXXX XXXX showing that my phone was hacked. I thought your bank was supposed to help you in these situations. {$XXXX} dollars is not a lot to most people but it is a lot to my family. This has caused us to be late on bills and cost a fortune in late fees.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Investigation took more than 30 days
Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681.

15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions 15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account status incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative: My accounts was never late! I have had exceptional payment history with XXXX XXXXXXXX and all payments were placed on Autopay. This late payment that is reporting is a result on a systematic error on their end processing my payment. This was clearly a billing error made my the company and is not a reflection of my payment experience which violates USC Code 1681eb. This error has caused severe hard to my reputation, my character, my mode of living and to my family! I demand the late payment reported to be removed/updated. They are not in compliance with the following law. 15 USC 1666b and its requirements set the standards and the guidance for a creditor to treat a payment as late, yet they are reporting a payment as late and they did not comply with the law! 15 USC 1666b ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered 21 days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule 1002 and It was never provided. This is unfair, illegal, fraudulent, and not equitable to me as a consumer!

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> Experian XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX **Subject : ** Dispute of Credit Report and Request for Correction Violation of FCRA Section 1681o ( Civil Liability for Negligence ) Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally dispute certain information reported on my credit file, and to notify you of a potential violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically Section 1681o, which addresses civil liability for negligence in the accuracy and completeness of consumer credit information.

There has been incorrect information affecting my credit report in regards to credit cards and a recent car note. This has been present on my file for more than 2 years, which is unfairly affecting my ability to rent, or get transportationXXXX XXXX XXXX **Description of Incorrect Information : late payments, missed, payments. 

Upon reviewing my credit report, I found that the above-referenced information is inaccurate or incomplete, due to incorrect missed payments. I believe this error was the result of negligence in your handling of my credit file. 

As outlined in Section 1681o of the FCRA, I understand that you are responsible for ensuring the accuracy and integrity of the information provided. I request that you investigate this dispute promptly and correct the inaccurate information. If it is determined that negligence was involved, I will also be seeking appropriate damages for any harm caused by the inaccurate reporting.

Please provide me with written confirmation that the matter has been investigated and the necessary corrections have been made, or an explanation if you believe the information is accurate. 

I appreciate your attention to this matter and expect a resolution in a timely manner, as required by the FCRA. 

Thank you for your cooperation. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account information incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
Equifax failure to correct the disputed accounts in accordance with 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( i ) is a violation of federal law. As of this date, I demand : 1. Immediate removal of the erroneous entries.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Was not notified of investigation status or results
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX Subject : Request for Description of Investigation Process and Correction of Inaccurate Reporting Dear CFPB, I am writing to formally dispute the inaccurate reporting of late payments on my credit report concerning the XXXX account ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. This is the second dispute regarding this matter, following my previous complaint on XX/XX/XXXX, which has yet to be adequately resolved. 
Pursuant to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) under 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 7 ), I request a detailed description of the investigation process your agency followed concerning this account. This information must be provided within 15 days, as stipulated by the FCRA. 
Details of the Dispute : The account in question has been incorrectly reported with late payments as follows : Equifax : XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX These late payments are erroneous, as I consistently made all payments on time according to the agreed-upon terms. 
Account Information : Account Number : XXXX High Balance : {$31000.00} Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Date Closed : XX/XX/XXXX Current Status : Closed Account Type : Automotive Loan Payment Status : Paid or Paying as Agreed ( per XXXX and Equifax XXXX ; Incorrectly reported as " Paid, was past due 30 days XXXX or XXXX times '' ( XXXX ). 
Monthly Payment : {$0.00} ( account closed ). 
Violation of Federal Laws : Under 15 USC 1681c, credit reporting agencies are required to ensure the accuracy of the information they report. Late payments negatively impact my credit history and do not align with my actual payment history. Further, per 15 USC 1681s-2 ( b ), furnishers of information are obligated to correct inaccuracies upon dispute. 
Additionally, under 15 USC 1666 ( b ), creditors are required to adopt reasonable procedures to ensure statements and due dates are communicated appropriately to consumers.

Reference to PAANL ( Paid As Agreed Never Late ) : The terms of my agreement with XXXX XXXX XXXX have always been adhered to. This account should reflect a status of " Paid As Agreed, Never Late '' because all payments were made in a timely manner. 
The inaccurate reporting of late payments undermines my financial responsibility and adversely affects my creditworthiness. As the FCRA mandates, consumer reports must be accurate and complete. Failure to correct this error will constitute a breach of this obligation. 
To clarify, under 15 USC 1681a ( c ) and 1681b ( a ) ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ), information reflecting transactions and experiences solely between me ( the consumer ) and the creditor must be reported accurately. Reporting incorrect late payments violates this requirement. 
Requested Action : Immediate Correction : Update the payment history on this account to reflect " Paid As Agreed, Never Late '' across all three credit bureaus. 
Investigation Documentation : Provide a description of the procedures used to investigate this dispute, including the steps taken to verify the accuracy of the reported late payments. 
Proof of Late Payments : If the late payments can not be corrected, provide documented proof, including dates, amounts, and supporting communication validating these claims. 
Supporting Documentation : Enclosed, you will find : My previous dispute letter dated XX/XX/XXXX. 
Copies of my credit reports from XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax showing the incorrect late payment entries. 
Expectations and Compliance : Per the FCRA, I request a written response within 30 days of receipt of this letter. Failure to correct these inaccuracies or provide the required documentation will be considered a violation of the FCRA and may lead to further action. 
I trust your agency will take immediate action to ensure my credit report reflects accurate and fair information. I expect a resolution that aligns with the legal obligations outlined by the FCRA, the Consumer Protection Act, and the Truth in Lending Act. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to address the account associated with XXXX  XXXX, account number XXXX, which continues to contain inaccurate information, including a potentially fraudulent account that has been investigated multiple times by the company. Despite my repeated attempts to resolve this issue through various channels, I have yet to receive an adequate resolution or satisfactory response. 

The investigation conducted on this matter has lacked professionalism and has not adhered to legally recognized investigative procedures. Despite multiple investigations and reinvestigations, the issue remains unresolved with no clear resolution. This constitutes a direct violation of several consumer protection laws and my rights as a consumer. 

Laws being violated include : Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) This law ensures that consumers have accurate and complete information in their credit reports and that disputes over information are handled promptly and fairly. Under the FCRA, when a consumer disputes inaccurate information, the credit reporting agency and the furnisher of the information ( like XXXX  XXXX ) are required to investigate the matter within XXXX days and notify the consumer of the results. Repeated failure to resolve this issue, as well as failure to provide clear information on the investigative process, violates this law. ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX ) Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) This act prohibits debt collectors from using unfair or deceptive practices when collecting debts. If XXXX  XXXX is reporting inaccurate or fraudulent information, they are violating the FDCPA by failing to ensure that the debt information being reported is accurate. ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX ) Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ) This law gives the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) the authority to enforce regulations regarding unfair or deceptive practices in consumer financial products or services. XXXX XXXXs failure to resolve this dispute in a timely and proper manner and its repeated re-reporting of inaccurate information constitutes a violation of this act. ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX ) Credit Repair Organizations Act ( CROA ) This law prohibits the use of false or misleading representations regarding credit repair services. If XXXX  XXXX is re-reporting inaccurate information after the matter has been investigated multiple times, this could be construed as a violation of the CROA, as the repeated errors can affect a consumers ability to repair their credit history. ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX ) Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) This act ensures transparency in lending practices. If XXXX  XXXX is reporting inaccurate credit information that is potentially fraudulent, they are violating TILA by failing to provide consumers with accurate and clear information regarding their credit accounts. ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX ) State Consumer Protection Laws Depending on your state of residence, various state laws may provide additional consumer protections against unfair credit reporting and lending practices. These laws complement the federal protections listed above. 

Given the severity of these violations, I request the following actions : That you immediately provide all methods and procedures used in the investigations conducted by XXXX  XXXX and EXPERIAN, including specific processes and supporting evidence, as it has been over XXXX  days since my last contact with both entities without receiving the requested documentation. 

That this account be permanently deleted from all credit reports and that no further reporting of this account be made in the future. 

That all violations of the law cease immediately, particularly those related to the FCRA, FDCPA, CFPA, CROA, and TILA, as well as any other applicable state laws. 

That legal action be taken to correct and prevent further harm to my credit and consumer rights. 

I expect a clear and effective resolution of this matter in the shortest time possible. Should I not receive a response, I will forward all relevant documentation to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and the Attorney General 's Office, as well as other relevant regulatory authorities. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
**Formal Dispute of Inaccurate Credit Reporting under the FCRA** **To Whom It May Concern, ** I am formally disputing inaccurate information on my credit report under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681i. This law requires credit reporting agencies to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation of disputed items. Recent findings by the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) have raised serious concerns about Experians failure to properly investigate consumer disputes.

In a lawsuit filed against Experian, the CFPB alleges that the company engaged in inadequate investigations, violating consumer protection laws and failing to meet its obligations under the FCRA. Under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), Experian is legally required to conduct a thorough and reasonable reinvestigation of disputed items within 30 days. Additionally, per 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ), any information found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable must be promptly deleted or corrected. Failure to comply with these provisions constitutes a violation of federal law.

I formally request that Experian : 1. Conduct a thorough reinvestigation of the following disputed accounts or items : Such as XXXX, any other bill on my account 2. Provide all documentation used to verify the accuracy of the disputed information.

3. Correct or delete any information that can not be verified or is inaccurate, as required by law.

Given the CFPBs recent findings, I expect Experian to address this dispute with the highest level of diligence and in full compliance with legal requirements.

I have enclosed a copy of my identification and relevant supporting documents to assist in your investigation. Please provide a written response confirming the results of your reinvestigation.

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Furthermore, under 15 USC 1681, Section 604 ( A ), Section 2, a consumer reporting agency can not furnish an account without my written instructions. Also, 15 USC 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ) states that no consumer reporting agency may include any adverse item of information that is more than seven years old, other than records of convictions of crimes.

Finally, under 15 USC 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ), no person shall furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. Additionally, according to 15 USC 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( B ), a person shall not furnish information if ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer that specific information is inaccurate, and ( ii ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am disputing a debt that Harris & Harris is attempting to collect because they have failed to provide debt validation as required by the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692g. 

In XX/XX/year>, I sent a debt validation request via certified mail to Harris & Harris, requesting proof that I owe this debt to XXXX XXXX. Under FDCPA law, they are required to provide verification of the debt before continuing collection efforts. However, they have not responded to my request, but they continue to send collection notices in violation of the FDCPA. 

Since Harris & Harris has failed to validate the debt, they should not be reporting it to the credit bureaus or attempting further collection efforts. Their continued collection attempts without proper validation violate federal consumer protection laws. 

I am requesting that : Harris & Harris cease all collection efforts until they provide the legally required validation of the debt. 
The debt be removed from my credit report as it remains unverified. 
CFPB investigates Harris & Harris for violating FDCPA laws by continuing collection efforts without verification.

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Attempted to collect wrong amount
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to dispute an inaccurate entry on my credit report related to the repossession of a vehicle. After a careful examination of my credit report, I have identified a significant error that is adversely affecting my creditworthiness. The issue at hand involves the inaccurate reporting of late payments, specifically 30-day, 60-day, and 90-day late payments, multiple times in connection with the repossession of the mentioned vehicle. They also never sent me a notice of sale or cancellation of contract since they sold my vehicle. they sent this to an old address. when i attempted to get the car back it was already sold. i was never told where the vehicle was etc.

The inaccurate listing of late payments is causing considerable harm to my credit score and is misleading as it suggests that I was delinquent on payments after the repossession had taken place. It is illogical and impossible for a repossessed vehicle to have accrued 90-day late payments multiple times when I no longer had possession of the vehicle.

This inaccurate reporting is damaging my creditworthiness and creating an unjust representation of my financial history. I request that you thoroughly investigate this matter and correct the entry accordingly.

The misreporting of this account has persisted for an extended period, and I have made previous attempts to rectify this issue without success. Given the prolonged and damaging nature of this error, I must insist on the immediate correction of this inaccurate information in which I expect to see the item removed from my credit report as it has been inaccurately reflecting on my credit for long enough, hurting my credit worthiness and violating my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act.

I expect a thorough and timely investigation into this matter, in accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). If this dispute is not resolved within the legally mandated time frame, I am prepared to take legal action to protect my rights.

Please provide a written response within 30 days from the date of this letter, confirming the correction of the inaccuracies on my credit report. 
Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter, and I appreciate your efforts in rectifying this issue promptly.

Subject : Formal Complaint Regarding Inaccurate Credit Reporting Dear CFPB, I am filing this complaint to address the inaccurate and harmful information being reported by the credit bureaus listed below. Consumer Rights Violated Under the FCRA ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq. ), I am entitled to : The assurance that my credit report contains only accurate, verifiable, and complete information. 
A thorough investigation of any disputed information, with results provided within 30 days. 
The removal of unverifiable or unauthorized information from my credit report. 

The inaccurate account and unauthorized inquiries have caused harm to my creditworthiness, violating my rights as a consumer.

Failure to address these inaccuracies will leave me no choice but to pursue legal action for non-compliance under the FCRA. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I trust that the CFPB will ensure the credit bureaus take the necessary steps to resolve these issues promptly. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Subject : Complaint Regarding Inaccurate Late Payments on Credit Report Complaint Details : I am submitting this complaint regarding inaccurate late payments that are reported on my credit file maintained by Equifax Information Services LLC. I believe these late payments are erroneous and do not accurately reflect my payment history. 

Nature of the Complaint : 1. Inaccurate Reporting : The late payments listed in my credit report are inaccurate. I have consistently made my payments on time, as I have been enrolled in auto pay for all my accounts. 
2. Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : The inaccurate reporting of these late payments violates my rights under the FCRA ( 15 USC 1666 ( b ) ), as they misrepresent my creditworthiness. 
3. Potential Violation of Fair Debt Collections Practices Act ( FDCPA ) : The reporting of false late payments may also constitute a violation of the FDCPA, which protects consumers from misrepresentation regarding their accounts. 
4. Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) : I assert that the reporting practices violate the TILA, which mandates accurate reporting of credit information. 


Account Number : XXXX Account Number : XXXX Additionally, the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically sections 15 U.S. Code 1681i and 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2, mandates that credit reporting agencies and information furnishes correct any inaccurate or incomplete information in credit reports and ensure the maximum accuracy of information contained in consumer files. 
Furthermore, under the FCRA, articles 616 and 617 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681n and 1681o ) outline the civil liability for willful and negligent noncompliance, respectively. 

These provisions provide for damages, including actual damages, attorney fees, and possible punitive damages, for failure to comply with the Act 's requirements

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt is not yours
Consumer complaint narrative:
Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, IA XXXX Subject : Formal Complaint Against Capital One Charge-Off and Non-Issuance of 1099-C To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally lodge a complaint against Capital One regarding a charged-off account reported on my credit file. I have repeatedly contacted Capital One to request the issuance of a Form 1099-C, as required under the Internal Revenue Code, but have not received any resolution despite multiple attempts over an extended period. 

Pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( Fair Credit Reporting Act ), consumers are entitled to accurate and fair reporting of credit information. Furthermore, under IRS guidelines, when a debt is charged off, the creditor is typically required to issue a Form 1099-C if the debt meets specific thresholds for cancellation. This failure to provide a Form 1099-C has caused considerable personal and financial stress, as I need this documentation for my tax filings. 

Additionally, I have observed that Capital One continues to report late payments on this charged-off account each month. Once an account is charged off, the addition of late payments contradicts accurate reporting practices and unfairly penalizes my credit standing, further exacerbating my difficulties. 

This unresolved issue has had a profound and stressful impact on my life, preventing me from moving forward with purchasing my first home for my family. I request the CFPBs assistance in ensuring Capital One complies with its legal obligations by : 1. Issuing the Form 1099-C for the charged-off debt.

2. Ensuring the account is accurately reported on my credit file without further monthly late payment notations. 



I respectfully request a resolution to this matter within 15 days from the date of this letter. Please let me know if further information is required to expedite this process. 

Thank you for your assistance in this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

XX/XX/XXXX Subject : Complaint Regarding Inaccurate Late Payment Reporting on Credit Report Dear CFPB, I am writing to file a formal complaint against Experian for failing to correct inaccurate information regarding late payments reported on my credit report for the following account : Account Details : Account Name : XXXX  XXXX Account Number : XXXX High Balance : XXXX XXXX {$660.00}, Experian : {$660.00}, XXXX XXXX {$500.00} Date of Last Verified : XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX Date of Last Activity : XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX, Experian : XX/XX/XXXX Date Reported : XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Date Opened : XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX, Experian/XXXX  : XX/XX/XXXX Balance Owed : {$0.00} Account Status : Closed Payment Status : Current Two-Year Payment History : Late payments noted for XXXX  ( 30 days late ) and XXXX  ( 60 days late ) for XXXX Despite multiple requests for correction through disputes filed on XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX, the inaccurate information has not been corrected. This failure violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ). 
FCRA Violations Under 15 U.S. Code 1681i, credit reporting agencies are required to ensure the accuracy of the information in consumer files. The presence of late payment notations that are demonstrably inaccurate violates this mandate. Additionally, creditors are obligated to send accurate information to the credit bureaus as outlined in 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2.

TILA Violations As per 15 U.S. Code 1666b, periodic statements must be provided at least 21 days before the payment due date. The inaccurate late payment reporting suggests that the creditor may have failed to comply with this requirement.

Protection Against Non-Payment of Obligations Act ( PAANL ) This act reinforces the need for creditors to send timely and accurate statements to prevent unfair penalties to consumers, which has not been adhered to in this case.

The continuous failure to address these inaccuracies has caused significant harm to my creditworthiness, affecting my ability to secure credit and financial opportunities.

Desired Resolution : Immediate removal of the inaccurate late payment notations from my credit report.

Written confirmation of the correction within 15 business days.

If this issue is not resolved promptly, I will escalate my complaint to include legal action and additional complaints with other relevant regulatory agencies.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Information belongs to someone else
Consumer complaint narrative: I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate information reported on my credit report concerning a charge-off. Below are the details of the account in question : Creditor Name : [ XXXX XXXX ] Account Number : [ XXXX ) Date of Charge-Off : ( XX/XX/year> ) It has come to my attention that this charge-off is being reported repeatedly monthly, which is incorrect. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), negative information such as a charge-off should be reported only once, reflecting the date it was charged off. Under the FCRA, credit reporting agencies are required to ensure the accuracy of the information they provide ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ). The continuous monthly reporting of this charge-off misrepresents my payment history and negatively impacts my credit score. Furthermore, the statute of limitations for reporting a charge-off is seven years from the date of the initial delinquency that led to the charge-off ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ( 4 ) ). Repeatedly reporting this charge-off as a new event each month does not reflect the statute of limitations and is therefore improper. Trequest an immediate investigation into this matter and the correction of my credit report by removing the repeated entries of the charge-off from my payment history. Please update my credit report accordingly and provide written confirmation of these corrections. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Sure, here 's a structured explanation you can use, incorporating the relevant law : -- - **Subject : Request for Removal of Account Due to Data Breach and Violation of Privacy Rights** Dear [ Credit Reporting Agency / Williams & Fudge ] , I am writing to formally request the removal of an account related to Williams & Fudge from my credit report due to a violation of my privacy rights stemming from a data breach.

**Background and Legal Context : ** 1. **Data Breach Exposure** : I believe my personal information, including sensitive financial data, was exposed during a data breach involving Williams & Fudge . As a result, my private financial details may have been improperly accessed or disclosed, which violates my fundamental right to privacy. A data breach of this nature is not only a breach of trust but also potentially a violation of multiple legal protections designed to safeguard consumers. 

2. **Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) 15 U.S. Code 1681** : Under the FCRA, specifically 15 USC 1681 , individuals have the right to expect that their personal information will be handled with the utmost care and accuracy by entities that report to credit bureaus. If an account or collection item is the result of a data breach or improper access to your personal information, it is considered inaccurate and unauthorized reporting, which can lead to harm in terms of credit scoring and personal privacy. 

3. **Violation of Privacy** : The exposure of my private information through this data breach is a clear violation of my privacy rights under both state and federal laws. When a consumer 's data is compromised, the consumer may have grounds to dispute the legitimacy of any resulting debts or collections that are reported based on this breach.

4. **Right to Dispute and Remove Inaccurate Information** : In light of these facts, I am exercising my right under the Fair Credit Reporting Act to dispute the accuracy of this account. Since the account with Williams & Fudge resulted from a data breach, and my personal information may have been improperly used, I request the immediate removal of this account from my credit. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this issue. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

After realizing that I had not included necessary identification documents ( a copy of my driver 's license, social security card, and proof of residency ), I promptly sent a new packet containing the same disputes, this time including the required documents ( a copy of my driver 's license, social security card, and voters registration card ). I tried several times to contact Experian by phone, however their automated system makes it impossible to speak with someone or inquire about disputes. Under the FCRA, Experian is obligated to investigate consumer disputes in a timely manner. If Experian can not verify the accuracy of the disputed information, it must delete the items from my credit report. Experian failure to comply with this legal requirement has left inaccurate negative information on my credit profile, causing significant harm. Impact of the Violation : Experian 's negligence has resulted in negative and inaccurate information remaining on my credit report. This failure has directly impacted my ability to access credit and secure housing, as lenders and landlords rely heavily on accurate credit reporting to make decisions. The presence of this false information has caused undue stress, financial hardship, and a diminished quality of life, which could have been avoided had Experian honored its obligations under the FCRA.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX XXXX Phone : XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX Date : XX/XX/year> XXXX Department Equifax Information Services LLC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX Subject : Dispute of Charge-Off Entry on My Credit Report Dear Equifax XXXX Department : I am writing to formally dispute a charge-off entry that appears on my credit report. According to 15 U.S.C. 1681i of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I have the right to dispute any inaccurate or incomplete information on my credit report. If the information can not be verified within a reasonable time frame, it must be removed.

The charge-off in question does not accurately reflect my credit history or the status of the account. I am requesting that you investigate and, if necessary, remove this charge-off entry from my credit report unless proper verification is provided.

Under 15 U.S.C. 1681i, credit reporting agencies are required to investigate any disputed information within 30 days and to provide written confirmation of the results of the investigation. If the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete, it must be corrected or removed. The presence of this charge-off on my credit report is damaging to my creditworthiness and violates my rights under federal law.

Please investigate this matter and remove the charge-off entry from my credit report if it can not be properly verified. I request a written confirmation once the investigation has been completed and the necessary corrections have been made.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. Please do not hesitate to contact me if you require any additional information. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX 15 U.S.C. 1681i Procedure in Case of Disputed Accuracy This section of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) outlines the procedures for disputing inaccurate information on a credit report. It states : When a consumer disputes information on their credit report, the credit reporting agency must investigate the dispute within 30 days.

The agency must promptly notify the consumer of the results of the investigation. 
If the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete, it must be corrected or removed from the consumers report.

2. 15 U.S.C. 1635 Right of Rescission : While this section primarily pertains to the right to rescind certain credit transactions, it underscores the necessity of clear and accurate credit agreements. The existence of a fraudulent account indicates a failure to uphold these standards.

Review and address any systemic issues within these credit bureaus that may allow for inadequate verification of disputed accounts, especially in identity theft resulting from data breaches. 
I trust that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau will take this matter seriously and take appropriate action to rectify the situation. 
Thank you for your attention to this urgent issue. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

On XX/XX/XXXX while in XXXX, my wife purchased a sweater from XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX. When we arrived home my wife went to wear it for the first time and I noticed a hole in the shoulder of the sweater. 

On XXXX/XXXX/XXXX I chatted, called and emailed XXXX XXXX XXXX and let them know the issue with the sweater. The chat system let me know that I could only email at the time. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I emailed again, as I got a notification that I needed to submit to a different email address than provided by the chat service. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I emailed again asking for any status updates. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I emailed again after I received an alert that I needed to email back if still needed help. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I called XXXX and spoke with XXXX. She asked for a picture of the sweater and the receipt. I submitted them through email after she sent her response. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I emailed back to confirm that she had received the pictures. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I called XXXX to speak with them about the issue. The agent asked if I was wanting a refund or replacement. 

Having resolved that no one from XXXX was helping or responding. I submitted my claim on XX/XX/XXXX in the total of {$120.00}. 

XXXX emailed me on XX/XX/XXXX to ask if I had gotten any communication on the sweater issue. I explained that I still hadnt been communicated with and had started a chargeback on the purchase. The XXXX store went silent again. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I called Elan Financial Services and spoke with an agent about the claim. She stated the vendor, XXXX, had not communicated with them. They had then escalated to XXXX. XXXX had not communicated with XXXX and that since the vendor was not communicating, that XXXX was stating that they would side with me. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I opened my XXXX account to find that I had charged for my dispute. The reason for the denial was that I was present at the time of the sale which invalidates any claims on items. 

I promptly called and re-opened the case. I do not agree that being present at the time of sale invalidates the dispute. I have purchased many items that you can not 100 % verify perfect quality at the time of purchase. This is unreasonable and untenable.
