Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this formal complaint against Experian for failing to fulfill its legal obligations under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically its duty to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation of disputed information on my credit report. Despite my repeated efforts and the evidence I provided, Experian has neither corrected nor removed the disputed items, which remain inaccurate or unverifiable. This failure has negatively impacted my credit standing and caused ongoing financial harm.

Under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), Experian is required to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation of disputed information within 30 days. Additionally, 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) mandates that credit reporting agencies ensure maximum possible accuracy in consumer credit files. Experians failure to properly investigate my disputes and its refusal to correct or remove inaccurate accounts constitute clear violations of these legal provisions.

Furthermore, I would like to bring attention to the recent CFPB lawsuit against Experian, which highlights systemic issues within its dispute resolution process. The lawsuit alleges that Experian has : 1. Failed to forward consumer-provided evidence to furnishers.

2. Accepted unreliable responses from furnishers without proper validation.

3. Failed to adequately notify consumers about the outcomes of their disputes.

These allegations mirror my experience. Experian has not properly reviewed or addressed the documentation I submitted, has failed to provide detailed explanations regarding its dispute resolutions, and has ultimately refused to take corrective action. This negligence continues to harm my financial standing, limiting my ability to obtain credit under fair terms.


Requested Action : I respectfully request that the CFPB take immediate action to : 1. Investigate Experians failure to comply with FCRA dispute resolution requirements. 2. Require Experian to correct or remove the disputed accounts from my credit report. 3. Ensure that Experian improves its dispute handling process to prevent further harm to consumers. Experians noncompliance with federal law has directly affected my financial stability, and I urge the CFPB to intervene promptly. Please find attached supporting documentation, including copies of my dispute submissions and Experians inadequate responses. Thank you for your time and consideration. I appreciate your efforts in ensuring consumer protection and fair credit reporting practices.

Product: Mortgage
Sub-issue: Foreclosure
Consumer complaint narrative:
I respectfully submit this urgent request for immediate intervention regarding ongoing and unlawful foreclosure proceedings against my property at XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XX/XX/XXXX IL XXXX, despite clear evidence that the mortgage debt has been fully satisfied. The imminent sale of my home is scheduled for XX/XX/XXXX, through XXXX, a sale that must be immediately stayed to prevent irreparable harm. 
I am the defendant in XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX, in Illinois, presided over by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX of the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX. Additionally, I have filed XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX to address numerous violations of my constitutional rights and federal law. Despite the submission of a Bill of Exchange ( BOE ) on XX/XX/XXXX, which was recorded on my XXXX Financing Statement and privately served open ended GSA Bond to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX, to settle the foreclosure case, the court has failed to honor the BOE and GSA Bonds and continues to allow the foreclosure to proceed unlawfully. 
Factual Background On XX/XX/XXXX, I issued a Bill of Exchange ( BOE ) to the U.S. Treasury in satisfaction of the alleged mortgage debt associated with my property. This BOE was validly recorded on my XXXX Financing Statement, pursuant to the Uniform Commercial Code ( UCC ), which recognizes the BOE as a valid negotiable instrument under UCC 3-104 and 3-603. 
On XX/XX/XXXX, The GSA Bond was delivered in a private capacity toXX/XX/XXXXXX/XX/XXXX XXXX, who presides over the foreclosure case in XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Case No. XXXX, through XXXX, Manager of the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, who confirmed on video that he personally delivered the instrument to XX/XX/XXXXXXXX. 
Despite being given 90 days to respond and comply, XXXX XXXX has remained silent, which under UCC 3-501 ( a ) constitutes acceptance of the instrument. Instead of applying the BOE to discharge the debt, the court continues to pursue foreclosure proceedings. 
The GSA Bond was open-ended, allowing XXXX XXXX to input any amount necessary to fully satisfy and discharge the alleged debt. 

Despite being given 90 days to comply, XXXX XXXX has failed to apply the bond or acknowledge it in any manner, constituting tacit acquiescence and acceptance of the bond. 

Instead of resolving the matter, the foreclosure case has been allowed to proceed, and a foreclosure sale is scheduled for XX/XX/XXXX, which is now listed on XX/XX/XXXX 

The bonds purpose was to fully satisfy the debt, close the foreclosure case, and protect Petitioners home located at XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, Illinois XXXX. 
Legal Arguments 1. Violation of Due Process U.S. Constitution, Fifth and Fourteenth Amendments The foreclosure proceedings have systematically denied me due process. My requests for discovery have been denied, my evidence has been ignored, and I have been prevented from presenting my case in a meaningful way. These actions violate my constitutional right to due process and fair treatment under the law. 
2. Uniform Commercial Code ( UCC ) Satisfaction and Discharge of Debt UCC 3-104 establishes that a Bill of Exchange is a negotiable instrument.

UCC 3-603 ( b ) mandates that once such an instrument is tendered and not refused within a reasonable time, the underlying obligation is discharged. Judge Sullivans failure to reject or acknowledge the BOE constitutes acceptance by silence.

UCC 3-501 ( a ) confirms that an instrument must be dishonored or accepted, but the judges silence and subsequent actions indicate unlawful retention without discharge of the debt.

3. Federal Consumer Protection Statutes Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), 15 U.S.C. 1601 et seq. : Failure to provide validation of debt and misapplication of payments are violations of TILA.

Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692 : Continuation of collection efforts after payment and failure to verify the debt constitute deceptive and unfair practices.

28 U.S.C. 1331 Federal question jurisdiction exists as Petitioners claims arise under the Constitution and federal statutes.

28 U.S.C. 1343 Federal courts have authority to redress constitutional violations and grant equitable relief.

42 U.S.C. 1983 The state courts failure to honor the GSA Bond and the continued foreclosure proceedings constitute violations of Petitioners civil rights under color of state law.

4. Illinois Foreclosure Law Violations 735 ILCS 5/15-1508 ( d ) requires that foreclosure sales be fair and just. Proceeding with a sale while the debt has already been discharged violates this statute.

Illinois Consumer Fraud and Deceptive Business Practices Act, 815 ILCS 505/2 : The foreclosure proceedings represent unfair and deceptive practices.

5. Humanitarian and International Law The imminent eviction of my family of six without legal justification violates basic human rights as enshrined in the Universal Declaration of Human Rights ( Articles 17 and 25 ), which guarantee the right to property and an adequate standard of living.

________________________________________ Relief Requested Given the urgency of this situation, I respectfully request that the CFPB : 1. Immediately halt the XX/XX/XXXX foreclosure sale of XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XX/XX/XXXX IL XXXX. 
2. Order XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX to acknowledge and account for the bond. 
3. Enforce the acceptance and application of the open-ended GSA Bond served on XX/XX/XXXX, to satisfy the alleged debt in Case No. XXXX. 
4. Conduct an investigation into the actions of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and all other parties involved in this unlawful foreclosure. 
5. Enforce the application of the Bill of Exchange and confirm the discharge of the alleged debt.

6. Protect my family from homelessness and uphold our constitutional and human rights.

Conclusion I have exhausted all remedies available at the state level and am now at my last line of defense. This situation is urgent, and immediate intervention is required to prevent a miscarriage of justice.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your immediate response and action.

Product: Mortgage
Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue related to modification, forbearance, short sale, deed-in-lieu, bankruptcy, or foreclosure
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Mortgage Payment Error and Unfair Late Fees Complaint Summary : I recently discovered that my mortgage was placed in default due to a short payment, which I was unaware of for two months. Despite having paid a total of {$5900.00} by XXXX, the bank refused to apply my payments to the mortgage account because of a shortfall of {$580.00} in XXXX. This shortfall was related to the escrow account reserve for taxes, not the actual interest payment. The bank has now demanded {$24000.00} in late fees and refuses to accept further payments unless the late fees are paid in full. 

Details of the Issue : Payment Application Issue : By XXXX, I had already paid {$5900.00}. Even if my XXXX payment was short by {$580.00}, the payment should have been applied to the mortgage account. The unpaid amount was not related to interest but to the escrow account reserve for property taxes. Despite this, the bank treated the shortfall as if it was a missed mortgage payment and escalated the situation unnecessarily. If penalties were applied starting from XXXX based on a {$1300.00} shortfall ( from both XXXX and XXXX ), it is unreasonable to demand {$24000.00} in penalties for such a small deficit. 

Excessive Late Fees : A penalty of {$24000.00} for a shortfall of {$1300.00} is excessive and disproportionate. The penalty calculation appears arbitrary, and there has been no clear explanation or breakdown of how this amount was determined. 

Refusal to Accept Payments : The bank is refusing to accept further payments until the full penalty amount is paid. This has escalated the issue unnecessarily and has caused significant financial distress. 

Requested Resolution : Apply the {$5900.00} paid to the mortgage account and adjust or waive the excessive late fees. 
Allow me to resume regular payments to bring the mortgage current. 
Provide a detailed breakdown of how the {$24000.00} penalty was calculated and clarify why the escrow reserve shortfall was treated as a missed payment. 
This situation has placed an undue financial burden on me and appears to violate fair lending practices. I request your assistance to resolve this issue and allow me to bring my account current.

o Obtain financing for essential purchases.

The CRAs ' negligence has effectively denied me the right to fair access to credit and housing, constituting a violation of my constitutional protections. 
3. Violation of Federal Law By failing to ensure the maximum accuracy of the information reported as required under 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) and failing to verify the validity of disputed accounts, the CRAs have willfully and negligently breached their obligations under the FCRA.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Personal information incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently conducted a review of my credit report and found several items that have caused me significant distress. These items appear to be unverifiable, inaccurate, and questionable. Your agency has failed to ensure the accuracy of the information as required under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of Reports. This statute mandates that consumer reporting agencies must follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report.

Consumer complaint narrative:
According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) 15 USC 1681 Section 602 ( a ), consumer reporting agencies like TransUnion, Equifax, and Experian have a responsibility to be fair, unbiased, and respect my privacy as a consumer. I have the right to ensure my private information is not shared. This is supported by 15 USC 6801, which says that financial institutions must protect their customers ' private information. XXXX XXXX, which provides information to credit agencies, is considered a financial institution under this law. 

15 USC 1681 Section 604 ( a ) ( 2 ) states that a consumer reporting agency can only share a consumer report if they have written permission from the consumer. XXXX XXXX  and the credit agencies do not have my consentwritten or otherwiseto share my information. I am officially revoking any past consent, whether verbal, implied, or written. 

15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ) says that a financial institution can not share private information with a third party unless the consumer is informed and given the chance to opt out. XXXX XXXX  never gave me this option. Additionally, 15 USC 1681C ( a ) ( 5 ) states that consumer reporting agencies can not include adverse information on a report if it is older than seven years, except for criminal convictions. This account is an adverse item being reported again without my permission, which is illegal. 

15 U.S. Code 1681s2 ( A ) ( 1 ) ( A ) states that a person should not report information to a credit agency if they know or have reason to believe it is incorrect. 15 U.S. Code 1681e also requires consumer reporting agencies to have proper procedures to ensure they comply with these rules. TransUnion, Equifax, and Experian are failing to do so. Additionally, 12 CFR 1016.7 states that a consumer can opt out at any time. I am officially opting out of your reporting services.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Experian Information Solutions , Inc . 
Dispute Department XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX RE : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX reporting under FCRA and XXXX XXXX To Whom it may concern, I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate information on my credit report. This dispute is submitted under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681i, which requires credit reporting agencies to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation of disputed items. 

Recent findings by the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) have brought to light significant concerns regarding Experians failure to conduct proper investigations. Specifically, in a lawsuit filed against Experian, the CFPB alleges that the company engaged in sham investigations, violating consumer protection laws by failing to meet its obligations under the FCRA.

As per 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) Experian is required to conduct a thorough and reasonable reinvestigation of disputed items within 30 days. Furthermore, under the 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ), any information found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable must be promptly deleted or corrected. Failure to adhere to these requirements constitutes a violation of federal law.

I hereby request that Experian : Conduct a thorough reinvestigation of the following disputed accounts or items Account name XXXX, Account number, XXXX. 
Provide me with all documentation to verify the accuracy of the disputed information. 
Correct or delete any information that can not be verified or is inaccurate, as mandated by law. 

Given the recent CFPB findings, I expect Experian to handle this dispute with the utmost seriousness and compliance with legal standards. A copy of my identification and any relevant supporting documents are enclosed to facilitate your investigation. 

If Experian fails to comply with its obligations under the FCRA, I will not hesitate to escalate this matter to the CFPB and pursue any necessary legal action to protect my rights. 

Please respond to this dispute in writing within the legally mandated time frame. I expect written confirmation of any changes made to my final credit file. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Subject : Request for Removal of Accounts Due to Data Breach Dear XXXX, I am writing to formally dispute the presence of accounts on my credit report that were compromised as a result of the XXXX  XXXX data breach, where my personal information, including sensitive financial data, was exposed without my consent. This has been confirmed via .equifaxbreachsettlement.com, engagement # XXXX. The breach exposed millions of consumers ' data, including mine, and I am invoking my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681c, and other applicable privacy laws to request the immediate removal of any accounts linked to this breach.

As the breach has left my personal data vulnerable to potential identity theft or fraud, I am requesting that you remove all such accounts from my credit report. Under 15 U.S.C. 1681i, you are required to conduct a thorough investigation into disputed items, and if you fail to verify these accounts as accurately linked to me, they must be removed. Should you fail to comply with this request, you may be in violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681n, which allows me to seek statutory damages for willful noncompliance with FCRA requirements.

Additionally, I request that you provide verifiable proof of each account linked to me, including the chain of assignment/custody and the original signed documents that verify I opened and/or signed for these accounts. If you can not provide this documentation, I expect the accounts to be immediately removed from my credit report.

Please be advised that any failure to remove unverifiable accounts may also be subject to penalties under the Identity Theft and Assumption Deterrence Act, 18 U.S.C. 1028, as unauthorized use of my information constitutes identity theft.

Should you fail to investigate this matter or provide the necessary proof of debt, I will pursue all available legal remedies, including filing complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and seeking legal action under 15 U.S.C. 1681o, which provides for civil penalties for negligent violations of the FCRA.

Enclosed Documents : ID & proof of residence Identity theft Report Credit Report Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
The accounts listed below have violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681. When I reviewed my XXXX report, I found several inaccuracies and incomplete details. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, consumer reporting agencies must follow reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information, as stated in 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ). Additionally, under 15 USC 1681, if any disputed information is found to be inaccurate or unverifiable after a reinvestigation, the consumer reporting agency must promptly delete or modify the information and notify the furnisher. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  [ EQUIFAX INFORMATION SERVICES LLC ] [ XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Subject : Dispute of Unauthorized Access and Furnishing of My Credit Information Dear Sir/Madam , I am writing to formally dispute the inclusion of my information on your credit report and to assert that I have not provided written consent for any entity to access or furnish my personal and credit information. I do not recall giving written consent for any company to obtain or furnish my information, nor have I signed any documentation authorizing such access. According to the FCRA, all credit reporting agencies are required to only provide consumer information when proper authorization is given, and I have not provided such consent. 
Please investigate this matter, and remove any information obtained or shared without my explicit permission. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

XXXX  XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX DATE XX/XX/2024 Synchrony Bank XXXX Long XXXX XXXX, XXXX, CT XXXX ACCOUNT NUMBER : XXXX ORIGINAL CREDITOR : Synchrony Bank XXXX XXXX ) Subject : Cease and Desist Request for Deletion of Collection Account Dear Synchrony Bank, I am writing to formally request that you immediately cease all reporting of the collection account associated with my name, which appears on my credit report. This request is made under the privacy protections afforded to me by 15 U.S. Code 6802. I have reviewed my credit report and noticed that your company is reporting a collection account that is inaccurate or incomplete. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I am entitled to dispute any information that I believe to be erroneous. If you do not cease reporting this account, I am formally requesting Proper Validation and Proof of Claim as per the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). I seek comprehensive validation of the alleged debt, including evidence establishing that I am the party obligated to settle this debt and that there exists a legally binding contractual obligation compelling me to do so. For clarity, I request that all communication be limited to written correspondence until adequate validation of the purported debt is provided. To assist you in meeting this request, please furnish the following required documentation : 1. A copy of the original contract or agreement under which the debt arose.

2. A detailed account statement showing the amount of the debt, including any fees or interest.

3. Date of Last Activity.

4. Full, accurate social security number that may help to identify me as the correct person you are trying to collect from.

5. Documentation confirming that you have the legal right to collect this debt.

6. Any correspondence related to this account that includes my signature or consent.

I demand that you take the following actions : 1. Immediately cease reporting the collection account associated with my name.

2. Confirm in writing within 15 days that this account has been deleted from all credit reporting agencies or provide the requested validation. Please understand that failure to comply with this request may result in further actions on my part, including but not limited to filing a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and seeking legal remedies to protect my rights. Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. I hope to resolve this issue swiftly. Please understand that failure to comply with this request may result in further actions on my part, including but not limited to filing a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and seeking legal remedies to protect my rights. Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. I hope to resolve this issue swiftly. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB Representative, I am writing to formally lodge a complaint against Experian for its willful noncompliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and to demand immediate action pursuant to my rights under federal law. 

Background The following account appear on my credit report as negative items XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Account Number : XXXX This record have been deleted from the record of the original data furnisher, XXXX XXXX This was confirmed by a direct inquiry with XXXX, which no longer maintains these records. 

Legal Basis for Dispute 1. Inaccuracy of Reported Information Pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( a ) ( 2 ), credit reporting agencies are required to ensure the accuracy and completeness of the information they report. Because the source of this information, XXXX, no longer maintains these records, Experian is reporting inaccurate and incomplete information by continuing to include these items on my credit report. 

2. Obligation to Remove Information FCRA 605 ( b ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) requires the removal of inaccurate items from the credit report within 4 days of a dispute being submitted. Given that these records are demonstrably inaccurate, Experian 's failure to promptly remove them violates this statutory obligation.

3. Willful Noncompliance Under 15 U.S.C. 1681n, Experian is liable for willful noncompliance with the FCRA. This includes failing to conduct a reasonable investigation into the accuracy of the disputed items and failing to act in accordance with the law to ensure only verified and accurate information remains on my credit report. 

Demand for Resolution I demand that the following actions be taken immediately : The removal of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ( Account Number : XXXX ) from my Experian credit report within the time frame required by FCRA 605 ( b ).

Confirmation from Experian that these items have been removed, along with a revised copy of my credit report reflecting these changes.

Request for CFPB Action I respectfully request that the CFPB investigate this matter thoroughly to ensure Experian complies with its legal obligations under the FCRA. This is a clear case of willful noncompliance, and I expect immediate corrective action. 

Enclosed are copies of supporting documents, including correspondence with XXXX confirming the deletion of these records and my dispute history with Experian. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Didn't receive enough information to verify debt
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Subject : Formal Request for Debt Validation and Cease and Desist Notice under FDCPA and CFPB Guidelines Dear XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX, This letter serves as a formal request for validation of the alleged debt referenced in your communication and a demand for compliance with my rights as established under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ), and the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) guidelines. 
Request for Full Debt Validation : Pursuant to federal law, I request that you provide complete and accurate documentation regarding the alleged debt, including but not limited to : 1. Assignment and Bill of Sale : o A copy of the original assignment contract or bill of sale proving that your agency has the legal authority to collect this debt.

2. Permissible Purpose : o Proof of permissible purpose under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681b, showing why and how you accessed or reported information on my credit report.

3. Validation of Debt : o The name and address of the original creditor. 
o A complete and itemized accounting of the alleged debt, including the original amount, any payments made, fees added, and how the balance was calculated.

o Copies of all documents bearing my signature that establish a contractual obligation for this debt.

4. Proof of Collectors Legal Authority : o Documentation demonstrates that your agency is licensed to collect debts in my state.

Cease and Desist Notice : Effective immediately
, I hereby demand that you cease all communication with me regarding this alleged debt, as permitted under 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ). This includes, but is not limited to, phone calls, emails, letters, or any other form of contact.

Furthermore, I demand that no negative information related to this disputed debt be reported to any credit reporting agency. If such information has already been reported, I request that it be removed immediately until this matter is resolved.

Failure to comply with these demands and legal obligations may result in complaints filed with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and the office of the Attorney General. 
Please send all requested documentation to my address listed above. If you are unable to provide sufficient validation, I request that you immediately cease collection activities and remove any related negative information from my credit reports. 
Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt and complete response.

Consumer complaint narrative: I purchased a home in XXXX of XXXX and sold my current home. Once my current home sold I applied the funds received toward my new mortgage in the form of a recast to lower my payment and remove the PMI. My mortgage has been sold and transferred to different servicing agencies more than once. My original loan servicer agreed to remove the PMI and lowered my payment. My loan was transferred to another servicing company and the PMI was still being taken from my escrow account. I called and they agreed to remove the PMI again and lowered my payment. I also sent a letter asking for an investigation into my account for all the hassle it took for me to have this simple process done after calling multiple times without success. They sent a letter stating they received my letter and would look into it. I received another letter asking for more time to investigate. I have been transferred multiple times and have a hard time speaking to a supervisor. I received a letter recently stating my loan was being transferred to another servicing company as of XX/XX/XXXX. I called today and was on the phone for two hours with no success on the refund to my escrow of the PMI that was taken in error. One service agent admitted she saw a note in my account that the escrow was taken in error and was going to be refunded. She said the note was from XXXX but it said that it was in process still. She told me I need to speak with the insurance department. The insurance department said I needed to speak with customer service. I was transferred to customer service and the young man would not listen to me and was talking over me. I asked for a supervisor and she did the same although I am not certain she was actually a supervisor. I asked for a call from a supervisor and she said if the dont call in the next couple days to just call back. It is extremely difficult to get a service agent on the line so this is very frustrating after two hours on the phone with no success. My loan will service will change again as of XX/XX/XXXX and I am afraid I will need to still fight with the new company. My escrow will be short from this error because they lowered the payment twice. One from the old company and one with this company but still took the PMI payments from the escrow. Most agents I talk to are rude and will not help. I ask for a supervisor and am told I will have to wait for a call and if they dont call to call again. Calling and trying to get an agent is almost impossible as the phone system does not work correctly. I am beyond frustrated at this point and need help with this issue.

I had applied for a personal loan through XXXX, which gave me an alternative funding source : AmOne. I went through their process and they sent me a list of loans I was approved for with monthly payment amounts. The APR Interest rate was 160 %, which was ridiculous because my credit may have been in the lower XXXX, but it wasn't worth being abused at 160 %. They then aggressively called me at my job and on my personal phone to discuss the approval. Once I decided on a time I could talk to them, which was today at XXXX XXXX, they quickly transferred me to a credit repair department, trying to sell me a credit repair package. I asked them what happened to my approved loan, and she said she apologized, but they didn't explain that I was being transferred to her department. But per her answer, I will have to do credit repair before they will consider a loan for me. I told her let me think about it and for her to call me the next day at XXXX XXXX. However after we hung up, I became very upset because I felt I was bamboozled by a company I had trusted to obtain a loan. I just sent her a reply email that I wasn't interested in obtaining this credit service which will cost me {$140.00}. 

I was angry because THIS WAS NEVER GIVEN TO ME VIA EMAIL OR ANY OTHER COMMUNICATIONS THEY GAVE ME. 

I felt this was a very deceptive marketing ploy. Nothing in their loan application stated anything about selling a marketing package in big bold fonts. Plus with their GOOD NEWS! HERE ARE WHAT YOU WERE APPROVED FOR marketing tactics, none were true.
Company public response: Company believes the complaint provided an opportunity to answer consumer's questions

My original dispute was filed on XX/XX/year>. And each time Ive had to refile my dispute they push the time frame of resolution back 30-45 days. 

I am attempting to prove that I did not authorize four transactions in the total amount of XXXX dollars. This is the total amount stolen from my account. I would like a provisional credit issued to my account for that amount considering my card information should have been protected by Money Network and the transactions should have been flagged for suspicious activity given the amount and the location the unauthorized transactions took place. 

Unauthorized transaction 1 : {$170.00} The XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX These transactions were NOT authorized by me. This money was stolen from me and I have not used my card physically or digitally to make any transactions in Georgia or South Carolina ever. I live and work in XXXX, Tennessee as you can see from all other transactions made on my card. 

On the day these transactions posted I was in Tennessee working. This can be proven by the deposit made by my work on the day in question and an XXXX trip taken by me in XXXX which also is reflected on my account. Please pull up my card information and refer to my card statements to see this. 
These two transactions are listed as follows : 1 : Funds transfer from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX {$150.00} 2 : XXXX Trip {$21.00} I need my money returned to me by Money Network as my card information should have been protected and these transactions should have been flagged. I have done everything I can to prove to you that I was NOT the one who made these transactions. 

I would like a provisional credit issued to me for all 4 unauthorized XXXX XXXX transactions. 3 in the amount of {$170.00} and 1 in the amount of {$140.00} for a total of {$670.00}. This is the amount that was stolen from me and the amount I would like given back to me. Thank you. 

These transactions all took place at the same time in 4 separate locations 10-12 hrs away from where I live which is not possible for me to do. Ive tried to explain this and they have offered me no support.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Information belongs to someone else
Consumer complaint narrative:
Re : Urgent Request Fraudulent Information Block under Section 605B of the FCRA To Whom It May Concern : I am writing to urgently request the removal of fraudulent accounts, inquiries, and public records from my credit report due to identity theft. This inaccurate information has caused significant harm to my credit, and I require immediate corrective action.

Under Section 605B of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ), I am invoking my right to have fraudulent information blocked and permanently removed from my credit report. The following fraudulent accounts must be removed within four ( 4 ) business days of receiving this letter : Account Name : XXXXXXXX XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Additionally, I request the removal of the following dismissed bankruptcy filings, which were the result of identity theft : Bankruptcy XXXX XXXX Dismissed Filed on : XX/XX/XXXX Reference Number : XXXX Court : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Bankruptcy XXXX XXXX Dismissed Filed on : XXXX XXXX, XXXX Reference Number : XXXX Court : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Bankruptcy XXXX XXXX Dismissed Filed on : XX/XX/XXXX Reference Number : XXXX Court : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Bankruptcy XXXX XXXX Dismissed Filed on : XX/XX/XXXX Reference Number : XXXX Court : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX In addition, I demand the removal of all unauthorized inquiries resulting from this identity theft : Creditor Name : Ally Financial Inquiry Dates : XX/XX/XXXX ; XX/XX/XXXX ; XX/XX/XXXX ; XX/XX/XXXX Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Inquiry Dates : XX/XX/XXXX ; XX/XX/XXXX ; XX/XX/XXXX ; XX/XX/XXXX ; XX/XX/XXXX Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX Creditor Name : XXXX Inquiry Date : XX/XX/XXXX Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX  Inquiry Date : XX/XX/XXXX Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Inquiry Date : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX Name : XXXX XXXX Inquiry Date : XX/XX/XXXX Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Inquiry Dates : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Failure to comply with this request will leave me no choice but to pursue legal action. If this fraudulent information is not blocked and removed, I will file complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) and seek monetary damages for the harm caused by the continued reporting of this inaccurate information. 

I also demand the immediate removal of all unauthorized inquiries related to this identity theft, which were not authorized by me and have negatively impacted my credit. If these inquiries are not promptly removed, I will escalate this matter to the appropriate legal authorities. 
I expect written confirmation within four ( 4 ) business days of this letter, confirming that the fraudulent accounts, dismissed bankruptcies, and related unauthorized inquiries have been fully removed from my credit report.

This is a time-sensitive matter, and you are now officially on notice. Failure to act promptly will result in further legal action to protect my rights and restore my credit. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this issue.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Information belongs to someone else
Consumer complaint narrative:
The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system.

So whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of my privacy with my consumer report, since I control what is listed and what is not. In the event that any accounts are reported without my written consent, that is considered identity theft.

This is a violation of both 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2. This leads way to civil liability against the credit reporting agency for negligent and willful noncompliance under 15 U.S. Code 1681n, which allows for {$1000.00} per violation, for account listed without my expressed written consent.

Based on these instructions, it is not possible to tell when a payees name has been altered. On XX/XX/2024, I received a letter from WFs Branch and XXXX XXXX XXXX Department regarding the first claim indicating we have determined the transaction posted correctly. The deletion by XXXX indicates that the account is no longer verified, and thus, under Section 607 ( b ) of the FCRA, you are required to ensure that the information you report is accurate and complete. Also Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1681.

I encourage you to take action within 30 days to remove this unverifiable account from my credit report. Failure to do so may violate the FCRA and could result in legal action. Under Section 616 of the FCRA, I have the right to seek damages if you willfully fail to comply with the law. 
Please confirm the removal of this account in writing, and let me know if you require any further information to assist in this matter. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this issue. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Consumer Laws- Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) - Section 607 ( b ) - Mandates that consumer reporting agencies must ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information they report.

- Section 616 - Provides consumers the right to sue for damages if a credit reporting agency willfully fails to comply with the FCRA. Make sure to fill in your personal information and the name and address of the credit reporting agency ( CRA ) you are addressing this letter to.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Date : XX/XX/year> To : Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) via CFPB Portal Subject : Formal Complaint Experians Failure to Address Inaccurate Payment Reporting Experian Report Number : XXXX Account : XXXX XXXX  XXXX Dear CFPB, I am filing this formal complaint to address Experians failure to conduct a reasonable investigation into inaccurate payment reporting for an account on my credit report. On XX/XX/year>, I disputed the reporting of my XXXX XXXX  account, citing incorrect payment information. Within less than 10 hours, Experian issued a response acknowledging that the account was inaccurately reported but stated that it would not be removed or corrected.

The response provided by Experian reads as follows : The incorrect account with XXXX XXXX  that starts with XXXX has not been changed and will remain on your credit report. 

This swift response strongly suggests that Experian did not conduct a thorough investigation, as required under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Specifically : 1. Failure to Conduct a Reasonable Investigation ( FCRA Section 611 ( a ) ) : Experians response timeframe raises concerns about whether XXXX XXXX  was contacted to verify the reported information.

The account has already been acknowledged as containing errors, yet Experian has refused to correct or remove the inaccuracies.

2. Failure to Correct or Delete Inaccurate Information ( FCRA Section 623 ( b ) ) : By law, credit reporting agencies must delete or correct inaccurate information if it can not be verified as accurate.

Actions Requested : I respectfully request the CFPBs assistance in ensuring Experian complies with the FCRA by : 1. Conducting a proper investigation into this accounts payment reporting errors.

2. Providing clear and verifiable documentation from XXXX XXXX to substantiate the payment history.

3. Correcting or removing the account from my credit report if it can not be verified as accurate and complete.

Supporting Documentation : A copy of Experians response ( Report Number : XXXX ). 
A copy of my credit report showing the disputed account and errors.

Desired Outcome : I request that the CFPB hold Experian accountable for its obligations under the FCRA and ensure that this matter is resolved promptly. Experians failure to address this issue impacts my creditworthiness and creates unnecessary financial hardship.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your assistance in resolving this dispute.

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt is not yours
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX FL XXXX XX/XX/XXXX To Whom It May Concern : Subject : Unauthorized Sharing of Information and UCC Violation in regards to two finding on my credit report for the amounts of {$1400.00} ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ) and {$1100.00} ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) This letter serves as formal notice regarding the unauthorized disclosure and handling of my personal information. Sharing my information with consumer reporting agencies without my explicit consent constitutes an infringement on my rights under the Privacy Act of 1974, Section 3-202. 

I have never conducted business with nor entered into any contractual agreement with LVNV FUNDING LLC. Consequently, any claim against me by this entity is without merit. Furthermore, transferring a security or obligation does not confer rights to the transferee that supersede those of the original creditor. Under Uniform Commercial Code ( UCC ) Section 3-203, the rights of enforcement are limited to the transferor and do not extend to third parties unless certain legal conditions are met : Instrument Transfer : According to UCC 3-203 ( a ), an instrument is considered transferred only when it is delivered by a party other than its issuer for enforcement purposes.

Transferee Rights : Per UCC 3-203 ( b ), the transferee acquires only the rights held by the transferor and can not attain holder-in-due-course status if fraud or illegality is involved. 

Endorsement Requirements : UCC 3-203 ( c ) specifies that a transferee must have a specifically enforceable right to the transferor 's endorsement, and negotiation is incomplete without such endorsement. 

Partial Transfers : UCC 3-203 ( d ) states that a transferee of less than the entire instrument has no enforceable rights under the UCC and holds only partial assignment rights. 

Based on the aforementioned statutes, LVNV FUNDING LLC has no legal standing to pursue or report any obligations tied to my name. I demand the immediate removal of any information related to this matter from my credit file and confirmation of this action in writing within 15 days. 

Failure to comply with this request will compel me to file complaints with the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) and other relevant authorities. Additionally, I reserve the right to pursue legal action for any damages arising from the unauthorized use of my information. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Reported phones made regarding late payments on financed auto loan since XX/XX/XXXX. Initially told, " I may have entered the incorrect account information '' when using the finance company website. I checked and re-checked, and there were no errors found. Another payment was made in XXXX, and it was rejected with a letter stating that my " financial institute was unable to process a payment of {$940.00} '' on XX/XX/XXXX. In addition to " please note that we may report information about your account to credit bureaus ''. This happened again in the month of XXXX, where I received that same written notice with the amount of {$1400.00} on XX/XX/XXXX. I was and have been in communication with this financing company. I reported to them ( Audi Fianacial Services ) that I was untrusting of their website and that payments would be submitted as a " bill pay '' from my bank. In speaking with the reported " Supervisor '', I was told I owned $ '' XXXX '', given the address ( XXXX  ) and account number which match the account number listed on their website for my account. This amount was initiated on XX/XX/XXXX, and delivered/paid on XX/XX/XXXX, via conf # XXXX through my bank as a bill pay. Since it appeared that the transactions completed without error, the action was initiated again on XX/XX/XXXX in the amount of {$1000.00} since speaking with them on XX/XX/XXXX. During this call, I confirmed with the " Supervisor '' that the calls was being recorded, and she confirmed. I asked her why my payments were previously being declined, and she stated due to " insufficient funds ''. I asked her if I could be provided with that documentation, that my bank sent ACH electronic messages stating that funds were insufficient. She stated that I would need a " subpoena ''. I asked why I would need a court order for my own account information. She stated, something like, " that is our process ''. I called me bank and reported that issue to them and they reported that there were no records of " Audi Financial '' initiated electronic payment request to my account. She asked if I had documentation, and I told her what I was told. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I logged into my account to check the XX/XX/XXXX payment status and found that the check mailed by my bank, was returned on XX/XX/XXXX with an electronic request to confirm the account number. No changes were made to the " bill pay '' account set-up with my bank so, it is unclear why the account would need to be confirmed. Again, I double checked and captured screen shots of the account information. I then set-up another " bill pay '' with another bank account I have where, and electronic ACH message is scheduled to pay today. I double checked that website, and it appears to be correct. At each instant of a failed payment, there is an unlisted " returned fee '' being incurred on my account and a notice of credit bureau reporting, though I am making payments repeatedly with the documented account information. I'm overwhelmed and exhausted with the calls, threats, and rejections of my payments. I am consumed by the fear of fraud and late fees.

Please respond to this dispute in writing within the legally mandated timeframe. I expect written confirmation of any changes made to my credit file. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute the inaccurate and misleading information contained in my credit report, as well as to address your companys failure to comply with federal consumer protection laws. This dispute is in direct reference to the recent enforcement action taken by the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) against Experian for engaging in sham investigations and failing to properly address consumer disputes.

It is unacceptable that Experian, as one of the largest credit reporting agencies, continues to violate the rights of consumers under federal law. I demand that you immediately investigate and correct the inaccuracies in my credit report and provide a detailed explanation of your findings. Failure to do so will result in further action, including filing a complaint with the CFPB and pursuing legal remedies.

Below, I cite three key federal laws under **15 U.S.C . ** that Experian is legally obligated to comply with : 1. **15 U.S.C. 1681c Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), Section 605** This section mandates that outdated and inaccurate information must not be included in consumer credit reports. Experians failure to remove or correct such information violates this provision and harms my creditworthiness.

2. **15 U.S.C. 1681e Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), Section 607** This section requires credit reporting agencies to follow reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information in consumer reports. Experians sham investigations and failure to properly address disputes demonstrate a blatant disregard for this legal obligation.

3. **15 U.S.C. 1681i Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), Section 611** This section requires credit reporting agencies to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation of disputed information within 30 days of receiving a dispute. Experians pattern of conducting inadequate or sham investigations, as highlighted by the CFPBs enforcement action, is a clear violation of this law.

I demand that Experian : 1. Conduct a thorough and lawful reinvestigation of all disputed items on my credit report.

2. Provide me with written confirmation of the results of the reinvestigation, including any corrections made.

3. Remove any inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable information from my credit report.

4. Cease any practices that violate federal consumer protection laws, including sham investigations.

If Experian fails to comply with these demands within 30 days of receiving this, I will have no choice but to escalate this matter by pursuing legal action under the FCRA. I will also seek damages for any harm caused to my creditworthiness and financial well-being as a result of Experians negligence and noncompliance.

This letter serves as a formal notice of my dispute and a demand for immediate action. I expect Experian to uphold its legal obligations and protect my rights as a consumer. 

Accounts to re investigate are in the attachments ( credit report )

The continuous monthly reporting of this charge-off misrepresents my payment history and negatively impacts my credit score. Furthermore, the statute of limitations for reporting a charge-off is seven years from the date of the initial delinquency that led to the charge-off ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ( 4 ) ). Repeatedly reporting this charge-off as a new event each month does not reflect the statute of limitations and is therefore improper. Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative: According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act 15 USC 1681 section 602 a states " There is a need to ensure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy. '' XXXX, XXXX, and Experian are consumer reporting agencies and I am the Consumer. These agencies have failed to do so. I have the right to make sure my private information isn't shared which is backed by 15 USC 6801 which states " It is the policy of the Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic personal information. '' ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) is a financial institution by definition under that title. 15 USC 1681 section 604 a section 2 states that " In general Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. '' ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) the financial institution and the Consumer reporting agencies XXXX and XXXX do not have my consent to furnish this information and they surely do not have my written consent. Any and all consent to XXXX, XXXX, ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) whether it be verbal, non-verbal, written, implied or otherwise is revoked. 15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ) states that " A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option. '' ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) Never informed me of my right to exercise my nondisclosure option. Not only that 15 USC 1681C ( a ) ( 5 ) states '' Except as authorized under subsection ( b ), no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. '' This account is an adverse item they are reporting again without my permission which is against the law. 15 U.S. Code 1681s2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A states " A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. 15 U.S. Code 1681e states '' Every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681c of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681b of this title. XXXX and XXXX are not maintaining reasonable procedures. Also 12 CFR 1016.7 states that " A consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time. ''

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account information incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a formal complaint against XXXX. XXXX for reporting inaccurate information on my credit reports. Specifically, they have reported missed payments, late payments, and an incorrect balance owed. The balance reported is significantly higher than what I actually owe, and I have never made a late payment on this account. Despite my efforts to dispute and correct this information, it remains inaccurate, which is damaging my credit profile and violating federal law. 

Details of the Issue : Incorrect Balance Owed : The balance listed on my credit report is {$170000.00}, which is incorrect. The true amount I owe is significantly less than this amount. The reported balance does not reflect the accurate debt. 
Inaccurate Reporting of Payments : The account history shows missed payments and late payments, which are completely inaccurate. I have never missed a payment or made a late payment for this account. I have consistently paid on time, and this misrepresentation is harming my credit score. 
Failure to Correct Discrepancies : I have already disputed these issues with the credit reporting agencies, but the information has not been updated or corrected by XXXX. XXXX, and the inaccuracies remain on my credit report. 
Violations : Failure to Report Accurate Information : XXXX. XXXX is in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) by reporting inaccurate account details, including the balance owed and payment history. 
Damage to Credit : The incorrect reporting of missed and late payments, as well as the inflated balance, is negatively impacting my credit score and making it more difficult for me to manage my financial affairs. 
Failure to Correct Disputes : Despite my efforts to dispute the inaccurate information, XXXX. XXXX has failed to correct the errors or provide adequate validation of the reported debt, violating my rights under the FCRA. 
Request for Action : I respectfully request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigate the following : The inaccuracies in the balance owed and payment history reported by XXXX. XXXX. 
The failure of XXXX. XXXX to correct the disputed information after being notified of the errors. 
The violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), particularly the requirement to report accurate and complete information. 
Appropriate action to ensure that XXXX. XXXX updates the account information to reflect the correct balance owed and accurate payment history. 
I have supporting documentation available, including credit reports showing the discrepancies, proof of payments, and any dispute correspondence. Please let me know if you require additional information to assist with your investigation. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to a resolution.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account information incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute the accuracy of several accounts on my credit report, as reported by creditors or collection agencies. These inaccuracies are damaging my credit profile, and I request a thorough investigation under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681i. Furthermore, I urge you to ensure that the reporting complies with METRO 2 standards as set forth by the Consumer Data Industry Association ( CDIA ). 

Accounts in Dispute XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX XXXX XXXX Issue : Incorrect reporting of charge-off and inaccurate balance of {$730.00}. 
Discrepancy : The Date of First Delinquency ( DOFD ) is not established, potentially causing incorrect reporting duration. 
XXXX Account Number : [ XXXX XXXX XXXX  ] Issue : The Charge-off was reported incorrectly as {$770.00} without proper substantiation. 
Discrepancy : XXXX XXXX and unclear balance calculation, including fees and interest rates. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX Account XXXX : XXXX Issue : Charge-off reported with a balance of {$11000.00}. 
Discrepancy : The account status and reporting of payments do not comply with FCRA requirements. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ) Account Number : [ XXXX XXXX XXXX  ] Issue : Late payments and charge-offs were reported inaccurately. 
Discrepancy : Payment history does not align with the original creditors documentation. 
Specific METRO 2 Concerns Under METRO 2 guidelines, all data furnishers must ensure the accuracy of the following : Base Segment Field 25 ( Date of First Delinquency ) : Accurate DOFD is required to determine the appropriate reporting period.

Field Code 19 ( Payment Rating ) : Must accurately reflect the payment performance at the time of reporting.

Field Code 21 ( Special Comments ) : Must include any clarifications if the account was impacted by extraordinary circumstances, such as disputes or errors.

Compliance Condition Codes ( CCC ) : Ensure proper coding for disputes, charge-offs, and late payments to avoid misleading reporting.

We used the treasurys check verification system website at XXXX XXXX XXXX to verify it before depositing it. ) Ally placed a 5 business day hold on the check, even though their terms and conditions state treasury checks are available on the next business day. The hold reason states the following : There is inconsistent information on the check you submitted. I called in and asked what information is inconsistent on the check. They told me they couldnt tell me. Later, a different associate told me the check image isnt clear. ( That is not true. I can see all the check identifying information in the image in my checking account. ) I asked if I could send a clearer image. They said no. Two other associates told me that Ally places a 5 business day hold on ALL treasury checks as a general fraud prevention measure. One of those associates told me that even if I mailed the check in ( to an address in Pennsylvania ), the 5 business day hold would be placed. I asked if someone could go to the treasurys website and verify the check so the hold could be released. They said no. I escalated to the highest level I could- in all cases, I was told there is nothing we can do except wait the 5 business days for the hold to removed. ( My husband and I have banked with Ally since XXXX. We regularly receive direct deposits, our account is not and has not been overdrawn, this check has not been returned unpaid, the check was not over the large check threshold, and weve had no issues with our account until now. ) Ally is an online bank. It has no branches and does not accept deposits via ATM so there is no way for me to deposit the check in person. Ally is placing 5-day holds on treasury checks in bad faith whether they doubt the collectability of the checks or not. ( There are many complaints just like mine on the CFPBs website and on XXXX. ) This practice is unethical and goes completely against the XXXX  of XXXX. CC funds availability requirements for government checks. In my case, Ally has no reason to doubt the collectability of the check when there is no indication the check wont be paid and when they can easily go to the treasurys website to confirm this is a real check. Ally is actively harming its customers by preventing them from accessing their funds in a timely manner and is deceiving its customers by stating treasury checks are available on the next business day when their practice is to hold them for five business days.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Regarding Inaccurate Late Payments on Credit Report Complaint Details : I am submitting this complaint regarding inaccurate late payments that are reported on my credit file maintained by Experian. I believe these late payments are erroneous and do not accurately reflect my payment history. 

Account name : XXXX XXXX Account number XXXX Nature of the Complaint : 1. Inaccurate Reporting : The late payments listed on my credit report are inaccurate. I have consistently made my payments on time, as I have been enrolled in autopay for all my accounts.

2. Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : The inaccurate reporting of these late payments violates my rights under the FC

RA ( 15 USC 1666 ( b ) ), as they misrepresent my creditworthiness. 3. Potential Violation of Fair Debt Collections Practices Act ( FDCPA ) : The r
eporting of false late payments may also constitute a violation of the FDCPA, which protects consumers from misrepresentation regarding their accounts.

4. Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) : I assert that the reporting practices violate the TILA, which mandates accurate reporting of credit information.

Additionally, the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically sections 15 U.S. Code 1681i and 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2, mandates that credit reporting agencies and information furnishers correct any inaccurate or incomplete information in credit reports and ensure the maximum accuracy of information contained in consumer files.

Furthermore, under the FCRA, articles 616 and 617 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681n and 1681o ) outline the civil liability for willful and negligent noncompliance, respectively. These provisions provide for damages, including actual damages, attorneys fees, and possible punitive damages, for failure to comply with the Act 's requirements.

Requested Resolution : I request that Experian conduct a thorough investigation into this matter and remove the inaccurate late payments from my credit report. I ask that all such entries be updated to reflect my true payment history of 100 % on-time payments.

I expect to receive written documentation confirming the removal of these entries within 30 days of this complaint submission. Failure to resolve this issue may lead to further action to protect my rights as a consumer. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

The promotion offers are as follows : 1 ) 0 % APR for 15 months ( expires XX/XX/XXXX ) 2 ) Earn additional 1.5 % on all purchases up to 20K spent in 1st year.

3 ) Earn a {$200.00} bonus after spending {$500.00} in the first 3 months from account opening. 
4 ) {$0.00} annual fee XX/XX/XXXX Received credit card in the mail. 
XX/XX/XXXX Called Customer Service to verify the promotion offers as listed above and which the representative confirmed. 

All promotional offers EXCEPT for item # XXXX were honored. Was told that it would take 6-8 weeks for it to be reflected on statement. 

XX/XX/XXXX Called Customer Service due to non receipt of {$200.00} bonus. Was instructed to send a " secure message '' via Chase.com 's website with a screenshot of the promotion offer ( to which I complied ). 

XX/XX/XXXX Secure message received stated the offer is not available and the current offer is higher than what I requested. ( Screenshot was supplied, do not understand this response. ) XX/XX/XXXX Secure message in reply to my contesting the message of XX/XX/XXXX, stated that because the screenshot did not have my name on it, it wasn't valid. 
( This promotional offer is still on the Chase.com website to this very day, it is not addressed individually. ) XX/XX/XXXX Secure message in reply to the absurdity of XX/XX/XXXX message stated I was not eligible. 

XX/XX/XXXX Called Customer Service to pursue this matter. Told it would be forwarded to the Escalation Dept., given conf # XXXX, and should hear within 7-10 business days. No followup received. 

XX/XX/XXXX Sent email to XXXX XXXX, CEO of Chase Credit card services regarding this matter. Submitted a 2nd email on XX/XX/XXXX due to no response. 

XX/XX/XXXX Received a phone call from XXXX of the Chase Executive Office who would handle this case. 
She provided her telephone number and extension. 

XX/XX/XXXX Received a secure email from the Executive office information that the offer was no longer available and they would not honor it. 

Please pursue this matter. As stated, this very promotional offer appears on Chase.com today. They refuse to honor it. Have read XXXX posts regarding other consumers having the same problem with Chase.

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Frequent or repeated calls
Consumer complaint narrative: Medicredit calls me almost weekly. I have spoken to them every single time. They told me I owe {$45.00} for a doctor I had 100 % coverage with, and told them as long as the office billed it correctly, I shouldnt owe anything. I asked for a breakdown of charges and they couldnt give them to me, in fact, they gave me incorrect info and said its because the doctors out of network. Thats not true ; I went to this doctor several times. Its a copay amount that they didnt charge me at the visit because I always had 100 % coverageso someone billed something incorrectly after the fact. I have told medicredit this several times and told them I have to go now call an old insurance company, and my old doctors office who is in a state I dont live in anymore and havent for a long time. They called me again tonight, after I told the last representative the week or so prior, that I need time to look into this. The guy who called me prior to her, called around thanksgiving when I wasnt even home. I told him the same thing, and I told him I dont want anymore repeated calls, and I will contact them when I have more information. I also told him it wont be that week because of holidays. And I told him I may not even be this month that I get an answer. When they called me again tonight, I missed it and called them right back. The first woman hung up on me while I was providing my name and DOB. The second woman said its policy to keep calling people even if they have already spoken with them. She said she would add me to the do not call list, but Ive expressed more than once now that I dont want anymore repeated calls. Im busy! I am working on it! I am not going to pay a copay that I know wasnt supposed to be charged to begin with! I am taking my personal time to deal with this and I no longer live in that state, no longer go to that doctor, and no longer have that insurance. So I have to literally chase down something from almost 2 years ago.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Credit inquiries on your report that you don't recognize
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Sir or Madam, I am writing to formally request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) assist in removing hard inquiries from my credit report under the guidelines set forth by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and related regulations. I have recently reviewed my credit report and identified several hard inquiries that I believe were made in violation of my rights, and I seek your intervention in addressing these issues. The following items I would like to have removed : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX According to the FCRA ( Section 604 ), a credit inquiry is considered " hard '' when it is made as a result of a credit application, loan request, or any other action that may impact my credit score. Under the FCRA, these inquiries should only be recorded if I have authorized them. Unfortunately, I believe some of the inquiries on my credit report were made without my explicit permission or were based on incomplete or inaccurate information. 

In particular, I would like to highlight the following reasons for my request : Lack of Authorization : There are hard inquiries on my credit report that I do not recall authorizing. If these inquiries were made without my consent, they violate my rights under the FCRA. 

Inaccurate Reporting : Some of the inquiries on my credit report may be inaccurate, as I did not apply for credit with the entities listed, or the inquiries may have been made in error. As per CFPB regulations, credit reporting agencies are required to ensure the accuracy of information contained within credit reports ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ).

Time Frame for Removal : Hard inquiries must be removed from a credit report after two years, but the inquiry may no longer be relevant to my credit score after the first year. I request that any outdated inquiries be removed as per CFPB regulations for data accuracy and fairness. 

Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I understand that I have the right to dispute any inaccuracies on my credit report directly with the credit bureaus. However, due to the circumstances surrounding these inquiries and the fact that they are affecting my creditworthiness, I request that you investigate this matter thoroughly and remove any unauthorized or incorrect hard inquiries from my report in accordance with federal law. 

Please let me know if additional documentation or information is needed to support my request. I would greatly appreciate your prompt attention to this matter and look forward to your response. Thank you for your time and consideration.

To Whom It May Concern, I am submitting this complaint regarding the sudden and unexplained closure of my business accounts with U.S. Bank. I have been a loyal customer for five years, operating a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX with multiple accounts under the bank. 

Recently, without any prior notice or explanation, all XXXX of my business accounts were abruptly closed. Despite numerous attempts to obtain information, I have been met with vague responses, with representatives stating they have no clue or no idea what happened. 

As a result of these closures : My payroll was delayed, severely impacting my employees. 
U.S. Bank has not sent me a check for the remaining account balance, which is close to {$50000.00}. 
I have received no clear explanation, and no one at the bank seems to take responsibility for the situation. 

This treatment is extremely unfair and demonstrates a complete disregard for consumer rights and business operations. The lack of transparency and failure to release my funds in a timely manner has put my business in a severe financial bind. 

I request immediate action from the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) to : 1. Investigate U.S. Banks practices regarding account closures without notice or explanation.

2. Ensure the immediate release of my funds. 
3. Hold the bank accountable for any damages caused by their failure to properly communicate or act in good faith. 

I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter and look forward to your response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account status incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, OK XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Universal Acceptance XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, MN XXXX Re : Cease and Desist Demand Under 15 USC 16 1692d and 1692c To Whom It May Concern, I, XXXX XXXX XXXX, residing at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Ok XXXX am writing to formally demand that Universal Acceptance immediately cease and desist all communications with me, as permitted under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCRA ), 15 USC 1692 et seq.

Background : This account has been paid but still reporting negatively on my report. I have received multiple communications from your company regarding an alleged debt. These communications have caused me significant distress and inconvenience when it has already been handled.

Legal Basic : Under 15 USC 1692d, debt collectors are prohibited from engaging in conduct that harasses, oppresses, or abuses any person in connection with the collection of a debt. Additionally, 15 USC 1692c ( c ) stipulates that upon receiving a written request from a consumer to cease further communication, a debt collector must honor that request.

Demand : I hereby demand that Universal Acceptance : 1. Immediately cease all communication with me for this account has been handled, including but not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, or any other form of contact.

2. Provide written confirmation within 30days of receipt of this letter that all communications have ceased only Please be advised that failure to comply with this demand may result in legal action, including but not limited to filing a complaint with the Oklahoma Attorney General 's Office, as well as pursing a private lawsuit for violations of the FDCPA. 

This letter is written without prejudice to any rights or remedies I may have under applicable law. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX last 4 of social security XXXX Date of Birth : XX/XX/XXXX cc Consumer Financial Protection Bureau Oklahoma Attorney General XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Marcus by Goldman Sachs ( Marcus ) has declined to recognize me as my XXXX parents Attorney-in-Fact on their savings accounts. Despite my repeated efforts since XX/XX/year> to submit the necessary documentation, I have encountered numerous challenges that have prevented the successful recognition of my authority and have hindered my ability to access the funds necessary to pay for their care. 
Between XXXX and XX/XX/year>, I made multiple attempts to submit the required supporting documents for Marcus to recognize me as my elderly parents Attorney-in-Fact. Two separate mailings were sent in XXXX and in XXXX to the address provided on the forms downloaded from the Marcus website ; however, these were returned as undeliverable in XXXX. In XXXX, I contacted customer service to report the death of my step-father and submitted a copy of the death certificate. 
After following up with customer service regarding the status of my request in XXXX, I was advised to resubmit the necessary documents, including an original or certified copy ( with a certified stamp ) of the XXXX of Attorney form. I was unable to send the original copy ( as I needed to retain it for other purposes ), I sought a notary to certify a copy of the document. I was subsequently advised that notaries do not provide certified stamps on copies, and instead arranged for the notary to stamp an Oath of Verification and Affirmation form to verify the authenticity of the document. 
In XXXX, I followed up with customer service and was informed that the packet had been received, but it was missing a stamp on the Oath of Verification and Affirmation form ( although the one I sent included a stamp ). I was advised that if the form were resent with the correct stamp, the packet would be approved by the documents review team. A fourth packet was sent in XXXX, and in an XXXX follow-up call, I was notified that the packet had been declined for all ten of my parents accounts due to a missing digit in the number of a single account.

Subsequent to this, I requested that my attorney take over the process of securing my recognition as the power of attorney. She resubmitted the required documents, which were received by Marcus, but she later received a voicemail indicating that they could not communicate with her without a notarized statement authorizing consent to do so. I provided my attorney this consent document which she has since submitted.
