He called me back at approximately XXXX to inquire if I was able to log onto my online banking account as I had difficulty given I don't use this feature. He provided me with 10-digit reference code submitted via text at number XXXX at approximately XXXX ( please refer to attachment PNC Bank XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Code : XXXX ). In doing so, {$1000.00} was transferred to a " XXXX XXXX. '' The XXXX XXXX is shown as complete. He proceeded in telling me that I needed to transfer the {$1500.00} but could not do so when it had exceeded the limit and the transactions of {$420.00} left in my checking account had failed as I had reached the limit ( please refer to the attachment of XXXX activity ). 

While in route to my bank at the branch addressed mentioned above I realized this was a fraudster/scammer as I tried to call the number back which is indeed a accurate number given it is inputted in my contacts when I do in fact call PNC Bank ( please refer to the attachment of call log activity of when the scammer called-approximately time XXXX length of call XXXX minutes and XXXX seconds ). 

At approximately XXXX I met with XXXX XXXX XXXX Branch Banker ) XXXX  ID XXXX ) Number : XXXX at PNC Bank located at XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX PA XXXX ( please refer to her business card as attached ). I advised her of the aforementioned and also sent her an email ( please refer to email to XXXX XXXX attached ) of the text message of the 10-digit confirmation number. XXXX XXXX along with another banker reported that other PNC Bank consumers were negatively affected by this XXXX scam. XXXX XXXX had worked to close out my original debit card and provided me with a new card and pin number. She advised me to log into my online banking account and change my password which I complied. She insisted that she could not stop the {$1000.00} transaction as it had not posted to my account which I did not understand given I had immediately warned the financial institution while the transaction was still pending. I thought being proactive opposed to reactive would remedy the situation along with having to work to change my debit card information. 

XXXX XXXX insisted that I contact the bank tomorrow morning Saturday XX/XX/XXXX at the number on the back of my card the same number where all this fraudulent activity began XXXX to inquire if the transaction had posted in order to dispute it. I really did not feel comfortable, was uneasy, and untrusting. With {$1000.00} being removed from my account I needed answers immediately. So I contacted the number the same day XX/XX/XXXX after meeting with XXXX XXXX twice once at XXXX length of call XXXX minutes and XXXX seconds ( see attached call log activity ) spoke with XXXX representative and called again at approximately XXXX and XXXX and spoke with XXXX XXXX for approximately XXXX minutes. XXXX kindly advised me the same as XXXX XXXX stated prior. XXXX XXXX stated that she was notating this matter as fraud and to reach out tomorrow morning to dispute the transaction once posted. I contacted XXXX directly at XXXX at approximately XXXX today for a duration of XXXX minutes and XXXX seconds ( see attached call log ). XXXX stated that they could not assist as the matter needed to be resolved with PNC Bank directly. 

I have never been involved any fraudulent behavior as such. I thought me being proactive opposed to reactive would have allowed PNC to stop payment to prevent having to file a dispute or funds to be transferred. I have to put my faith in the hands of others to hopefully pray that all of my funds can be recovered. It should be noted that I filed a complaint with the Federal Trade Commission ( please refer to attachment ) for this matter. Please help me and thank you for your time and attention to this matter. 

Respectfully, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative: Experian has failed to fulfill its legal obligation under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation of disputed information on my credit report, leaving inaccurate or unverifiable accounts unresolved. The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) has recently filed a lawsuit against Experian, alleging systemic issues such as failing to forward consumer-provided evidence to furnishers, accepting unreliable responses, and failing to adequately notify consumers of dispute outcomes. These failures align with my experience, where Experian has neither corrected nor removed disputed items despite the evidence I provided, causing ongoing harm to my credit standing. I am requesting immediate corrective action to remove or amend the disputed accounts, as Experian 's inaction violates federal law and my rights as a consumer.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account information incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
" The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system. 

So whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of TILA US Code 1666B since I was never late. 

I recently reviewed my consumer report and noticed an incorrect late payment record on my XXXX Bank account [ XXXX ]. I have always maintained timely payments on this account. Under the Fair Credit Billing Act ( FCBA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), creditors are required to accurately report consumer transactions and provide a mechanism for correcting errors in a timely manner. Please conduct an investigation into this matter, and if you can not provide documentary evidence of these supposed late payments, I demand these payments to be updated to on time as they should be as I was NEVER late. I expect these updates to be made promptly, in compliance with the law. 
"

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/2022, I applied for the XXXX  XXXX program. I am in an active bankruptcy. 

Definition of XXXX : PROGRAM OVERVIEW : Up to {$75000.00} per household for expenses which may include : Mortgage reinstatementEscrow shortagesDelinquent property taxes and XXXX dues/feesMunicipal or property tax liensMortgage payments, including principal, interest, taxes, and homeowners insurance XX/XX/2022 : Mr. Cooper received a letter from XXXX asking if Mr. Cooper would accept funds from the XXXX XXXX XXXX Mr. Cooper has verbally confirmed & documented they accidentally sent a letter to XXXX objecting to receive funds which would allow me the benefit & right to participate in the XXXX  XXXX program. 

XX/XX/XXXX, Mr. Cooper 's bankruptcy 's dept rep specificly told me they do not object to receiving fund from the XXXX program or any HAF programs and asked me to obtain a letter from my bankruptcy attorney agreeing to their participation of the XXXX program, to support Mr. Cooper 's acceptance of the XXXX program. Mr. Cooper promised to correct their error by sending a letter to XXXX specificly stating that they " did not '' object to the XXXX program and will participate with receiving funds. 

I regularly sent emails and follow up calls during ( XXXX XXXX ) to ensure that Mr. Cooper made good on their promise to remediate their error. Unfortunately I was disappointed to know that the specific letter Mr. Cooper promised to send was never sent to XXXX and XXXX stated that as of XX/XX/XXXX, I was denied the XXXX program because Mr. Cooper failed to send XXXX the coorespondance to overturn the objection that was inadvertently was sent error, as promised to me. ( recorded calls are available ) As of today Mr. Cooper has stated that they are trying to remediate the problem they created in XXXX and that I am now to contact XXXX not Mr. Cooper for status on the XXXX status. 

Mr. Cooper 's negligence, admitted error, failure to resolve timely ( timeline XXXX - XXXX ), and significant impact to jeopardizing my receipt of state assistance during my hardship is unacceptable, I also believe their actions maybe discriminatory and the process has been extremely exhausting and stressful for me and my family. 

I am requesting an investigation of Mr. Cooper 's actions and remediation with a desired outcome to compensate me the amount of funds I would receive from the XXXX program as described in the " XXXX XXXX XXXX '' as listed above. 

I must state that I have spoken with over 10 representatives over the past 5 months from Mr. Cooper all on recorded lines and have also sent written correspondence. All have confirmation that Mr. Cooper never objected to my participation in the XXXX program and they would resolve within 7 days. 

Everytime I would ask a rep when would the letter confirming Mr. Cooper 's participation/acceptance would be sent to XXXX, to resolve Mr. Cooper 's error the response was always " a letter will be sent within 7 days. '' I have been told that a letter will be sent within 7 days since XX/XX/XXXX. I have diligently followed with Mr. Cooper and XXXX up every 2 weeks since then. I am now being told to just wait and follow up with NJFMA with questions regarding the XXXX decision. This is unfair because the XXXX decision is based on the service 's response. 

How can this be when the error was with Mr. Cooper. More importantly I am very concerned that I am in jeopardy of loosing my XXXX XXXX and Mr. Cooper is demonstrating unfair Mortgage practice. 

Your assistance would be greatly appreciated. 

XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports

Consumer complaint narrative:
My personal and financial information was compromised without my authorization. My personal educational records were accessed and shared without my express written or verbal permission in violation of the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act ( FERPA ). I have filed a formal complaint with FERPA directly. I urgently request that you investigate this happenstance. The Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act ( FERPA ) protects the confidentiality of student records. This breach is a clear violation of FERPA and it is their responsibility to safeguard my information. 

My personal education records, including but not limited to Social Security Number, payment records, bank account information, bank payment records, and Federal Student Aid account details and records were accessed without my express permission by members of the Department of Government Efficiency beginning on XX/XX/XXXX. This information is included in my personal education records. My records were made available to employees/contractors/members of the Department of Government Efficiency ( DOGE ) commission without my written or verbal express permission. I became aware of the disclosure on XX/XX/XXXX, the date on which the information was made available, through newspaper articles via the media. I have had no communication, verbal, written, or otherwise, with any members of the Department of Government Efficiency ( DOGE ). I have not been properly notified or officially communicated with by any members of DOGE in any capacity. I believe that this improper disclosure of my personal information is a violation of the Federal Privacy Act of 1974. 

The following article titled " Inside DOGE 's takeover of the Education Department '', posted on XX/XX/XXXX and published by XXXX XXXX XXXX the access that the DOGE team was granted regarding files within the Department of Education. This article was written by XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX. The article details specific members of DOGE who have been granted access within the Department of Education 's email system, and provides additional details regarding XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX access to the back-end systems of the ed.gov website on XX/XX/XXXX. The article specifies that sensitive personal and financial data from the Department of Education is being fed into artificial intelligence software by the DOGE commission. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt is not yours
Consumer complaint narrative:
DEBT VALIDATION LETTER XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX NY, XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX NJ XXXX Date : XX/XX/XXXX To Whom it May Concern : This letter is being sent to you in response to a notice sent to me on XX/XX/XXXX regarding account #. XXXX Be advised this is not a refusal to pay, but a notice sent pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, 15 USC 1692g stating your claim is disputed and validation is requested. 

This is not a request for verification or proof of my mailing address, but a request for VALIDATION made pursuant to the above-named Title and Section. I respectfully request your offices provide me with evidence that I have any legal obligation to pay you, including the following documentation : 1. Agreement with the creditor that authorizes you to collect on this alleged debt ; 2. The agreement bearing my signature stating that I have agreed to assume the debt ; 3. Valid copies of the debt agreement stating the amount of the debt and interest charges ; 4. Proof that the Statute of Limitations has not expired ; 5. Complete payment history on this account along with an accounting of all additional charges being assessed ; 6. Proof that you are licensed to collect in my state ; and 7. Your license numbers and Registered Agent. 
At this time, I will also inform you that if your offices have reported invalidated information to any of the 3 major credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX, or XXXX ) this action may constitute fraud under both Federal and State Laws. Due to this fact, if any negative mark is found on any of my credit reports by your company or the company that you represent, I will not hesitate in bringing legal action against you and your client for the following : Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, Violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, and Defamation of Character. 

If your office fails to reply to this debt validation letter within thirty ( 30 ) days from the date of your receipt, all instances related to this account must be immediately deleted and completely removed from my credit file. Moreover, all future attempts to collect on the said debt must be ceased. 

Your non-compliance with my request will also be construed as an absolute waiver of all claims to enforce the debt against me and your implied agreement to compensate me for court costs and attorney fees if I am forced to bring this matter before a judge. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX ( Debtor Signature ) XXXX XXXX ( Debtor Printed Name )

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Was not notified of investigation status or results
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year>, I sent a formal dispute letter to Experian to address inaccurate items on my credit report. Along with this letter, I provided comprehensive documentation to verify my identity, including a copy of my photo ID, Social Security card, and a recent bank statement with my current address. 
In my dispute, I explicitly requested specific information regarding the verification process : -Details on how the disputed item was verified. 
-The date when Experian contacted the creditor and furnisher. 
-Contact information for the creditor and furnisher. 
-The name of the individual who verified the item. 
-The method of communication used to verify the disputed information ( e.g., phone, email, mail ). 
-Confirmation on whether the creditor and furnisher provided any sensitive personal information, such as my Social Security Number, address, and date of birth during the verification process. 
On XX/XX/year>, I received a response from Experian with the following statement : " We received a recent request regarding your credit information that does not appear to have been sent directly by you or to be authorized by you. As a precautionary measure, we have not taken any action on your alleged request. '' This response is completely unacceptable and appears to be a blatant violation of my consumer rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). The FCRA clearly requires Experian to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation of any disputed items in a consumers file. There is no ambiguity in this requirement ; Experian 's refusal to investigate my dispute, despite receiving sufficient verification documents and a clear request, represents a failure to meet its statutory obligation.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
RE : Dispute of Inaccurate Information on Credit Report Dear EXPERIAN I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate information listed on my credit report, specifically regarding the following account : - **Account Name** : XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX **Account Number**XXXX Under **15 U.S. Code 1681**, also known as the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), you are mandated to ensure the accuracy, completeness, and verifiability of the information reported on consumer credit reports. In accordance with this law, I request that you conduct a thorough investigation into the account listed above. 

As per the FCRA, if the information can not be verified as accurate within a timely manner, you are required to remove it from my credit report. Therefore, I am requesting that you take action to remove this inaccurate entry **within 4 days** of receiving this letter. 

To assist you in your investigation, I have enclosed the following documents to verify my identity and address : 1. A copy of my Social Security card 2. A copy of my government-issued ID 3. Proof of address ( utility bill ) 4. A copy of my credit report with the accounts in question highlighted I expect to receive a written response from you regarding the results of your investigation within **30 days**, as stipulated by the FCRA. Should you find that the information is indeed inaccurate, please ensure its prompt removal from my report. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your swift response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX UCC 1-308 All Rights Reserved

2. Opt-Out of Information Sharing : I do not consent to the disclosure of my personal or financial information to credit bureaus, reporting agencies, or other third parties. 
Supporting Documentation For your review, I have previously submitted the following : A copy of my driver license A recent utility bill to verify my identity If additional documentation or clarification is needed, please contact me at XXXX or via email at XXXX. 
I understand that you may need additional time to process my request and review the necessary details. However, I kindly request that you prioritize this matter and provide a detailed update or resolution within the stated 60-day timeframe. 
Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to receiving your final response. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Information is missing that should be on the report
Consumer complaint narrative:
Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, ZIP Code : XXXX, Ga XXXX : XXXX Phone : XXXX Date : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX Dispute Department XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, TX XXXX XXXX Dispute Department XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX XXXX Dispute Department XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, PA XXXX Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Information on Credit Report To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally dispute an inaccuracy on my credit reports issued by XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX. Upon reviewing my reports, I noticed a significant error related to my CBNA account ( Account Number XXXX ). 
Specific Inaccuracy : The report states that the account was charged off with a past due amount of {$6100.00} as of XX/XX/XXXX and a balance of {$6100.00} updated as of XX/XX/XXXX. However, there is a clear inconsistency in the payment history section : 1. The payment history shows multiple charge-offs ( CO ) reported consecutively for several months in XXXX and XXXX. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), a charge-off can only be reported once and should not appear as a recurring event. Reporting a charge-off for multiple months is factually incorrect. 
2. Additionally, the payment history indicates a 30-day and 60-day late payment for XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX after the account was already reported as charged off in previous months. Once an account is charged off, it can not have additional late payments reported. This is a clear violation of accurate reporting standards under the FCRA. 
Requested Actions : 1. Reinvestigate this account information with CBNA to verify its accuracy.

2. Correct the status of the account by removing the repeated charge-off entries and the inaccurate late payments if they are indeed errors, or provide supporting documentation validating the reported information.

3. Update my credit reports accordingly and send me corrected copies. 
Please consider this letter as a formal dispute under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). I have attached a copy of my credit report highlighting the inaccurate information for your reference and request that XXXX and XXXX also verify the accuracy of this account. 
I would appreciate your prompt attention to this matter and a response within 30 days of receiving this letter. Should you need any further information to complete the investigation, please contact me directly at the phone number or email listed above. 
Thank you for addressing this issue promptly. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Issue: Charged fees or interest you didn't expect
Consumer complaint narrative:
I financed a XXXX ATV for my sons birthday in XXXX. 

The purchase price was about {$1200.00}. I gave the company I purchased the ATV from a {$500.00} down payment, and financed the remainder. I set up payments to be deducted weekly by the finance company " American First Finance '' in the amount of {$39.00} until the balance was paid off, or I was under the impression that was the case. 
Every week I received notifications that my payment was successful. On XX/XX/XXXX my payoff amount was {$400.00}. On XX/XX/XXXX it went all the way up to {$990.00}. I spoke to XXXX XXXX XXXX ) and he did the typical " let me get my XXXX '' sales pitch. XXXX XXXX of the customer service reps. After 2 offers they " brought it down '' to {$630.00} for the final buyout amount. XXXX told me I " received an email '' a week prior letting me know the balance would go up. That email was never received, however I received every email about my successful payment. On XX/XX/XXXX after I wrote a bad review and threatened attorneys, they provided a " settlement offer '' of {$530.00}, valid until XX/XX/year>. 

Between XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX I had paid an additional {$310.00} weekly as the payments were still being deducted. The finance company has many other reviews from customers with similar experiences to mine.

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Attempted to collect wrong amount
Consumer complaint narrative:
account number : XXXX account balance : {$410.00} To Whom It May Concern : I am writing in reference to the collection account reported on my credit file associated with the account number mentioned above. This account is negatively impacting my credit profile, and I am exercising my rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) to request validation of this debt and to demand that you cease all communication with me regarding this matter. Pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1692g, I request that you provide the following information to validate this debt : 1. The name and address of the original creditor.

2. A copy of the signed agreement or contract that allegedly obligates me to pay this debt.

3. A complete account history, including all charges, payments, and credits applied to the alleged debt.

4. Documentation showing that you have the legal right to collect on this debt.

Until this information is provided, I demand that this collection account be removed from my credit report as reporting inaccurate or unverifiable information violates 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) and 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ). Additionally, under 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ), you are hereby notified to cease and desist all communication with me regarding this matter. Any further attempts to contact me will be considered a violation of federal law.

I expect written confirmation that this collection account has been removed from my credit report and that you have ceased all collection efforts.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX.

This late payment that is reporting is a result on a systematic error on their end processing my payment. This was clearly a billing error made my the company and is not a reflection of my payment experience which violates USC Code 1681eb. This error has caused severe hard to my reputation, my character, my mode of living and to my family! I demand the late payment reported to be removed/updated. They are not in compliance with the following law. 15 USC 1666b and its requirements set the standards and the guidance for a creditor to treat a payment as late, yet they are reporting a payment as late and they did not comply with the law! 15 USC 1666b ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered 21 days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule 1002 and It was never provided. This is unfair, illegal, fraudulent, and not equitable to me as a consumer!

I am deeply troubled by the denial of credit and the lack of proper justification provided for this decision. It is my firm belief that I am entitled to receive the necessary information and explanation regarding the denial, in accordance with the provisions of UCC 1681a and the Bill of Exchange Act. 

I urge you to promptly investigate this matter and provide me with the required documentation and details related to the credit denial. You have a period of ten days to respond and resolve this credit transaction in compliance with the relevant laws and regulations.

Furthermore, I request that you resolve this matter by promptly sending me the perks or benefits that were promised to me as part of the transaction that took place. It is imperative that you honor your commitments and fulfill the terms of the agreement made with me as a consumer.

I expect a swift and satisfactory resolution to this matter, and I trust that you will take the necessary actions to address this issue promptly. Failure to comply with the regulations outlined in UCC 1681a and the Bill of Exchange Act will result in further escalation of this matter through legal channels.

Thank you for your attention to this urgent issue, and I look forward to receiving a prompt response from you within the stipulated timeframe.

Violations of the FCRA Violation of FCRA 1681e ( b ) Failure to Maintain Maximum Possible Accuracy : Experian failed to ensure the accuracy of the information it is reporting by misclassifying an active, open account as charged off. 
Violation of FCRA 1681i Failure to Properly Investigate Disputed Information : If this reporting was previously disputed and remains unchanged, Experian is violating its obligation to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation.

Violation of FCRA 1681s-2 ( b ) Failure to Update Information After Dispute : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  ( the furnisher ) is also responsible for correcting inaccurate data once notified of a dispute. If Experian is failing to update the information despite receiving corrected data from the creditor, it is in violation of the law. 
Requested Resolution Immediate Deletion or Correction Experian must correct the XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX account status to reflect " Pays as Agreed '' with no charge-off, aligning with XXXX accurate reporting. 
Provide Investigation Results & Supporting Documents Experian should furnish a full investigation report detailing how it verified the incorrect charge-off status. 
Regulatory Action Against Experian Given the severe nature of this inaccuracy, I request that the CFPB review Experians compliance with FCRA standards and take any necessary enforcement action. 
This false charge-off status has caused severe harm to my creditworthiness, impacting my ability to obtain financing and financial stability. I request CFPB intervention to ensure compliance with the FCRA and consumer protection laws. 

I have attached copies of my XXXX and Experian reports as evidence of the discrepancy. I expect this matter to be addressed promptly, and I appreciate the CFPBs assistance in enforcing my rights under federal law. 

Sincerely,

Product: Prepaid card
Sub-issue: Trouble using the card to spend money in a store or online
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally lodge a complaint regarding the purchase and subsequent issues I have faced with three American Express eGift Cards I purchased online on XXXX XXXX XXXX. The total value of the purchase was {$1500.00}, with each card worth {$500.00}. The order number is XXXX, and the last three digits of the card numbers are # XXXX, # XXXX, and # XXXX, respectively. 

Initially, I received an email confirming the delivery of the eGift Cards, but I encountered significant difficulty in accessing the card details. Despite multiple attempts and considerable effort, including contacting your customer service by phone multiple times and waiting on hold for extended periods, I eventually managed to resolve the issue on my own. The details appeared to be restricted for security reasons. While I can appreciate the necessity of stringent security measures, the process was unnecessarily cumbersome and frustrating. 

Unfortunately, a far more serious issue emerged after obtaining the card details. When attempting to use these eGift Cards for online shopping, I discovered that many merchants declined them or expressed uncertainty regarding their validity. In several instances, transactions were outright rejected, either due to the merchants ' inability to verify my rightful ownership or for unspecified reasons. 

As a consumer, my primary motivation for purchasing these prepaid eGift Cards was to enjoy the convenience, portability, and security they are supposed to offer. However, these benefits have been completely overshadowed by the cards ' impracticality. Instead of a hassle-free payment method, these eGift Cards have become an undue burden, requiring me to expend time and effort to identify merchants who might accept them.

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Company closed your account
Consumer complaint narrative:
The complaint is with Capital One. In several instances in my dealings with them, they did not perform and violated several consumer laws. I had XXXX credit card accounts with them and I contacted them with billing concerns and formally lodged a billing dispute complaint. I sent the first letter to them on XX/XX/XXXX and then again on XX/XX/XXXX. They did not respond to either of the disputes within 30 days as the law states and made no attempts to investigate the matter. My complaints were about 15 USC 1666b and 1666d. They did not abide by these laws in how my account was handled and how they reported my activity. 

After several conversations with the various departments they sitll didnt even acknowledge the fact that I had in good faith submitted billing disputes on both of my accounts. Ultimately they wound up closing both of my accounts citing a violation of the cardholder agreement. They told me that they do not accept the form of payment I sent in. I sent them a registered security to satisfy payment and a security is a lawfull form of payment. When calling them and asking me to send them in writing that they do not accept securities ( commercial paper bonds ) as payment, they hung up on me several times. Finally, after calling back several times, they blatantly told me that they could not send me that information in writing. It was enough of a reason for them to close my accounts but they absolutely would not send me it in writing. My last communication with them was on XXXX, XXXX 2024 at around noon CST, on several recorded lines and this is where they told me they couldn't send me this information in writing. 

The reason why they would not send me the information in writing is because it backs up my stance in the disputes with them and also because they are committing securities fraud and evading paying taxes on the proceeds from those securities. They take their receivables, securitize them in a trust, and then trade them on the primary and secondary markets where they do not have to be registered for a few different reasons. First, they are a foreign limited liability company that doesn't have to register securities and secondly, they get securitized as commercial paper which also does not have to be registered, if they are not registered you can surely believe they are not paying taxes on them. This is the reason they refuse to send me the information I requested in writing. In their purchase, pooling and servicing, security and indenture agreement, it states that they do not and will not engage in any fraudulent practices when it comes to their investors and their handling of securities and then they evade obligation or liability by refusing to provide documentation when requested to an investor who feels that they are being used to commit the fraud.

Product: Student loan
Issue: Dealing with my lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Received bad information about my loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have been consistently misled and kept in the dark about the process of my repayment and deferment. I called XXXX on around XXXX XXXX XXXX, and was told that I would be out of deferment and able to begin repaying my loans, waving my rights for the grace period. Because of usurious interest rates of XXXX and other student lenders, I accepted. The period in which I was to wait to enter repayment lapsed, and I was not notified and remained unable to begin repayment, which I needed to refinance my loans. I called XXXX to be told I was not going to be taken out of deferment, but instead would need to send a letter to request to forego the grace period and deferment in order to begin repayment. In the meantime, I accrued interest at usurious rates. 

The same story happened at Discover. I called on XXXX XXXX XXXX, and was told I needed to send a letter to Discover Student Lending services to remain out of deferment because " the system fluctuates and takes people out of deferment. '' No changes on my account occurred, and I called back roughly 10 days later ( accruing well over {$100.00} in interest over that period, over {$100.00} in seven days, to be specific ). When I called to inquire about this, I was told they were waiting to take me out ( two business days after the 5 business day period I was told ) of deferment. I was told in that phone call contradictory information, i.e., that I did not need to send a letter. I called on the following Monday, and was told I did need to send a letter, and that I had n't been given false information. I was under the impression that this would be a personal letter, as the first representative stated. The representative did n't state otherwise and offered no specifics. I later called back to get specifics, only to be told to " hold '' while the representative " researched '' the policy. She returned to the phone to tell me that I needed a letter from my university requesting to forego my grace period and deferment and enter repayment. This seemed odd, given the substance of the first and second representatives ' information. I requested to speak with a supervisor, who then told me I did need to send a letter -- he later informed me of the upload feature, but only after I mentioned a lawyer. No other representative offered knowledge of an immediate upload feature. US mail would have taken additional time, and additional interest. Anyway, this supervisor told me I needed to send a personal letter -- not a letter from my university -- in order to forego grace period and deferment. I asked, " This is the fifth person I 've spoken to, and the fifth type and level of asymmetry of information I 've received. '' He said, " It 's on the website. '' I said, " Show me. '' He could n't, and after a brief hold, returned to tell me " it 's not on the website. '' I said, " Interesting. '' I then asked about the interest I 'd accrued during this week and a half run around. He misrepresented that amount, and said, " It would be 'dollars. ' '' I said, " How many 'dollars? ' '' His rejoinder : " over {$100.00}. '' I accrued over {$100.00} additional dollars in interest in " seven days, '' while they misled me and fed me false information. They did the same for four years, leading us to believe -- without any notifications -- that we would n't be accruing significant interest, burying the transparent amount over the course of years ( again, without even a courtesy call to let me know the amount I 'd accrued ). I had accrued {$30000.00} in 4 years while working toward a XXXX. 

Example of the lack of transparency in this period of interest accrual? I called in XXXX of XXXX, and in XXXX XXXX. In those six months, they raised my interest rates three times without so much as an email notification. These banks are not making it easier for students to pay them back, they 're making it harder to make more money. Otherwise, they 'd offer better counsel and more communication.

XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXXChase Bank Fraud DepartmentXXXX.XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXXChase Card # closed card XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX member since XX/XX/XXXXDear Sir or Madam : I am writing to dispute a fraudulent charge of {$5700.00} on my account, and posted on between XX/XX/XXXX-XX/XX/XXXX. Please investigate this matter and send me a written explanation of your findings and actions. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX bank states as their defense these following sentences .... 
You confirmed your husband, XXXX XXXX, wrote the check. 
You added XXXX XXXX as an authorized user on the account on XX/XX/XXXX. 
The access check was written on XX/XX/XXXX. 
XXXX XXXX was authorized to write the check. 
Their assessment that he was authorized is completely false! He was NOT authorized to write the check and he WAS NOT AN AUTHORIZED USER UNTIL AFTER IT WAS CASHED! I am a victim of financial abuse and was advised by my divorce attorney to NOT seek action UNTIL the divorce was final and I was away from him. I kept copies of everything while i was in hiding and used a po pox from then on to protect myself from him. This is NOT the only card of mine he forged, there are many and my attorney through the abuse organization I am seeking help with advised me to go this route before utilizing a professional. I repeat Chase bank states XXXX XXXX WAS " AUTHORIZED '' TO USE THIS CHECK. Who gave him authorization? He new my mothers maiden name, the strret I grew up on, my social security number, my first pet and everything he needed to have someone act as me on his behalf AFTER HE FORGED MY NAME. Forgery is a crime punishable by law! Chase bank should be an accompliss to this forgery. If he WAS AUTHORIZED USE WHY DID N'T HE SIGN HIS NAME? 
I was advised by my divorce attorney to keep making payments so that it would not affect my credit. The burden became too much since he was not paying child support I had to eventually stop paying it and worry about my credit after all of this was over. Now my part time job is repairing my credit completely ruined by this man. My credit was excellent until a few years into the marriage he starting stealing from my credit cards and my business checking account. It is your duty to protect me. I need your help!

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Unable to get your credit report or credit score
Sub-issue: Other problem getting your report or credit score
Consumer complaint narrative: Please investigate the pattern of unethical practices with Transunion and XXXXXXXX XXXX investigative processes. Both of these companies have initiated intimidation practices to prevent consumers from exercising their rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act. In response to consumers ' requesting investigation of inaccurate information on credit reports, Transunion and XXXX are blocking consumers ' credit reports and restricting consumers ' access to view their credit reports and/or investigative results. In addition, creating obstacles when consumers ' realize the report is blocked and request that it be unblocked by advising consumers ' they need to print a physical copy of their driver 's license and social security card, go to the post office, spend their own money and mail their sensitive information to the credit agency in order to have access to their own credit reports. Asking these agencies to comply with the Fair Credit Reporting Act and investigate inaccurate information appears to result in illegal, punitive action to scare consumers into not disputing inaccurate information found on Transunion and XXXX credit reports. The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) is the primary federal law that regulates credit bureaus and protects consumers credit information. Under the Economic Growth, Regulatory Relief, and Consumer Protection Act ( XXXX  ), credit bureaus can not lock or freeze your credit report without your consent. This law mandates that : 1. Consumers have the right to freeze and unfreeze their credit reports for free at all three major credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion ). 2. Credit bureaus can not lock or freeze a credit report without the consumers explicit request. 3. Credit freezes must be lifted upon requestwithin one hour if requested online or by phone. I did not request that Transunion block my credit report and I am demanding my report be unlocked immediately. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Ga, XXXX XX/XX/year> Experian Information Solutions , Inc . 
Dispute Department RE : Formal Dispute of Inaccurate Credit Reporting under FCRA and Consumer Law To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate information on my credit report. This dispute is submitted under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681i, which requires credit reporting agencies to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation of disputed items. 
Recent findings by the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) have brought to light significant concerns regarding Experian 's failure to conduct proper investigations. Specifically, in a lawsuit filed against Experian, the CFPB alleges that the company engaged in sham investigations, violating consumer protection laws by failing to meet its obligations under the FCRA. 
As per 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), Experian is required to conduct a thorough and reasonable reinvestigation of disputed items within 30 days. Furthermore, under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ), any information found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable must be promptly deleted or corrected. Failure to adhere to these requirements constitutes a violation of federal law.

I hereby request that Experian : 1. Conduct a thorough reinvestigation of the following disputed accounts or items [ list the specific accounts or items you are disputing ].

2. Provide me with all documentation used to verify the accuracy of the disputed information.

3. Correct or delete any information that can not be verified or is inaccurate, as mandated by law. 
Given the recent CFPB findings, I expect Experian to handle this dispute with the utmost seriousness and compliance with legal standards. A copy of my identification and any relevant supporting documents are enclosed to facilitate your investigation. 
If Experian fails to comply with its obligations under the FCRA, I will not hesitate to escalate this matter to the CFPB and pursue any necessary legal action to protect my rights. 
Please respond to this dispute in writing within the legally mandated timeframe. I expect written confirmation of any changes made to my credit file. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX GA XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, IA XXXX Subject : Formal Complaint Regarding Improper Handling of Dispute, Misreporting of Past-Due Balances Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally complain about a violation of my consumer rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) by XXXX. After disputing a collection account reported by this entity, I discovered that no proper investigation was conducted. Instead, the account was updated to include a past-due balance, inaccurately reflecting the account as open and actively delinquent. 

This reporting practice is inconsistent with FCRA requirements and legal precedents that emphasize the accuracy and completeness of credit reporting. 

Details of the Issue XXXX. Account Information : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX accounts, same number listed on my report, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX : Date of my original dispute : XX/XX/XXXX Date of response/update : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX. Violation of FCRA and XXXX XXXX XXXX : FCRA XXXX XXXX ( b ) : This section mandates that furnishers of information ( creditors and collection agencies ) conduct a proper investigation upon receiving a consumer dispute. Updating the account with incorrect information without investigating violates this provision. 
FTC Advisory Opinion ( XX/XX/XXXX ) : The Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) has noted that collection accounts are not open accounts and, therefore, should not reflect ongoing past due balances. Reporting such balances misrepresents the nature of the account and creates a misleading credit profile. 

Relevant Legal Precedents XXXX. XXXX v. XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX ( S.D. Iowa XXXX ) : This case highlights that reporting inaccurate or misleading information about a consumers credit violates the FCRA and creates actionable harm. 
XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX  XXXX ) : The court ruled that creditors and furnishers must ensure the accuracy of reported information and investigate disputes thoroughly. Failing to do so can result in liability under the FCRA. 
XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ) : This case established that credit reporting agencies and furnishers must take reasonable steps to ensure the accuracy of their information. 

Request for Resolution I respectfully request the following : 1. Immediate removal as it does not align with the nature of a collection account.

Supporting Documents I have attached copies of the following : Response received from the collection agency/credit bureau Copies of my credit report showing the inaccurate reporting.

Impact on Me This inaccurate and misleading reporting has caused unnecessary damage to my credit score, hindering my ability to refinance my mortgage.

I trust the CFPB will take appropriate action to ensure compliance with FCRA regulations and address this issue. I also request that the CFPB investigate the practice of reporting past-due balances on collection accounts, which is inherently misleading and not reflective of their closed status. 

Thank you for your time and attention. I look forward to your response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Under 15 USC 1681b - Permissible Purposes of Consumer Reports, THE LAW CLEARLY STATES : ( a ) In General : Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : o ( 2 ) In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. 
Did I provide written instructions for this inaccurate information to be furnished on my credit report?

Product: Student loan
Sub-issue: Problem lowering your monthly payments
Consumer complaint narrative:
Back in XXXX I was XXXX years old and remember being very diligent about my finances and accruing student debts. I applied for as many scholarships and grants that I could qualify for with the hope of receiving as much financial assistance that I could to utilize towards furthering my education. In XXXX I enrolled in the University XXXX XXXX XXXX where I finished my XXXX XXXX. I did this because while attending that school the tuition was roughly half that of the main campus at the University XXXX XXXX. I did all of these laborious tasks to cut down my costs for higher education. After receiving my XXXX  degree and not being able to afford to repay my student loans, I called your organization to hear my options and ask for assistance. I signed up for the deferment plan versus an income based repayment plan because the representatives stated that deferment would be the best option for me based on my financial situation. I feel as though I was mislead by not being advised to utilize the income based repayment plan, which would have been the best option so that I would not have had to use finite loan deferment time while also accruing more interest on the loans. 

Once I graduated with my XXXX degree, I realized that I couldnt afford to repay my student loans even though I was working two part time jobs. Around XXXX I was finally advised by your representatives to enter an income based repayment plan. In XXXX, I moved to XXXX XXXX, CA and it took me roughly 4 years to gain employment where I could finally afford certain necessities such as health insurance and a 401k account. Less than a year into that position, I am now required to pay student loans that I simply can not afford. The cost of living in XXXX XXXX is almost 50 % higher than the national average and in order to live in accordance with societal expectations, one must budget accordingly. The monthly payment estimator on your website states that in the current program that Im enrolled in, I will owe $ XXXX/month. That is upwards of 20 % of my take home income. The estimator does not take into consideration the cost of living expenses for residing in a more costly city like XXXX XXXX, which makes it more difficult to save towards any future goals, such as buying a home or saving for retirement.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Credit inquiries on your report that you don't recognize
Consumer complaint narrative: I received my credit report and noticed violations under the 15 us code 1681 and 15 us code 1681b ( FCRA ). The law clearly states the following15 us code 1681b ( a ) In general Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : ( 2 ) In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. Meaning that if you do not have or havent gotten any written instructions from me ( the consumer ) to furnish an account on my report. It should not be there. That is a violation. I never gave written instruction to furnish any of the following accounts. Secondly according to the 15 us code 1681.The law clearly states 1. Accuracy and fairness of credit reporting. The Congress makes the following findings : 2. The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system ( 4 ) There is a need to ensure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy. ( b ) Reasonable procedures It is the purpose of this subchapter to require that consumer reporting agencies adopt reasonable procedures for meeting the needs of commerce for consumer credit, personnel, insurance, and other information in a manner which is fair and equitable to the consumer, with regard to the confidentiality, accuracy, relevancy, and proper utilization of such information in accordance with the requirements of this subchapter. I sent out a letter To Verify The Accuracy On Credit Report and I did not get a response. So I send out another letter just in case they didn't receive it still no respond. Under the FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681i, all unverified accounts MUST be promptly deleted. I have the list of accounts thats inaccurate and its in clear violation of my privacy. Which is a violation of the law. This is embarrassing and damaging to my reputation as a consumer. I need financing for a car and this inaccurate report is hindering me. As the consumer
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Difficulty submitting a dispute or getting information about a dispute over the phone
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a formal complaint against TransUnion for repeated violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). These violations have caused significant harm to my financial reputation and emotional well-being. 

Violations : Denial of Access to Credit Report : TransUnion refused to grant me access to my credit report despite providing valid identification, including a utility bill, drivers license, and Social Security card. This violates FCRA 609 ( a ), which guarantees consumers the right to access their credit report. 
Reporting Inaccurate Public Records : A dismissed bankruptcy ( Case # XXXX ) is inaccurately listed in my credit report. Dismissed bankruptcies provide no debt relief and should not harm a consumer 's credit. 
Failure to Investigate Disputed Accounts : I disputed several accounts on my credit report, but TransUnion failed to provide documentation validating these accounts, including : XXXX XXXX XXXX : A collection account. 
XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX : Reporting a balance that exceeds the original credit limit. 
XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, and others. 
Harm Caused : Denied access to credit due to inaccurate reporting. 
Financial losses from higher interest rates on existing accounts. 
Emotional distress and damage to my credit reputation. 
Requested Resolution : Compensation : Actual damages for financial losses : {$10000.00}. 
Statutory damages under FCRA 1681n : {$1000.00} per violation.

Punitive damages for willful noncompliance.

Corrections : Immediate removal of the dismissed bankruptcy and unverifiable accounts, all inquiries which I did not authorized. 
A detailed explanation of the source of inaccurate information. 
Proof of Compliance : Documentation showing how TransUnion will ensure compliance with the FCRA moving forward.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/year> Experian XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Subject : Formal Complaint Regarding Failure to Reinvestigate Account XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 

Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to file a formal complaint regarding a critical issue with the reinvestigation process on my credit report, as mandated by the regulations outlined in 15 USC 1666 ( b ) and 15 USC 1681 ( a ) ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ). Experian has failed to remove a late payment from my XXXX XXXX XXXX account , despite the necessary steps being taken on my part to rectify this incorrect information. 

I recently disputed the presence of a late payment on my XXXX XXXX XXXX  account , which has been negatively impacting my credit history. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I have the right to an accurate and fair credit report. After my dispute, Experian was obligated to conduct a reinvestigation into the matter and ensure that any inaccuracies are promptly corrected. 

Despite this statutory obligation, Experian has failed to carry out a proper reinvestigation and correct the inaccurate information on my credit report. This negligence has not only affected my credit score but also compromised my financial well-being. 

I request that Experian urgently investigate this matter and ensure compliance with the regulations stipulated under the law. I am seeking prompt action to rectify this error and restore the accuracy of my credit report. 

Attached to this letter are supporting documents relevant to my case, including copies of correspondence with Experian and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I appreciate your attention to this matter and look forward to a swift resolution. 

Thank you for your prompt assistance in this regard. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Information belongs to someone else
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, Connecticut, XXXX XX/XX/year> Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  DC XXXX Subject : Complaint Against Experian Regarding Failure to Remove Inaccurate Debt Information Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally lodge a complaint against Experian for its failure to address a disputed debt on my credit report appropriately and in accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 
On XX/XX/year>, I contacted Experian to dispute a debt reported by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, which I believe to be inaccurate and fraudulent. This balance resulted from identity theft, and I have taken the necessary steps to report this matter, including filing a complaint with the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ). I provided Experian with the FTC Identity Theft Report and other supporting documentation. Despite this, Experian has chosen not to uphold my rights as a victim of identity theft and has continued to report the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX account on my credit report. 
Additionally, I requested that XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX validate the debt, including providing all relevant documentation such as the original contract and supporting records that demonstrate the validity of the debt. However, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX failed to provide me with any of the documents I requested to validate the debt. 
Despite XXXX failure to provide the necessary validation, Experian has informed me that XXXX " proved '' the debt to them and has therefore refused to remove the item from my credit report. This decision violates my rights under the FCRA and the protections afforded to victims of identity theft. 
This unresolved issue has caused significant distress and has negatively impacted my credit profile. Experians failure to ensure the accuracy and verifiability of reported information, particularly in the context of identity theft, is unacceptable. 
I am requesting the following actions : A full investigation into the validity of this debt and Experians compliance with FCRA requirements. 
Immediate removal of the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX account from my credit report due to the lack of proper validation and the identity theft claim. 
Confirmation in writing that the issue has been resolved. 
I trust the CFPB will take my complaint seriously and take appropriate steps to ensure Experian adheres to the requirements set forth in the FCRA, particularly as it pertains to identity theft. 
Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

I am writing to you regarding a violation of my privacy and confidentiality rights, protected under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 USC 1681b ( 2 ) ). Pursuant to 18 USC 8, I have identified the following accounts that have breached these legal provisions : INSURANCE SELFREPORTED Account # : XXXX XXXX XXXX. Account # : XXXX XXXX SELFREPORTED. Account # : XXXX These accounts have accessed my credit information without my explicit authorization, which constitutes a violation of my privacy and confidentiality rights. Additionally, some of these accounts contain obsolete information that should be excluded from my credit report as stipulated in 15 USC 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ).

According to 15 USC 1681, Section 602 ( A ), I have the right to privacy. Furthermore, under 15 USC 1681, Section 604 ( A ), Section 2, a consumer reporting agency can not furnish an account without my written instructions. Also, 15 USC 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ) states that no consumer reporting agency may include any adverse item of information that is more than seven years old, other than records of convictions of crimes.

Finally, under 15 USC 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ), no person shall furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. Additionally, according to 15 USC 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( B ), a person shall not furnish information if ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer that specific information is inaccurate, and ( ii ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Credit inquiries on your report that you don't recognize
Consumer complaint narrative:
I previously filed a formal complaint with the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) regarding unauthorized inquiries on my credit report. The reference number for that complaint is XXXX, filed XXXX. 
Complaint Description : My credit report contains unauthorized inquiries that were made without my consent. Upon contacting the creditors responsible for these inquiries, they confirmed they have no evidence that I initiated these inquiries and lack any written or verbal authorization from me. 
Due to the lack of valid grounds for these inquiries, I formally requested their immediate removal. The credit bureau in question has not provided a satisfactory response, which is why I filed a complaint with the FTC. 
Legal Grounds ( Fair Credit Reporting Act, FCRA ) : Permissible Purposes : Under Section 604, unauthorized inquiries do not meet the requirements for permissible purposes.

Handling of Unverifiable Information : According to Section 611, any inquiry that can not be verified must be removed.

Right of Verification : Section 609 grants me the right to verify each inquiry with an original signed contract.

Information Provider Responsibility : Section 623 requires that reported data is accurate and authorized.

Protection Against Identity Theft : Section 605A mandates the removal of unauthorized inquiries potentially related to identity theft.

Additional Legal Support : Cases such as Pintos v. Pacific Creditors Association ( 2010 ) and Dennis v. BEH-1, LLC ( 2002 ) reinforce that inquiries must meet the FCRA 's permissible purposes requirements.

XXXX ( a ) Requirements Relating to Information Contained in Consumer Reports This section of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) outlines time limitations on how long certain negative information can appear on a consumer 's credit report : Bankruptcy cases under Chapter XXXX must be removed from the credit report after XXXX XXXX from the date of filing. 
Bankruptcy cases under Chapter XXXX must be removed after XXXX years from the date of discharge. 
Other adverse information, such as charge-offs and collections, must generally be removed after XXXX XXXX from the date of the original delinquency. 
The law ensures that outdated and damaging information does not remain on a consumer 's credit report indefinitely, protecting consumers from undue harm to their creditworthiness.

Consumer complaint narrative: JPMorgan Chase Bank is in violation of multiple laws set forth by Congress in regards to the following account # XXXX. 15 U.S. Code 1681a ( 2 ) ( a ) ( i ) states that the consumer report does not include information solely as to transactions or experiences ( payment history, charge off status ), between the consumer ( myself ) and the person ( JPMorgan Chase Bank ) making the report. Additionally, 15 U.S. Code 1681 s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) states that A person ( JPMorgan Chase Bank ) shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer ( ME ) to any consumer reporting agency ( XXXX, XXXX, XXXX ) XXXX the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. JPMorgan Chase Bank can not collect on a discharged debt. This is now considered a certificate of indebtedness per the IRS and income can not be reported. The IRS Clearly defines a charge off as Gross or Ordinary income, INCOME DOES NOT GET REPORTED ON THE CONSUMER REPORT which in fact makes reporting of this account inaccurate! I provided a screenshot from the IRS website. By Definition, the IRS Clearly says a Cancelled debt or Charge off is Income. The reporting of this account as a debt is inaccurate. I never received a 1099-C from JPMorgan Chase Bank for the cancelled debt of { { {$4100.00} } } in order to file as ordinary income. Where is my 1099-C JPMorgan Chase Bank is clearly writing off debt with the IRS without sending out 1099-C as required by the IRS for debts greater than { { {$600.00} } }. This is unsatisfactory! JPMorgan Chase Bank has been HEREBY PUT ON NOTICE that they are furnishing incorrect inaccurate information. In JPMorgan Chase Bank terms and conditions they agreed not to share my information with non affiliates. XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX is not an affiliate of JPMorgan Chase Bank nor are they " bureaus ''. The only true credit bureau is the CFPB and they DO NOT furnish consumer reports as stated in federal law. I have a right to privacy and Per the Privacy Act of 1974 as a federally protected consumer I am now revoking any and all authorization I the consumer may have given you written, non written, verbal, and nonverbal per 5 U.S. Code 552a. Per the FCRA as a federally protected consumer I am now opting out of any and all authorization I the consumer may have given you written, non written, verbal, and non verbal per 15 USC 6802. I shall also point out their responsibility pursuant 15 U.S. Code section 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( B ) ( ii ) : ( a ) DUTY OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO PROVIDE ACCURATE INFORMATION 1 ) PROHIBITION ( B ) Reporting information after notice and confirmation of errors A person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer, at the address specified by the person for such notices, that specific information is inaccurate ; and ( ii ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate. JPMorgan Chase Bank must also refund the remaining balance of the consumer account upon its termination. This is your 7 day notice to return ALL money due from this consumer account. XXXX Treatment of credit balances ; account termination. ( a ) Credit balances. When a credit balance in excess of { { {$1.00} } } is created on a credit account ( through transmittal of funds to a creditor in excess of the total balance due on an account, through rebates of unearned finance charges or insurance premiums, or through amounts otherwise owed to or held for the benefit of the consumer ), the creditor shall : ( 1 ) Credit the amount of the credit balance to the consumer 's account ; ( 2 ) Refund any part of the remaining credit balance within seven business days from receipt of a written request from the consumer ; ( 3 ) Make a good faith effort to refund to the consumer by cash, check, or money order, or credit to a deposit account of the consumer, any part of the credit balance remaining in the account for more than six months. No further action is required if the consumer 's current location is not known to the creditor and can not be traced through the consumer 's last known address or telephone number. ( b ) Account termination. ( 1 ) A creditor shall not terminate an account prior to its expiration date solely because the consumer does not incur a finance charge. ( 2 ) Nothing in paragraph ( b ) ( 1 ) of this section prohibits a creditor from terminating an account that is inactive for three or more consecutive months. An account is inactive for purposes of this paragraph if no credit has been extended ( such as by purchase, cash advance or balance transfer ) and if the account has no outstanding balance. ( c ) Timely settlement of estate debts ( 1 ) General rule. ( i ) Reasonable policies and procedures required. For credit card accounts under an open-end ( not home-secured ) consumer credit plan, card issuers must adopt reasonable written policies and procedures designed to ensure that an administrator of an estate of a deceased accountholder can determine the amount of and pay any balance on the account in a timely manner. ( ii ) Application to joint accounts. Paragraph ( c ) of this section does not apply to the account of a deceased consumer if a joint accountholder remains on the account. ( 2 ) Timely statement of balance ( i ) Requirement. Upon request by the administrator of an estate, a card issuer must provide the administrator with the amount of the balance on a deceased consumer 's account in a timely manner. ( ii ) Safe harbor. For purposes of paragraph ( c ) ( 2 ) ( i ) of this section, providing the amount of the balance on the account within 30 days of receiving the request is deemed to be timely. ( 3 ) Limitations after receipt of request from administrator ( i ) Limitation on fees and increases in annual percentage rates. After receiving a request from the administrator of an estate for the amount of the balance on a deceased consumer 's account, a card issuer must not impose any fees on the account ( such as a late fee, annual fee, or over-the-limit fee ) or increase any annual percentage rate, except as provided by XXXX XXXX b ) ( XXXX ). ( ii ) Limitation on trailing or residual interest. A card issuer must waive or rebate any additional finance charge due to a periodic interest rate if payment in full of the balance disclosed pursuant to paragraph ( c ) ( XXXX ) of this section is received within 30 days after disclosure.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account information incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to dispute the inaccurate and misleading reporting of the closed account referenced below on my credit report. I demand the immediate deletion of this account from my credit report due to numerous violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681 and its subchapters, which require accurate, complete, and up-to-date reporting of all credit information. 

The account in question is listed as a charged off auto loan, but the information is inaccurate, incomplete, and misleading. Below are the key discrepancies and violations : Account Information : Account Number ( redacted ) : XXXX Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Type : Auto Loan Account Status : Closed High Balance : {$23000.00} ( XXXX and Experian ) ; {$15000.00} ( XXXX XXXX Last Verified : XX/XX/XXXX Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX Balance Owed : {$15000.00} Closed Date : XX/XX/XXXX Account Rating : Derogatory ( Across All Bureaus ) Payment Status : Collection/Chargeoff Creditor Remarks : Charged off as bad debt / Merchandise taken back by XXXX XXXX Payment XXXX XXXX {$0.00} Last Payment : XX/XX/XXXX ( XXXX and Experian ), XX/XX/XXXX ( XXXX ) Past XXXX Amount : {$4900.00} ( XXXX ) Discrepancies and Violations : Incorrect Date of Last Activity The " Date of Last Activity '' is reported inconsistently across the credit bureaus : XXXX reports XX/XX/XXXX XXXX 
Experian reports XX/XX/XXXX. 
XXXX reports XX/XX/XXXX. 
This inconsistency violates 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ), which mandates that credit information must be accurate, complete, and up-to-date. 
Failure to Correct Inaccurate Reporting of XXXX The account is listed as " charged off as bad debt '' across all three credit bureaus, which is misleading and incorrect. The account was disputed previously but was reported with contradictory remarks : Experian and XXXX report that the dispute was resolved and indicate that the account was resolved by the data furnisher, but the charge-off status still remains. 
XXXX reports that merchandise was taken back by the credit grantor, which does not accurately reflect the accounts status and is an incomplete and misleading statement. 
Under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), if an account is disputed and later resolved, the credit reporting agencies are required to ensure that the information reported is accurate. This account has not been properly corrected, thus violating the FCRA. 
Inaccurate Payment History The payment history is inconsistent : XXXX and Experian report the last payment as XX/XX/XXXX, whereas XXXX reports the last payment as XX/XX/XXXX. 
This discrepancy in payment history is a direct violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681i, which requires a credit reporting agency to correct any inaccuracies and ensure the account history is properly reported. 
Inaccurate XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX is reporting a past due amount of {$4900.00}, which is incorrect. The past due balance should reflect the current status of the account, including any payments or adjustments made, but the figure is outdated and incorrect. This violates the requirement under 15 U.S.C. 1681c to report accurate and complete information. 

Failure to Properly Report Account Status The account was closed and charged off, but the FCRA Section 1681e ( b ) requires that information on closed accounts be fully accurate. The inaccurate remarks and inconsistent reporting of the status of the account suggest that the account is still open or unresolved, which is not the case. This misreporting is misleading and violates my rights under 15 U.S.C. 1681c.

Legal Right to Seek Damages : Under 15 U.S.C. 1681n, I am entitled to seek statutory damages of up to {$1000.00} per violation if the credit reporting agencies willfully fail to comply with the FCRA. Subject : Third Complaint to CFBP : Experians Non-Compliance with Section 605C of the Fair Credit Reporting Act Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), I am filing this third complaint regarding Experians repeated failure to comply with Section 605C of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Despite my multiple submissions of the required documentation as a victim of human trafficking, Experian continues to deny my request to block adverse information from my credit file.

Specifically, I have provided : A self-attestation letter signed by both myself and an authorized officer from an authorized agency.

A victim determination letter, also signed by myself and the authorized agency.

These documents have been submitted to Experian on three or four separate occasions. While both XXXX and XXXX accepted the same documentation and blocked the adverse information as required under Section 605C, Experian has refused to do so. This has caused significant inconsistencies across my credit reports and continues to harm my financial standing. 

Experian has repeatedly sent me identical, automated responses, despite my compliance with all legal requirements for exercising my rights under the FCRA. It appears there has been no meaningful human review of my case, yet the only denial reason they give is for me to submit a victim determination letter even though I have sent it to them on numerous occasions I respectfully request that the CFPB : 1. Investigate the methods and tools Experian is using to determine its denial of my request to block adverse information.

2. Require Experian to conduct a human review of my case, as their automated responses fail to address the merits of my documentation and circumstances.

3. Ensure Experian complies with its obligations under Section 605C of the FCRA, as both XXXX and XXXX have already done. 

As a victim of trafficking, I should not be subjected to this repeated and unjust denial of my rights, especially after providing all required documentation multiple times. I urge the CFPB to intervene and hold Experian accountable for its obligations under the law. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Well it states Lenders that violate the provisions of the ECOA face civil liability for actual and punitive damages, the latter of which is limited to non-governmental entities and can amount to up to {$10000.00} for an individual claim or the lesser of {$500000.00} or 1 % of the lender 's net worth in a class action. Without limiting the general application of the foregoing, the following conduct is a violation. Under 15 USC 1666B Grace period- If an open end consumer credit plan provides a time period within which an obligor may repay any portion of the credit extended without incurring an additional finance charge, such additional finance charge may not be imposed with respect to such portion of the credit extended for the billing cycle of which such period is a part, unless a statement which includes the amount upon which the finance charge for the period is based was mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the date specified in the statement by which payment must be made in order to avoid imposition of that finance charge.
