Consumer complaint narrative:
Claimant : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, La XXXX XXXX XXXX Nature of the Dispute This arbitration demand is filed against Experian Information Solutions , Inc. for violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). Experian continues to report inaccurate information regarding an account labeled XXXX XXXX XXXX despite multiple disputes and the absence of valid supporting documentation from the furnisher of information. Experian has failed to reasonably investigate and correct these inaccuracies, resulting in significant financial, reputational, and emotional harm. 

Violations 1. Failure to Delete Inaccurate Collections Violations of FDCPA : 15 U.S. Code 1692 ( g ) : Experian failed to ensure that XXXX XXXX validated the debt. XXXX XXXX has not provided any valid contract, assignment, or evidence of their legal right to collect or report the debt. 
1

5 U.S. Code 1692 ( c ) : Experian has allowed continued reporting of this inaccurate collection entry, even after receiving multiple disputes highlighting the absence of validation and errors.

2. Failure to Delete Inaccurate Charge-Offs Violations of FCRA : 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) : Experian failed to follow reasonable procedures to ensure the accuracy of the XXXX XXXX XXXX account information.

15 U.S. Code 1681i ( a ) : Despite three disputes, Experian did not conduct a reasonable reinvestigation into the inaccuracies of the XXXX XXXX XXXX account. 

Evidence Supporting My Claims Credit Report Details : The XXXX XXXX XXXX account is listed with conflicting and inaccurate information, including : A balance of {$0.00} reported by Experian, while other credit bureaus ( e.g., XXXX and XXXX ) list different balances, such as {$10000.00} and {$13000.00}, respectively. 
An account status of Transferred in Experian, which contradicts the Derogatory or Repossession status listed by other bureaus.

Comments that the dispute is resolved, despite no valid documentation supporting the accuracy of the account being provided. 
The last reported activity dates are inconsistent between the bureaus, indicating errors in reporting. 
Screenshots of Disputes : The results of disputes filed with Experian show a refusal to address inaccuracies, even though XXXX XXXX XXXX has failed to provide validation or correction of the errors. 
Supporting Documents : Evidence of no direct agreement with XXXX XXXX XXXX or sufficient validation of the debt. 

Damages Suffered 1. Financial Harm : Denial of credit due to inaccurate and negative entries from XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
Increased interest rates on existing and future credit products. 
2. Reputational Harm : Damaged credibility with lenders, landlords, and financial institutions due to erroneous reporting of a repossession and charge-off.

3. Emotional Distress : Experians refusal to correct inaccuracies after multiple disputes has caused significant stress, frustration, and anxiety.

Arbitration Agreement This demand is submitted under Experians arbitration clause, as outlined in their terms and conditions. However, I reserve the right to challenge the enforceability of any provision limiting my ability to seek full relief under the law.

Certification and Signature I certify that the information contained in this complaint is true to the best of my knowledge and belief. 

Signed, XXXX XXXX

XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XX/XX/XXXX Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Dear Sir/Madam, **RE : Cease and Desist Request** I, XXXX XXXX, am writing XXXX formally request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) immediately cease and desist any further actions or communications concerning Credence Resource Management account # XXXX ].

This request pertains specifically to XXXX and XXXX XXXX collecting inaccurate data and placing it on my credit report damaging my FICO score.

Despite my previous communications filed XXXX, I have not received sufficient clarification or resolution on the matter, and I believe the actions currently being taken by your office are [ unlawful, unjustified, harassing, etc. ]. As such, I respectfully request that you cease any further actions or communications regarding this issue and confirm in writing that no further steps will be taken.

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt is not yours
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern : Please respond do not mark duplicate I am writing in response to your recent communication regarding the debt associated with account number XXXX. While I understand that your agency is working on behalf of the original creditor, I would like to clarify my position and request additional information regarding the permissible purpose for reporting this debt to the credit bureaus. 

As you are aware, your agency does not own the debt but is acting as a third-party collector on behalf of the original creditor. I have kindly emailed the original creditor to verify whether the debt has been sold or if you have been authorized to report it to the credit bureaus. This verification will help me assess if your actions are in compliance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Please be advised that I am carefully monitoring the situation for any potential misleading practices under the FDCPA, including, but not limited to, the misrepresentation of debt ownership or authority to report on my credit profile. 

I respectfully request that you provide me with the following information : Written confirmation that your agency is legally authorized to report the debt to the credit bureaus, either through ownership or explicit authorization from the original creditor. 
Documentation proving that your agency has the authority to report this debt on behalf of the original creditor, if applicable. 
Should it be found that this debt was not properly transferred, or that your agency lacks the necessary authorization to report on my credit file, I will consider further actions, including filing a formal dispute with the credit bureaus and reporting the issue to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) for investigation. 

I expect a prompt response within 30 days, as required by law. If the proper documentation can not be provided, I request that you immediately remove this debt from my credit report and cease any further reporting related to it. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXXXXXX XXXX

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Took or threatened to take negative or legal action
Sub-issue: Threatened or suggested your credit would be damaged
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am submitting this formal complaint to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) regarding Solar Mosaic and their failure to process my hardship modification request in good faith. Below are the details of my complaint : Company Information : Solar Mosaic Timeline of Events : On XX/XX/year>, I contacted Solar Mosaic by phone to inform them of my difficulty in making payments and requesting alternative options for the short term. During this call, the representative suggested that I apply for a hardship modification to which I agreed. The representative suggested that the hardship modification may give me the short term reprieve to allow time to catch up with payments. 

Following this conversation, at XXXX AM on XX/XX/year>, I received an email from XXXX confirming my request for a hardship modification and requesting that I upload evidence of my hardship to include a hardship letter and XXXX months of bank statements. The info was to be uploaded to Mosaic via a secure web link which was provided in their email. 
I acquired the bank statements and hardship letter and compiled and uploaded the requested documents in XX/XX/year>. 
On or about XX/XX/year>, I contacted Solar Mosaic and spoke to a representative who confirmed receipt of my documents and furthermore stated that my request was under review. 

From XXXX through XX/XX/year>, I received multiple calls from representatives of both Solar Mosaic and XXXX XXXX. During these calls, I explained that I had submitted a hardship modification request to Solar Mosaic. 

The representatives from Solar Mosaic informed me that my application was received but still being reviewed, while the XXXX XXXX stated that they were the debt collectors for Solar Mosaic and would proceed to reach out to Solar Mosaic to confirm my hardship request. Both parties assured me that our conversations were being recorded and that they were also updating my account notes to reflect the pending hardship modification request and our contact. 

From XXXX through XX/XX/year>, I also subsequently received written communication from Solar Mosaic & XXXX XXXX regarding the past due amount of my loan, including threats of default and referral to a debt collector. While I proceeded to make some payments to Solar Mosaic during that period, I never received any written update or decision regarding the status of my hardship modification request which was submitted in XX/XX/year>. 

In XX/XX/year>, I received a notice from a credit monitoring service that my solar mosaic loan had been closed and possibly transferred to a debt collection agency, XXXX XXXX XXXX.I contacted Solar Mosaic who confirmed that the company had transferred my account to XXXX XXXX XXXX and they had no further response or update concerning my hardship modification request and referred me to XXXX  XXXX. 

Violations and Concerns : - Failure to Communicate : Solar Mosaic failed to provide a written response or update regarding the outcome of my hardship modification request. 
- Deceptive Business Practices : Promising to review my hardship request while subsequently transferring my account to a debt collector without notice constitutes misleading and deceptive business practices. 
- Lack of Transparency : Solar Mosaic did not provide any documentation or explanation for the transfer of my loan to XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
Emotional and Financial Impact : This mishandling has caused financial strain, emotional distress, and negatively impacted my credit score.

Requested Action : Conduct an investigation into Solar Mosaic 's handling of hardship modification requests and their failure to communicate decisions to customers.

Determine whether Solar Mosaic violated any Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) regulations related to deceptive business practices.

Require Solar Mosaic to restore my account to good standing and process my hardship modification request as originally submitted. 

Ensure the removal of any negative credit reporting caused by this transfer to a debt collector. 

Promptly address this matter due to the urgency of the situation, as the debt collector is currently seeking full repayment. 

While I am not seeking financial compensation for emotional distress at this time, I reserve the right to pursue this and every other legally available option if the issue is not resolved swiftly & amicably. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this urgent matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Information belongs to someone else
Consumer complaint narrative:
consumer Reporting Agencies play a crucial role in gathering and assessing consumer credit information. However, they must exercise their responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and respect for the consumers right to privacy. The banking system relies on accurate and fair credit reporting, and when these reporting methods are unfair, it undermines public trust, which is vital for the system 's stability. I never gave my explicit, written consent for these agencies to report my information, which is a violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ). This violation has led to an alleged case of identity theft, breaching 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2. The accounts in question are not related to any transactions made by me.

The Fair Debt Collection Practices Act was created to ensure that laws and procedures are in place to protect consumers from abusive, deceptive, and unfair practices by debt collectors. In this case, the company has violated 15 U.S. Code 1692f, which prohibits debt collectors from using unfair or unconscionable means to collect a debt. Specifically, they can not collect any amounts that arent explicitly authorized by the agreement or allowed by law. Additionally, the company has violated 15 U.S. Code 1692e, which prohibits the use of false, deceptive, or misleading representations in debt collection efforts. This includes using deceptive methods to collect a debt or gather consumer information. Moreover, they are forbidden from contacting consumers at inconvenient times or places, or engaging in behavior that harasses or abuses consumers. 

In this case, the company has harassed me by claiming I owe a debt that I do not recognize as my responsibility. They have also contacted me at inconvenient times and places, in violation of the law.

Product: Credit card or prepaid card

Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently looked at my credit reports and noticed that Sears/CBNA XXXX reported negative marks Paid, was past due 30,60 days late on my reports WITHOUT ever telling me they were going to report them. I believe this is incredibly unfair and had I received the federally mandated notice to me, I would have paid on time. 
According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act Section 623 ( a ) ( 7 ) ( A ) ( i ) and ( B ) ( i ), they has a responsibility to provide a notice furnishing of negative information, in writing, to the customer and that this notice is to be given to the consumer prior to or no later than 30 days after furnishing the negative information In fact, the Federal Reserve even created a published form so that creditors can be in compliance. 
Here is the compliant verbiage : We may report information about your account to credit bureaus. Late payments, missed payments, or other defaults on your account may be reflected in your credit report. 
In short, I never received such a warning notice! 
I understand that according to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, failing to provide this notice can result in a penalty up to {$2500.00} and can be enforced by the FTC, and that my state attorney general can also enforce this with a {$1000.00} penalty as well. 
I attached a copy of the law and the actual document from the federal reserve

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt is not yours
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am submitting this complaint regarding Midland Credit Management XXXX XXXX for engaging in unauthorized debt collection activities within the state of Florida. Specifically, XXXX is attempting to collect the following alleged debts reported to my credit file : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX Upon consultation with my legal counsel on XX/XX/XXXX, it has been confirmed that Midland Credit Management , Inc. does not possess a valid consumer collection agency license as required by the Florida Consumer Collection Practices Act ( FCCPA ), Chapter 559, Part VI, Florida Statutes ( Fla. Stat. 559.553 ). Additionally, XXXX does not maintain a registered business location within the state, violating Fla. Stat. 559.555, which governs registration requirements for out-of-state collection agencies.

Legal and Regulatory Violations The following statutory protections are being violated : Florida Consumer Collection Practices Act ( FCCPA ), Fla. Stat. 559.72 prohibits debt collectors from using deceptive means or attempting to collect debts without proper legal authority.

Fla. Stat. 559.553 mandates that no person shall engage in collection activities without registering with the Florida XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. Midlands failure to register or secure a bond renders all collection attempts unlawful. 
Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692 et seq. protects consumers from deceptive, unfair, or abusive collection practices.

Furthermore, Midland has failed to provide : Documentation proving securitization of these debts, A copy of the purchase agreement, Evidence of their legal right and standing to collect in Florida.

Demand for Immediate Action I demand that : Midland cease all collection activities immediately, The debts be removed from my credit reports, and All future correspondence be directed to my legal counsel. I will be happy to provide my attorneys contact information upon request. 
Failure to resolve this matter will result in legal action against Midland Credit Management , Inc., the original creditors, and credit reporting agencies for damages under Fla. Stat. 559.77, which allows consumers to seek actual damages, statutory damages of up to {$1000.00} per violation, and reasonable attorneys fees.

Product: Vehicle loan or lease
Sub-issue: Loan balance remaining after the vehicle is repossessed and sold
Consumer complaint narrative:
Letter I wrote To Wells Fargo Hello, I am writing this letter today to express my frustration and disappointment with Wells Fargo customer service and how I have been unjustly penalized through a bank error. 
A friend of mine, XXXX XXXX, gave me a gift of XXXX XXXX dollars. XXXX sent XXXX XXXX dollars through a wire and another XXXX XXXX dollars through XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX then wanted to revert XXXX XXXX dollars back to her account. XXXX didnt communicate this with me. I would have given XXXX the XXXX XXXX dollars that she wanted back if she did. So, my account was frozen by the fraud department without an email being sent or the courtesy of an explanation prior to the account being frozen. I only saw a number posted on my online Wells Fargo account. The phone representative explained that the account was under investigation for fraud. He explained to me that the funds were unauthorized. XXXX never claimed the transaction was unauthorized. After explaining to the representative that I had nothing to do with this, I was told that the account would be unfrozen and to follow up on Tuesday, the next week. I decided to wait it out and my account was closed on the following Monday. After following up on Tuesday, speaking to around 10 reps in many departments, including supervisors, I was told that the account was closed and that it couldn't be reopened. 
My credit card was then closed because my checking account was closed. The only checking account I had was a Wells Fargo College account. I was satisfied with what I had and never thought to open another checking with a different bank to deposit my money. After my checking account was closed unjustly, all the payments that were due to be sent ended up being charge backs into all my credit cards and my University account. The charge back fees amounted to around XXXX $ and I ended up with late payments. Up until then, I had 260 payments always on time and no derogatory marks in my credit history. I couldnt even get my money back. I had put a lot of effort and work into building my credit. It was XXXX and now its at XXXX. Its unjust that I had to be a victim of a bank error and not be able to find a rep that could help solve the issue. 
I went to two banks in person to be misinformed about reopening my college checking account with the same stipulations I had before. I was told that they could reopen the same closed checking and credit card accounts. All in all, I was left with a bad memory of the poor Wells Fargo customer service, loss of the time and loss of money ( many hours it took to earn the money ). There were no reparations for that and most importantly no accountability of the bank error. XXXX also contacted XXXX and had a letter sent stating that the two transactions were authorized. 

Thank you. 



I didnt have access to funds or could use checking or credit card to pay my auto loan bill. After months Wells Fargo decided to reopen my college checking account which had been grandfathered and my credit card because of a bank error. Though I was left with my first delinquency on my credit report. 

I couldnt pay my auto loan bill which I was high pressured to get car with misleading tactics along with a XXXX $ warranty. 

I spoke with many reps and Vice Presidents office of Wells Fargo Dealer Services to share my story. They were non compliant to fix my only derogatory credit mark. Wells Fargo Dealer services then disable my online account, so I couldnt make payments on car. They told me I had to pay XXXX or the car would be repossessed. The car was for sale for XXXX and I had already made payments of XXXX $ on the car. I didnt have full balance to pay the car so my car was reprocessed at XXXX and I couldnt do anything about it. 

Now I have a serious delinquency on my credit report and I also cant do anything about it. I was told by a rep that I would still be responsible for payments after the car is sold. What kind of injustice is that? 

I dont have a derogatory mark on 300+ payments for all my credit cards and my credit to debt ratio is around half. 

I was curious to what this delinquency had triggered. As XX/XX/2018, I made my first credit card inquiry for 2 student credit cards and was not approved.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Checking or savings account
Sub-issue: Banking errors
Consumer complaint narrative:
Bank : Wells Fargo XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX Personal Banker : XXXX XXXX Branch Manager : XXXX XXXX On XX/XX/XXXX I was contacted by XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) via a freelance website ( XXXX ) to hire me as a XXXX XXXX XXXX. He ended up being a scammer who put me through an online interview and chatted with me for a couple weeks. He said that I would meet with my supervisor and undergo training but first I needed to have office equipment shipped ( hardware, software, printer, fax machine, etc.. ). He sent me 2 checks ( 1. {$4900.00} and 2. {$4900.00} ). The first time on XX/XX/XXXX, he asked me to deposit the check into my bank account at Wells Fargo and then withdraw {$4900.00} in cash to deposit to a " vendor '' account at XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. I attempted to deposit the check at the ATM machine but the alert on the screen said that the value of the check was too high to deposit into the ATM machine and I had to go inside the branch to deposit it and so I did. I deposited the check with XXXX XXXX. I attempted to deposit at XXXX and was denied because the " vendor '' account was blocked. I then went back to Wells Fargo and deposited the cash in-branch, into a " vendor '' account ( Acct holder 's name : XXXX XXXX, Acct # : XXXX ). I even showed the teller the account information from the XXXXXXXX on my phone. 

The second check was received on XX/XX/XXXXand I went through the same process, only this time the scammer asked me to do the deposit of the check, withdrawal of cash, and then subsequent deposit into a vendor account ( Acct holder 's name : XXXX XXXX, Acct # : XXXX ) all at Wells Fargo. I did this process again with XXXX in-branch at Well Fargo this time, and XXXX XXXX remembered me from the previous correspondence. 

When I received another check from the scammer I knew something was suspicious. I called Wells Fargo XXXX XXXX to let them know that I was suspicious of recent activity on my account and that's when I was informed that both of the checks I deposited bounced. I then immediately filed a police report, a fraud claim with Wells Fargo, reported this to the FTC and the FBI. 

Wells Fargo denied my claim stating that I authorized the deposits. I asked them why the branch tellers did not warn me that the activity was suspicious and they then responded that I did not deposit the checks in branch. They responded that all teams at Wells Fargo corroborate that I deposited the checks at the ATM machine. I told them that the first time I did attempt to deposit the check at the ATM machine but the alert said that the value was too high to deposit at the ATM machine so I went in-branch. They restated that I deposited the checks at the ATM machine. I asked them to check the security camera footage and the manager said he would request them and then get back to me the next day. He did not get back to me and when I went back to the branch XXXX XXXX ( the personal banker of the case ) said that XXXX ( the branch manager ) was gone for 7 days. The next time I spoke to XXXX XXXX he stated that the resolution team has the footage and it is internal information only. I asked to talk to the resolution team and he said that it is not a client-facing team. 

I am very disappointed that the information about the fraudulent checks were inaccurate. I have been a Wells Fargo customer for forever and expected better handling of this case and my complaints.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Failure to Ensure Accuracy ( FCRA 607 ( b ) ) : Credit bureaus are mandated to ensure maximum accuracy in reporting. Discrepancies in balances, credit limits, open dates, and payment histories indicate violations. 

Failure to Investigate ( FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) ) : Credit bureaus must complete investigations within 30 days. My disputes remain unresolved beyond this timeframe.

Failure to Reinvestigate ( FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 6 ) ) : Credit bureaus must reinvestigate disputes upon request. My requests were inadequately addressed. 

Failure to Protect Personal Information ( 15 U.S.C. 6801-6809 ) : Under the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, financial institutions and credit bureaus must safeguard consumer data. A breach in security has evidently occurred.

Identity Theft Protections Violated ( 18 U.S.C. 1028 ) : Fraudulent accounts violate federal protections against identity theft under the Identity Theft and Assumption Deterrence Act.

Failure to Provide Resources ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ( e ) ) : Credit bureaus must provide victims of identity theft with resources, fraud alerts, and support, which were not offered. 

State Law Violations ( Florida Statutes ) : Fraudulent accounts violate Floridas identity theft protections.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Information belongs to someone else
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute inaccuracies on my credit report related to identity theft. I submitted my initial dispute on [ date of dispute ], along with a Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) Identity Theft Report and additional documentation supporting my claim. However, your agency has failed to meet its obligations under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Violations of the FCRA 1.Failure to Conduct a Reasonable Investigation ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ) Under the FCRA, credit reporting agencies are required to conduct a reasonable investigation upon receiving a dispute. Despite providing a comprehensive FTC Identity Theft Report and detailed supporting evidence, I have not received confirmation of any substantive investigation into the disputed items. 
2.Failure to Notify Me of Investigation Results ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ) ) The FCRA mandates that consumers be notified of the results of an investigation within 30 days of submitting a dispute. To date, I have not received any such notification, nor have I been informed of the outcome of your review or the process by which my dispute was evaluated. 
3.Failure to Block Inaccurate Information Promptly ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) The FCRA requires credit reporting agencies to block information resulting from identity theft upon receipt of appropriate documentation, such as an FTC Identity Theft Report. This has not occurred in my case.

Precedent Cases Supporting My Position Your failure to comply with FCRA requirements is not only a violation of my rights but also exposes your agency to liability, as demonstrated in precedent cases : Cushman v. TransUnion Corp. ( XXXX ) : This case emphasized that credit reporting agencies have a duty to conduct reasonable investigations beyond relying on the data provided by furnishers. 
Ramirez v. TransUnion LLC ( XXXX ) : The Supreme Court upheld consumer rights in disputes related to credit reporting inaccuracies, reinforcing the accountability of credit bureaus under the FCRA. 

Requested Resolution To resolve this matter, I demand the following actions : 1.Conduct a reasonable and thorough reinvestigation of the disputed accounts and transactions associated with my identity theft.

2.Provide a detailed written summary of your investigation, including the steps taken and evidence reviewed.

3.Immediately block or remove all inaccurate information resulting from the identity theft. 

If this matter is not resolved promptly, I will have no choice but to escalate my complaint by filing with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and potentially pursuing legal remedies. 
XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint to request removal of a specific account from my credit report with EXPERIAN due to inaccurate and inconsistent information, based on my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ). 
Disputed account details : Account number : XXXX Creditor name : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Incorrect information identified on reports from all three credit bureaus. 
Legal basis for removal of information : Right to accurate information ( FCRA, Section 609 - 15 U.S.C. 1681g ) : I request that the authenticity of this account be verified manually with the original creditor, rather than relying on the automated XXXX system, and that I receive a detailed explanation of the verification process. 
Reinvestigation of Disputed Information ( FCRA, Section 611 - 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) : Under this section, I demand a complete reinvestigation of the account and immediate correction of any inaccurate information. 
Deletion of Inaccurate or Unverified Information ( FCRA, Section 611 ( 5 ) - 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( 5 ) ) : Under the FCRA, if information can not be verified, it must be removed from the report.

Liability of Information Providers ( FCRA, Section 623 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) - 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) ) : The creditor 's failure to validate this information warrants its deletion.

Compliance with Accuracy Procedures ( FCRA, Section 607 - 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ) : The inaccuracy in my report suggests a failure to comply with required accuracy procedures.

Permitted Purposes for Access ( FCRA, Section 604 - 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) : I request confirmation that the access to my report was legitimate. If it was not, I request deletion of any unauthorized data.

Truth in Lending Act ( TILA, Section 1601 - 15 U.S.C. 1601 ) : TILA reinforces my right to accurate information, and the presence of this inaccurate account contradicts that right.

Supporting Case Law : Cortez v. Trans Union, LLC ( 617 F.3d 688 ) emphasizes the credit bureaus ' responsibility to properly investigate consumer disputes. Dennis v. BEH-1, LLC further reinforces the obligation to maintain reasonable procedures to ensure accuracy.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act 15 USC 1681 section 602a states : There is a need to ensure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy. 
have the right to make sure my private information isnt shared which is backed by 15 USC 6801 which states It is the policy of the Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic personal information. 
XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  are financial institutions under 15 USC 6801 and they have violated that obligation by sharing my private information to XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, Early Warning Services, XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX and XXXX without my consent. 

15 USC 1681 section 604a section 2 states : In general Subject to subsection, any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  which are financial institutions, and the Consumer reporting agencies XXXX, XXXX and XXXX do not have my consent to furnish my information, and absolutely do not have my written consent. All consent to XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, wether it be verbal, non-verbal, written, or implied is now revoked. 
Per 15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ) states : A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless- the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option. 
XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Never informed me of my right to exercise my nondisclosure option which is against the law. In continuation, 15 USC 1681C ( a ) ( 5 ) states Except as authorized under subsection ( b ), no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX are reporting adverse items again without my permission which is also against the law. 

Privacy Act of XXXX ( 5 U.S.Code 552a ) Important Definitions ( 4 ) the term *record '' means any item, collection, or grouping of information about an individual that is maintained by an agency, including, but not limited to, his education, financial transactions, medical history, and criminal or employment history and that contains his name, or the identifying number, symbol, or other identifying particular assigned to the individual, such as a finger or voice print or a photograph : This includes consumer reports b ) Conditions of Disclosure.-No agency shall disclose any record which is contained in a system of records by any means of communication to any person, or to another agency, except pursuant to a written request by, or with the prior written consent of, the individual to whom the record pertains, unless disclosure of the record would be ( 12 ) to a consumer reporting agency in accordance with section 3711 ( e ) of title 31. 
Section 3711 ( e ) of title 31 States ( 1 ) When trying to collect a claim of the Government under a law except the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 ( 26 U.S.C. 1 et seq. ), the head of an executive, judicial, or legislative agency shall disclose to a consumer reporting agency information from a system of records that a person is responsible for a claim if. 
( E ) the head of the agency has established procedures to ( ii ) get satisfactory assurances from each consumer reporting agency that the agency is complying with all laws of the United States related to providing consumer credit information : Not only has XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX violated the Fair Credit Reporting Act but they have also the Privacy Act of XXXX. 

Per IRS Publication 4681 Canceled debts, If a debt for which you are personally liable is forgiven or discharged for less than the full amount owed, the debt is considered canceled in whatever amount it remained unpaid. You must include the canceled debt to your income ( Certificate of indebtedness ). XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX report charge off on my consumer report. They can not report income to my consumer report so those negative accounts need to be removed immediately. 

It is illegal to report transaction history, XXXX XXXX bank, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  have all violated the law by reporting my credit card utilization to XXXX, XXXX and XXXX. This needs to stop reflecting on my credit report immediately. 

Per 16 USC 313.7 Form of opt out notice to consumers ; opt out methods 1 ) Form of opt out notice. If you are required to provide an opt out notice under 313.10 ( a ), you must provide a clear and conspicuous notice to each of your consumers that accurately explains the right to opt out under that section. The notice must state : ( i ) That you disclose or reserve the right to disclose nonpublic personal information about your consumer to a nonaffiliated third party ; ( ii ) That the consumer has the right to opt out of that disclosure; and ( iii ) A reasonable means by which the consumer may exercise the opt out right. 

( 2 ) Examples ( i ) Adequate opt out notice. You provide adequate notice that the consumer can opt out of the disclosure of nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party if you : ( A ) Identify all of the categories of nonpublic personal information that you disclose or reserve the right to disclose, and all of the categories of nonaffiliated third parties to which you disclose the information. 
( B ) ( ii ) Reasonable opt out means. You provide a reasonable means to exercise an opt out right if you : ( C ) ( A ) Designate check-off boxes in a prominent position on the relevant forms with the opt out notice ; ( D ) ( B ) Include a reply form that includes the address to which the form should be mailed ; or ( E ) ( C ) Provide an electronic means to opt out, such as a form that can be sent via electronic mail or a process at your web site, if the consumer agrees to the electronic delivery of information ; or ( D ) Provide a toll-free telephone number that consumers may call to opt out. 
( E ) Time to comply with opt out. You must comply with a consumers opt out direction as soon as reasonably practicable after you receive it. 

XXXX XXXX bank, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Early warning services XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  never gave me reasonable and continuous options to opt out. 

Right now I am exercising my right to opt out of all reporting from these companies to my credit report.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account information incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
Since XX/XX/2024, I noticed several inaccuracies on my credit report. I sent letters to XXXX, XXXX, and Experian detailing the information I believed was incorrect and requested that they correct the errors and provide me with an update once the changes were made. In compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), which mandates a 30-day response period under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), I allowed 30 days, plus an additional 15 days for mailing, for their investigation and response. 

However, I did not see any updates on my credit report. Later, I received a letter from XXXX requesting that I confirm my identity by sending personal documents, which I promptly provided. From the other bureaus, I received no response at all, a clear violation of their obligation to investigate disputes and respond under the FCRA. 

I sent a follow-up letter to all three bureaus, informing them that since they had not responded, they were required under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) to delete the inaccurate information. Additionally, I requested that if they had verified the disputed items, they provide me with the documentation they used to validate the information. Once again, I received no response, which constitutes another breach of the FCRA 's requirements.

This process has been extremely stressful, as the inaccurate reporting has negatively impacted my ability to build business credit. The failure of the credit bureaus to act on my dispute within the legally mandated time frame has now exceeded 60 days since my initial request. In my final letter, sent in XXXX, I stated that I would escalate the matter to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) if I did not receive a response. Despite this warning, I have still received no communication or resolution. 

The credit bureaus ' noncompliance with 15 U.S.C. 1681i has left me no choice but to take matters into my own hands. I am prepared to escalate this issue further, including filing a formal complaint with the CFPB and exploring legal action, as permitted under 15 U.S.C. 1681n and 1681o, for their willful or negligent noncompliance with the FCRA.

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative:
Complainant : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX Financial Institution : Citi Cards XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, KY XXXX Subject : Formal Billing Dispute Interest Calculation Transparency & Account Protection Account Number : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Disputed Amount : {$7300.00} Complaint Details : I am filing this complaint against Citi Cards regarding a billing dispute for the total amount of {$7300.00} on my credit card account ( XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX ). On XX/XX/XXXX, I submitted a formal dispute to Citi Cards at XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, KY XXXX in accordance with my billing rights under the Fair Credit Billing Act ( FCBA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ).

The dispute was submitted because the interest calculations on my account appear inconsistent with the disclosed Annual Percentage Rate ( APR ), Daily Periodic Rate ( DPR ), and Average Daily Balance ( ADB ). The figures provided on my statement do not align with my own calculations, and I have not been provided a clear breakdown of how the interest rate was applied to my account. 

Nature of the Dispute : 1. Incorrect or Unclear Interest Rate Calculations The APR provided does not align with my calculated DPR and ADB, raising questions about how the final interest charge was determined.

2. Lack of Transparency While APR is disclosed, Citi has not provided the raw interest rate used to calculate my charges, making it impossible to verify whether I am being overcharged. 
3. Failure to Provide Required Documentation Under TILA and FCBA, I am entitled to a detailed, written breakdown of how my balance was calculated, including how interest, fees, and payments are allocated. 
4. Potential IRS Compliance Issue Under IRS regulations, any interest amount exceeding {$10.00} requires a 1099-INT form for tax reporting purposes. To date, I have not received one. If Citi Cards has failed to issue the required documentation, this raises serious tax compliance concerns. 

The Core Issue with Interest Calculations The interest rate is the raw percentage charged on the amount I owe before any extra fees or calculations. The APR includes fees and represents the yearly cost of borrowing, while the Daily Periodic Rate ( DPR ) is just a small piece of the APR. But none of these numbers actually tell me the pure interest rate being used to calculate my charges, and thats a major issue. 

APR is a long-term cost representation, DPR is just a step in the math, and the actual interest rate is the hidden percentage that controls how much Im truly being charged. Without knowing the true interest rate, there is no way to verify whether the lenders interest calculations are correct. 

Requested Information : To resolve this matter, I request that Citi Cards provide a full written response detailing the following : 1. A clear separation of the actual interest rate applied versus any fees included in the APR.

2. The precise Daily Periodic Rate ( DPR ) used and how it was derived.

3. A full breakdown of how my Average Daily Balance ( ADB ) was calculated.

4. A detailed explanation of how my APR and daily interest are calculated, including how my payments are allocated between principal and interest.

5. A full review of my account to verify that all calculations have been applied correctly.

6. A revised statement, if necessary, that accurately reflects the interest and payment structure.

7. Clarification regarding any discrepancies that may have led to miscalculations or inconsistencies.

8. Written confirmation that no payments are required until this dispute is fully reviewed and resolved.

9. Issuance of a 1099-INT form for any interest assessed to my account, as required by law.

Legal Protections & Account Safeguards : The Fair Credit Billing Act ( FCBA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) both provide protections that ensure consumers can dispute any questionable charge, including interest assessments and balance discrepancies, without the risk of retaliation or unfair treatment by the lender. These laws safeguard my right to request full transparency in how my balance is calculated and ensure that no payments are required until the dispute is properly reviewed and resolved.

As required by law under 15 U.S. Code 1666 ( c ) : My account must not be subjected to adverse action ( such as late fees, penalties, or negative credit reporting ) while this dispute is under review.

The disputed amount can not be collected until Citi provides written evidence supporting the accuracy of the charges.

Additionally, nowhere in federal law does it state that a certain transaction can only be disputed under the Billing Rights Act. My right to dispute interest calculations, balance discrepancies, and account accuracy is protected under multiple consumer protection laws, including TILA and FCBA.

In accordance with federal consumer protection laws, my account should be placed on hold until this matter is fully reviewed and resolved. It is my right to receive a clear and accurate breakdown of how interest and balances are calculated before being required to make further payments. Continuing to impose payment obligations without providing this critical information could be considered unfair and improper under applicable laws.

I also request written confirmation that Citi will not close my account or take adverse action due to this dispute. The law does not limit disputes to specific transactionsconsumers are allowed to dispute total balances, interest calculations, and account inaccuracies without facing retaliation.

Supporting Documentation : Copy of my original dispute letter sent to Requested CFPB Action : I request that the CFPB intervene to ensure that Citi Cards : Provides a full and transparent explanation of how my interest was calculated.

Does not take adverse action against my account while the dispute is under review.

Issues a formal response within 30 days as required by law.

Suspends collection efforts on the disputed amount until the matter is resolved.

Corrects any errors found in the interest calculation and adjusts the balance accordingly.

Issues a 1099-INT form for any interest assessed, as required by IRS regulations .

Since my dispute was filed in compliance with federal law, I am requesting CFPB oversight to ensure that Citi follows all legal requirements and provides the transparency I am entitled to under TILA and FCBA.

Thank you for your time and assistance. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Details of the Complaint : 1. Dispute Information : - AXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Nature of Inaccuracy : I would like to have these accounts removed from my report.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account status incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
This correspondence serves to notify you that I have recently obtained a copy of my credit report published by your organization. Upon careful examination, Im writing to dispute the inaccurate information that appears in my XXXX consumer report. 

The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), as outlined in 15 USC 1681, pertains to Section 623, which addresses the responsibilities of consumer reporting agencies regarding the maintenance of accuracy. The Act stipulates that these agencies are required to report solely accurate information. Therefore, I kindly request to remove the inaccuracies from my report. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I examined my credit report and discovered that XXXX is reporting incorrect information. Firstly, an old address, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Oh XXXX, has reappeared, although I have never resided at that location. Additionally, the status of my XXXX card tradeline is incorrect. For account number XXXX, it indicates that the account was written off in XX/XX/XXXX, which is inaccurate ; it should have been written off in XXXX. Furthermore, the second XXXX card, # XXXX, has an erroneous reporting status for the period from XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX. I request the removal of this inaccurate information from my record. 

Furthermore, regarding my XXXX Credit card ending in XXXX, I have noticed that XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX reported a charge-off in XXXX, whereas it actually occurred in XXXX. Federal regulations require the accurate reporting of information, and this company has not complied. I request the removal of this inaccurate data from my credit report. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I dispatched a certified letter to all credit bureaus, requesting the removal of accurate data associated with XXXX. I informed them that they have 30 days to verify and eliminate this erroneous information.

Product: Student loan
Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Received bad information about your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
This letter is to formally complain about the unauthorized refinance of my private student loans that occurred in XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX 

On or around XX/XX/XXXX, I contacted the company handling my private student loan, American Education Services ( AES ), to explore potential options for lowering my student loan payments. The private loans were taken out in XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX Currently, I owe {$43000.00}. The original loan amount was {$8500.00}. The principal has long been paid, and what is remaining is all interest. During this call, I specifically requested : A soft credit check : I did not authorize a hard credit check. 
An estimate of my monthly payment if I were to refinance my loans. 
A follow-up call to discuss the estimated payment and compare it to my current payment options before proceeding with any refinance. 

Despite these explicit instructions, a refinance of my loans occurred without my authorization. This action resulted in a higher monthly payment than I was previously paying via a letter when I logged into my account and was notated in my next invoice. 

I contacted AES company around XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX via phone to address this issue. During this call, a representative reviewed my account and confirmed that the initial call notes indicated my request for an estimate and a follow-up call. 

I believe that the representative who handled my initial call failed to follow my instructions, resulting in the unauthorized consolidation of my loans. 

I submitted my complaint in writing to American Education Services a few days later after speaking with the AES representative, expressing my displeasure with their actions of refinancing my loan payment without my consent. 

I asked for AES to immediately investigate this matter and take the following corrective actions : Reverse the loan refinance : I request that you rescind the refinance and return my loans to their original status. 
Remove the hard credit inquiry : I request that you remove the hard credit inquiry associated with the unauthorized consolidation from my credit report. 
Waive any fees associated with this error. 
Provide written confirmation of the resolution of this issue, including the reversal of the refinance and the removal of the hard credit inquiry. 

I let them know that I expected a prompt and satisfactory resolution to this matter. If the issue is not resolved within 10 business days,. I let AES know that I would be forced to explore further options, including contacting the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and seeking legal counsel. 

I received two voicemails after submitting my complaint from AES on XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I returned the AES voicemail on XX/XX/XXXX, and spoke with an AES representative. The representative read the notes and agreed that AES did refinance my loans without my consent and that the issue had to be escalated to a complaint with CFPB on their part. She asked that I not say anything because she was not supposed to admit that they made an error.

This is an auto loan with XXXX XXXX. I called XXXX XXXX to request information about this loan, and why it is on my credit file. I only have one auto loan with a different company for a different vehicle and a very different balance. XXXX XXXX told me that the account I referred to does not belong to me. The confirmed that the account belongs to an individual with a different name, and a different social security number than the one I provided. They concluded that I am not the account holder, and they reported to me that they were documenting notes regarding the situation on the account file so that Experian could resolve the issue. I then filed a dispute with Experian on XX/XX/year>XXXX  regarding the account with XXXX XXXX belonging to an individual with a different name and social security number on my credit file. I informed them of my conversations with representatives from XXXX XXXX in which they confirmed that the account does not belong to me. Experian claims to have finished investigation the dispute on XX/XX/year>XXXX  and they claim that this loan belongs to me. I am not the account owner for the referenced loan. XXXX XXXX knows I am not the owner. Experian claims that they have verified me to be the owner. The owner has a different name and a different social security number. This loan is having a very negative impact on my ability to obtain any financing, and it is not my loan. Neither XXXX XXXX nor XXXX are reporting this particular account to belong to me, only XXXX.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a complaint against Experian for failing to properly investigate my disputes regarding inaccuracies in my credit report. 
Despite my submissions, Experian consistently responds within 24 hours stating the account is accurate, without providing any evidence of a thorough investigation.

This practice violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681i, which mandates a reasonable investigation of disputes. Furthermore, Experians actions may also contravene the Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ), 12 U.S.C.

5536 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) - ( B ), as highlighted in the CFPB 's recent administrative proceeding ( File No. XXXX ) against them for similar violations. I request that the CFPB take action to ensure Experian complies with federal law and provides consumers with the necessary proof of investigation. The XXXX account is marked as inaccurate.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative: XXXX XXXX has improperly reported my credit utilization data to credit bureaus without honoring my rights under federal opt-out laws, including Regulation P ( 12 CFR 1016 ). Under these laws, I have the right to opt out of disclosing my nonpublic personal information to nonaffiliated third parties. XXXX XXXX has not provided me with a clear and conspicuous notice or reasonable means to exercise this opt-out right. Despite my attempts to opt-out, they continue to report my credit utilization data. This failure violates federal requirements, including the mandate to comply with opt-out requests as soon as reasonably practicable under 12 CFR 1016.10. This improper handling has negatively impacted my financial privacy and subjected me to potential harm.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
Arvest Central Mortgage Co of XXXX XXXX AR took over my mortgage services on XX/XX/2020, however no correspondence was sent to me regarding the details of how to pay or how to contact their company until XX/XX/2020, via US mail bulk rate, and was not received by me until XX/XX/2020, the day that my mortgage would be considered late for payment and be imposed a late fee ( which Arvest has since said they are waiving for all customers ). 
When I originally tried to pay my mortgage to Arvest, via their automated system I was told that my information did not exist in their system. Due to not receiving the information from Arvest that I needed in order to pay ( including a contact number ) I was not able to pay my mortgage in a timely manner to Arvest. My mortgage interest accrues at over {$90.00} per week. This negligent and unethical delay in proper notification of how to pay my mortgage in a timely manner, by Arvest, resulted in my interest owed being increased by {$90.00} per week. This interest that accrued due to their delay, equates to direct fraud by this company, as it equates to more money that I now owe them. This interest that was not paid down due to this delay will be compounded many times over for the life of the loan. How can a company mail a notice on XX/XX/2020, via slow US mail, of how to pay make a payment that was due on XX/XX/2020?

Product: Bank account or service
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have maintained my personal bank accounts including home mortgage and XXXX visa cards in Chase Bank for over 13 years as a loyal customer. During this time, I never had a late payment on any of my credit cards or home mortgage loan, not even XXXX time. I maintained excellent credit score, well above XXXX and lately at XXXX. 

Early this year I began receiving notices against each of my accounts from Chase Bank, other than the home mortgage, that Chase has decided to close all of my personal and XXXX Credit Card accounts. I was given a certain date to close my accounts out. Chase said it was within its rights to do so and they did n't have to give me a reason for their action. Including in those accounts were XXXX custodial accounts ; XXXX accounts belong to my daughters attending XXXX XXXX and XXXX of my XXXX-years old mother. I found it outrageous but decided to comply with their requests. 

I rushed to open new bank accounts with another institution and got new credit cards from XXXX and XXXX XXXX. I went to the local branch of Chase Bank and settled all of my credit cards and withdrew my personal funds. 

My Mileage Plus United Chase Visa card, XXXX of XXXX credit cards with Chase, had {$10000.00} balance due per the previous months statement that I paid it off on XXXX XXXX, 2015. On XXXX XXXX, 2015, I went to the local bank branch and paid the {$990.00}, the balance incurred since the last statement. Later, I learned that bank assessed additional {$87.00} interest on XXXX XXXX, 2015 that also was paid on XXXX XXXX, 2015, via a phone call. I was entitled to a refund on the annual fee of {$85.00} assessed earlier. 

I had used online access, portal provided by the Chase Bank, to manage my accounts. After the accounts were settled and closed Chase took away my on-line access. In XXXX 2015, I was denied a refinancing loan on my personal residence because Chase had reported {$370.00} due on my XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX account and reported XXXX late payments ranging between {$25.00} and {$42.00} over the next three month. That was the first time I learned I had derogatory reports on my credit report. 

I called the Bank on XXXX XXXX to confirm these charges. I did not realize that after I had paid up my last balance and brought my XXXX XXXX balance to XXXX on XXXX XXXX, Chase allowed XXXX unauthorized charges that I had no knowledge of on the XXXX Card on XXXX XXXX and XXXX for {$290.00}. Chase also refunded {$85.00} annual fee and had an outstanding balance of {$200.00}. ( XXXX & XXXX bank statements are attached. ) Over the next 6 months that balance became {$370.00} after Chase added late fee and interest and reported XXXX late payments to the Credit Bureaus. Chase never attempted to contact me via a phone call or sent a customary letter or provided monthly bank statements. 

Chase customer service representative, who identified herself as XXXX, told me that it was not Bank 's responsibility to inform me about my statements because I was using an on-line access. The fact that the on-line access was taken away after I was forced to close my accounts was none of their concern. However, the Bank felt obliged to continue to assess interest and penalties and also reported to the Credit Bureaus but saw no reason to inform me. I requested the bank statements. 

After the bank statements were received I called bank on XXXX XXXX, 2015, to resolve my credit report issues. XXXX XXXX from XXXX XXXX location told me that I had no recourse and all he could do was to accept my payment of {$370.00} ( includes {$170.00} in penalties and interest ) on the phone that could be charged to my new XXXX XXXX account. I authorized the payment. Chase maintained my personal information ( phone, address, new bank ) but chose not to contact me. 

In conclusion, Chase removed my account access, never sent me an account statement, and I had no way of knowing the charges or penalties.

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt was paid
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dispute Regarding Inaccurate Account Reporting and Violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( e ) b To Whom It May Concern, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account number : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account number : XXXX XXXX XXXX  Account number : XXXX I am writing to formally dispute the inaccurate reporting of charged-off accounts appearing on my credit report. The accounts in question has been reported as a charge-offs, and yet they continue to be furnished on my credit report as an outstanding debt. Furthermore, I stand firm on my position that this reporting is both inaccurate and unlawful, and I demand its immediate removal from my credit report. 
According to the information available to me, the creditor has issued a Form XXXX for this account, signifying that the debt has been canceled and reported as ordinary income for tax purposes. If a charge-off is considered ordinary income, as evidenced by the issuance of a XXXX, it can not simultaneously be reported as a collectible debt. Reporting the account in this manner is not only misleading but also inconsistent with the legal implications of debt cancellation. 
Additionally, the creditor has failed to provide me with a copy of the XXXX form to file on my tax return as required by law. This failure to notify me is another indication of the creditors negligence and failure to comply with regulatory standards. 
Under 15 U.S.C. 1681b, the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) requires that information furnished to consumer reporting agencies must be accurate and permissible under the law. The continued reporting of a canceled debt as an outstanding obligation violates these provisions and is causing ongoing harm to my creditworthiness and financial well-being.

I request that the creditor and all associated parties immediately take the following actions : 1. Cease reporting this account as an outstanding debt on my credit report and remove all associated negative marks. 
2. Have XXXX provide ( XXXX XXXX ) and CFPB with a copy of the XXXX form for my records and tax reporting purposes. 
3. Conduct a thorough investigation into this matter and provide written confirmation of the resolution. 
Should this matter not be resolved promptly, I am prepared to escalate this dispute to the appropriate regulatory agencies, including but not limited to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ). I am also prepared to seek legal counsel to address these violations. 
Please consider this letter my formal notice under the FCRA, and I expect a response within the legally mandated time frame of 30 days. Failure to comply with this request will result in further action. 
Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX

Sub-issue: Was not notified of investigation status or results
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX Subject : Formal Complaint Regarding Inaccurate Late Payment Reporting on Account with Equifax Dear CFPB, I am filing this formal complaint against Equifax for failing to correct inaccurate information regarding late payments reported on my credit report for the following account : Account Details Account Name : XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Despite multiple requests for correction, including dispute letters sent on XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX, my requests have been ignored, and the erroneous information remains unchanged on my credit report. This lack of action violates both the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ). 
Summary of Errors and Discrepancies : Late payments are incorrectly reported for the following periods : Equifax : XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX. 
The discrepancies include inconsistent dates of activity, reporting, and late payment histories. 
The account has been verified multiple times, yet the inaccuracies persist without correction.

FCRA Violations : Under 15 U.S. Code 1666b, creditors are required to send periodic statements at least 21 days before the payment due date. The inaccurate late payment reporting on my account suggests a failure to comply with this requirement. Additionally, 15 U.S. Code 1681i mandates that credit reporting agencies ensure the accuracy of information in consumer files. In my case, this responsibility has not been upheld.

Desired Resolution : Immediate removal of the inaccurate late payment notations from my credit report.

Written confirmation of the corrections made.

If this issue is not resolved promptly, I will escalate my complaint further, including potential legal action and filing additional complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and other relevant agencies. Please address this matter with the urgency it requires and ensure compliance with federal laws to protect consumer rights.

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
For approximately XXXX year I have repeatedly sought to remove an item from my credit report that is there in error. For over XXXX year XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  has continually reported information on my credit report that is incorrect. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  has reported this incorrect information and continues to do so to all of the major credit reporting bureaus. The information that XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  is reporting is incorrect because the debt that they are reporting is not mine. I have never contracted in any capacity with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. I did not open an account with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. I did not authorize any person or party to act on my behalf to open an account with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. I will not and have not benefited in any way from this account that XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  is reporting. 
In trying to remove this account from my credit report I have reached out to all parties involved ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  and the major credit reporting bureaus ). I have filed numerous disputes with the major credit reporting bureaus indicating that this debt does not belong to me. Each dispute has resulted in the same outcome, where the debt is claimed to be verified. Throughout the past year I have made XXXX separate written requests to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  demanding that they validate, verify, and provide all corresponding paperwork with regards to this debt. I HAVE NEVER RECEIVED A RESPONSE TO ANY OF MY WRITTEN DEMANDS. I have contacted XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  numerous times via telephone and I have been told each time that such requests must be made in writing. 
When disputing this debt with the major credit reporting bureaus I have included the aforementioned information. The major credit reporting bureaus are aware that I have made said demands on XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  and that they have not responded to said requests. Despite this obvious non compliance with various governing laws and regulations all the major credit reporting bureau have continued to report this incorrect information on my credit report. It appears that said major credit reporting bureaus are satisfied with the information that XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  is submitting in response to my initiated disputes. All the major credit reporting bureaus have denied my requests to examine the documents that XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  submits in response to my dispute initiation.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account status incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative: Subject : Complaint Regarding Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) I am submitting this complaint regarding violations of my rights as a consumer under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) by Transunion XXXX have enclosed a copy my Police Report/FTC identity theft report ( FTC REPORT XXXX XXXX to support my identity theft claim. Under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 when a consumer submits an identity theft report, credit reporting agencies must block any information identified by the consumer as resulting from identity theft within four business days. Despite my previous correspondence Letter 1 and Letter 2, which requested the removal of the above-mentioned account due to inaccuracies and failure to validate the information as required by law, Transunion has not conducted a proper investigation nor provided the required documentation. Reasons for Complaint : 1. Violation of the FCRA : o Investigation Requirements ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) : Your verification response did not include a sufficient description of the investigation process, as required by the FCRA. You failed to adhere to the obligation to provide a thorough and detailed account of the steps taken to verify the information. o Permissible Purposes ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( 2 ) ) : The information provided did not comply with the permissible purposes outlined in the FCRA. The verification process failed to meet the established standards for handling and reporting information. o Privacy Rights ( 15 U.S.C. 1681a ( 4 ) ) : The continued inclusion of this bankruptcy record and associated accounts infringes upon my privacy rights. The failure to follow appropriate procedures for handling sensitive information constitutes a violation of this section. o Description of Investigation ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( 7 ) ) : Credit reporting agencies are obligated to provide a description of the investigation within 15 days of receiving a dispute. To date, I have not received this required information. o Invocation of 15 U.S.C. 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( a ) and 15 U.S.C. 609 ( a ) ( 2 ) : I am invoking these provisions to request the removal of this account and to demand proof of its verification. The failure to complete this verification constitutes an abuse of my rights. 2. Violation of the TILA : o Disclosure Requirements : experian failed to provide accurate and timely disclosures regarding the account status, breaching the TILA requirements. 3. Federal Consumer Protections : o Title 15, Chapter 41 : The failure to provide adequate proof and the apparent disregard for my rights under the FCRA indicate a violation of federal consumer protection laws. o Public Law 91-506, Title VI, Section 611, Subsections A-D : This law stipulates the procedures for the removal of inaccurate or incomplete information from credit reports. The response and verification process did not comply with these provisions, necessitating the removal of the bankruptcy record. Immediate Action Requested : Delete Immediately for Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) : XXXX. Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX o Account Number : XXXX Present below the inaccurate information persistently affecting my credit report.

Consumer complaint narrative: In the quiet humdrum, of everyday life, a sudden jolt shattered the tranquility. I had become a victim of identity theft. Like a thief in the night. Unseen hands had stolen my personal information, plunging me into a bewildering maze of uncertainly. With each fraudulent transaction and unauthorized accounts. The breach of trust cut deep. Leaving me grappling with the unsettling reality of a violation identity. Yet, in the midst of chaos, a glimmer of resilience emerged, a resolve to reclaim what was rightfully mine and restore the harmony stolen by unseen adversaries these are the following accounts need to be removed.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX Subject : Formal Complaint Regarding Inaccurate Late Payment Reporting on My Credit Report Dear CFPB, I am writing to formally file a complaint against TransUnion for failing to correct inaccurate information regarding late payments reported on my credit report for the account with XXXX XXXX 
Despite multiple requests for correction, including disputes dated XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX, no changes have been made. This lack of action violates both the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ). 
Account Information : Account Name : XXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX High Balance : {$2500.00} Last Verified : XX/XX/XXXX Date of Last Activity : XX/XX/XXXX Date Reported : XX/XX/XXXX Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Balance Owed : {$0.00} Closed Date : XX/XX/XXXX Account Rating : Closed Account Description : Individual Dispute Status : Account not disputed Creditor Type : Miscellaneous Finance Account Status : Closed Payment Status : Current Creditor Remarks : Closed Payment Amount : {$0.00} Last Payment : XX/XX/XXXX Term Length : 15 Month ( XXXX ) Past Due Amount : {$0.00} Account Type : Unsecured Loan Payment Frequency : Monthly ( every month ) Credit Limit : {$0.00} Two-Year Payment History : TransUnion : XX/XX/XXXX : OK XX/XX/XXXX : OK XX/XX/XXXX : OK XX/XX/XXXX : XXXX late ( inaccurately reported ) XX/XX/XXXX : OK XX/XX/XXXX : OK XX/XX/XXXX : OK Days Late - XXXX History : TransUnion : 30 Days Late : XXXX ( XX/XX/XXXX ) XXXX : None Reported XXXX : None Reported Violations : FCRA XXXX : According to XXXX XXXX Code XXXX, creditors are required to send periodic statements at least 21 days before the payment due date. The inaccurate late payment reporting on my account suggests a failure to comply with this requirement. Additionally, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX mandates that credit reporting agencies ensure the accuracy of information in consumer files, which has not been upheld in my case. 
TILA Violations : The Truth in Lending Act emphasizes the necessity for accurate and timely disclosures to consumers. The inaccurate reporting of late payments has caused undue harm to my creditworthiness. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX of Obligations XXXX ( XXXX ) : This act reinforces the responsibility of creditors to provide timely statements, preventing unfair penalties to consumers. 
Desired Resolution : XXXX removal of the inaccurate XXXX late payment notation for XX/XX/XXXX from my credit report. 
Written confirmation of the correction. 
If this issue is not resolved promptly, I will escalate my complaint further, including potential legal action and filing additional complaints with relevant regulatory agencies. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. Please contact me at your earliest convenience to confirm receipt of this complaint and to provide an update on your corrective actions. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

I demand that you provide a detailed list of the investigative tactics and procedures used to confirm their validity.

You have already exhausted the 30-day time frame allotted by law to investigate disputes. Therefore, if you can not provide undeniable proof of the accuracy and ownership of these accounts, I demand their immediate removal from my credit report within 15 days. I must also remind you that your delay in resolving this matter is causing financial harm, as I am unable to obtain a vehicle necessary for employment. Any further failure to act in compliance with the law could result in legal consequences, including damages for financial hardship. 

I expect your prompt attention to this matter and a written response detailing your findings. 

I have provided the original letter with high-lighted credit report and credentials to verify my identity. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Consumer Loan
Issue: Taking out the loan or lease
Consumer complaint narrative: I called Ally on XXXX and asked what I needed to do to purchase my leased vehicle. She stated that I needed to pay off the amount to Ally and they would then send the title and another document for me to sign off on mileage. She gave me the amount of {$29000.00}. I call Ally back on XXXX to ask for the address to send my final payment. Once talking to this gentleman he told me my final payoff amount to purchase the vehicle was {$30000.00}. I said, but I was told two days ago the {$29000.00} and that was good until XXXX XXXX. He said, sorry, she gave you the payoff amount not the amount to purchase the vehicle. I said, I did n't think that was fair and I did n't understand. It seemed like a bait and switch. I hung up frustrated. I called back a while later and told the person who answered I had received XXXX amounts. She asked me the amounts and then asked me to hold. When she came back she said the correct amount was the lower amount. When I asked her why I was given XXXX different amounts she said the gentleman calculated it wrong. Here I sit without feeling comfortable that the amount I have is accurate. In addition, I feel they are being deceptive in the way they are changing the balance. I wonder if they have taken advantage of others this way. I also wonder if they have done other things to my account that would cause me to pay more than I owe - like they tried to today. Please look into this unacceptable culture they have at Ally.
