Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Formal Complaint Against TransUnion for Unlawful Reinsertion of a Deleted Account Dear CFPB, I am filing this formal complaint against TransUnion for a violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically related to the reinsertion of an account that had previously been deleted from my credit report. This action was conducted without proper notification or sufficient evidence, which directly contravenes the protections afforded to me as a consumer under FCRA Section 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( B ). 
The account in question, XXXX, Account number : XXXX was previously investigated and removed from my credit report. However, TransUnion has reinserted this account without providing me with : 1. Written notification within five business days of the reinsertion, as required by law.

2. Substantial and verifiable proof to justify the reinsertion of the account. 
According to FCRA Section 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( B ), any account previously deleted may only be reinserted if the furnisher of the information provides verified certification that the account is accurate. Furthermore, the credit bureau must notify the consumer of the reinsertion in writing, specifying the details of the certification. To date, I have not received any such notification or evidence. 
This reinsertion is not only unlawful but has caused significant damage to my credit profile and financial well-being. I am requesting the following actions to resolve this matter : 1. Immediate removal of the reinserted account from my credit report.

2. A thorough investigation into TransUnion 's failure to comply with FCRA guidelines.

3. Written confirmation of the steps taken to address and correct this issue. 
As a consumer, I am entitled to accurate reporting and compliance with all applicable laws. TransUnions actions constitute a breach of my rights, and I trust the CFPB will take appropriate measures to ensure accountability. 
Please find attached copies of all relevant documentation, including my previous dispute and any correspondence I have received regarding this matter. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this serious issue. I look forward to receiving a response detailing the resolution of this complaint. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Was not notified of investigation status or results
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  Subject : Request for Description of Investigation Process - Disputed Account on My Credit Report Dear CFPB, I am writing to formally dispute the inaccurate reporting of late payments on my credit report for the XXXX XXXX  account and request a detailed description of the investigation process conducted by your agencies. Pursuant to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 USC 1681i ( 7 ), credit reporting agencies are obligated to provide a description of the investigation within 15 days of receiving a consumer 's dispute. 
Account Details : Account Name : XXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX High Balance : {$10000.00} ( XXXX, Experian ) Credit Limit : {$14000.00} Balance Owed : {$0.00} Account Status : Open Payment Status : Current Late Payment Dates : XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Experian : XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX Nature of Discrepancy : The reported late payments are inconsistent with my payment history and do not accurately reflect my financial responsibility. Based on my records and the terms of this account, the payments were made on time, and the reported 30-day late payments in XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX are incorrect. These discrepancies violate the FCRA 's requirement for credit reporting agencies to ensure maximum accuracy and fairness in consumer reporting ( 15 USC 1681e ( b ) ). 
Reference to PAANL ( Paid As Agreed, Never Late ) : The terms of my agreement with XXXX XXXX  have always been adhered to, and the account in question should reflect a status of " Paid As Agreed, Never Late '' based on the timely payments made. This account has consistently been in good standing, and the reported late payments contradict the actual payment history. It is critical that my credit report accurately represents my financial responsibility and commitment to meeting payment obligations. 
I am requesting that my account status be corrected to " Paid As Agreed, Never Late '' to accurately reflect my on-time payment history. Inaccurate reporting of late payments adversely affects my creditworthiness and violates the accuracy standards required under the FCRA. 
Supporting Evidence : XXXX. 
XXXX Two-Year Payment History : Late payment reported for XXXX Experian Two-Year Payment History : Late payment reported for XX/XX/XXXX. 

XXXX Two-Year Payment History : Late payment reported for XX/XX/XXXX. 
These inconsistencies across the three credit bureaus further indicate potential errors in the reporting process. 
Requested Action : 1. Investigation of Dispute : Conduct a thorough investigation to verify the accuracy of the reported late payments.

2. Documentation of Process : Provide a detailed description of the reasonable procedures you have adopted to investigate this dispute, as required by 15 USC 1681i ( 7 ).

3. Correction of Errors : If the late payment reporting can not be substantiated with verifiable proof, promptly update the account to reflect its accurate status as " Paid As Agreed, Never Late. '' 4. Proof of Late Payments : Provide documented proof supporting the claim of late payments, including specific details such as dates, amounts, and any relevant communication indicating these payments were late. 
Legal References : Per 15 USC 1681 ( a ) ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ), my consumer report should only contain accurate information regarding transactions between me and the creditor. 

Section 1666 ( b ) of Title 15 mandates that periodic statements must be sent to consumers at least 21 days before the payment due date, ensuring sufficient notice for timely payments. 
Next Steps : If your investigation confirms that the reported late payments are incorrect, I request the prompt correction of my credit report to accurately reflect my payment history. If you can not verify the accuracy of the late payments, I expect you to provide the required details and take corrective actions within the 30-day timeframe mandated by the FCRA. 
Your cooperation in resolving this matter is essential to maintaining the accuracy and integrity of my credit report. I look forward to receiving your response, including a detailed description of your investigation process, within the stipulated timeframe. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Unable to get your credit report or credit score
Sub-issue: Other problem getting your report or credit score
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have identified multiple issues with my credit report that indicate fraudulent activity, mishandling of my personal information, and improper practices by credit reporting agencies. Below are the specific problems : Incorrect Information on My Report : My credit report contains accounts and inquiries that are not mine. These accounts appear to have been fraudulently opened using my personal information. 

Examples include accounts listed with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, and other financial institutions, none of which I authorized or recognize. 

Additionally, there are discrepancies in my personal information section, such as incorrect addresses and employment history. 

Improper Use of My Report : My credit report has been accessed without my consent by unknown entities. Unauthorized inquiries from these entities suggest misuse of my personal data, potentially stemming from previous breaches such as the XXXX data breach. 

Failure to Provide Accurate and Timely Updates : I have submitted disputes and requests for correction to the credit reporting agencies, including XXXX. However, I have not received adequate or timely responses. 

Despite placing a fraud alert on my credit file, new unauthorized inquiries and accounts have continued to appear, demonstrating insufficient protection of my data. 

This mishandling has caused significant harm, including damage to my credit score, financial reputation, and peace of mind.

Legal Violations Involved The following federal, state, and other legal frameworks are applicable to this complaint : Federal Laws : Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681 ) : Ensures accuracy, fairness, and privacy of consumer information.

Federal Trade Commission Act ( 15 U.S.C. 45 ) : Prohibits unfair or deceptive acts or practices in commerce.

Identity Theft and Assumption Deterrence Act ( 18 U.S.C. 1028 ) : Addresses fraudulent use of personal identity information.

Electronic Communications Privacy Act ( 18 U.S.C. 2511 ) : Protects against unauthorized access to electronic communications and data.

State Laws : State Breach Notification Laws : Require timely disclosure of data breaches to affected individuals.

Unfair and Deceptive Acts and Practices ( UDAP ) Laws : Protect consumers against deceptive, unfair, or fraudulent practices.

Identity Theft Protection Acts : Mandate businesses to protect sensitive consumer information and implement security measures.

Uniform Commercial Code ( UCC ) : UCC Article 9 ( Secured Transactions ) : Addresses creditor and debtor rights regarding obligations and disputes.

Privacy Laws : California Consumer Privacy Act ( CCPA, if applicable ) : Provides rights regarding the collection and use of personal data.

General Data Protection Regulation ( GDPR, if applicable ) : Protects individuals personal data and privacy rights ( for global companies ).

What would be a fair resolution to this issue?

To resolve this matter, I request the following actions : Conduct a Comprehensive Investigation : Investigate all disputed accounts and inquiries, provide a detailed report of findings, and permanently remove fraudulent or inaccurate information from my credit report.

Implement Enhanced Security Measures : Strengthen protections on my credit file, including an extended fraud alert for a minimum of seven years.

Provide Credit Monitoring Services : Offer free credit monitoring and identity theft protection for a period of at least two years to mitigate the effects of these issues.

Ensure Compliance with Legal Obligations : Adhere to timelines and requirements mandated by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), state laws, and other applicable regulations. 

Hold Relevant Parties Accountable : Address systemic failures and negligence by credit reporting agencies in protecting sensitive consumer data and ensuring accurate reporting.

" I was shocked and devastated to see credit inquiries without my knowledge. I have reached out to the creditors to ask the following but they have FAILED to provide such.

Inquiry Details : Ask the creditor to provide specific details about the inquiry, such as the date it was made, the purpose of the inquiry and the type of credit product or service associated with the inquiry.

Application Documentation : Request copies of any credit applications or other documents related to the inquiry. This may include application forms, agreements, or disclosures that you would have completed or received when applying for credit.

Authorization Documentation : Ask the creditor to provide evidence of your authorization for the inquiry. This could include signed consent forms, agreements, or disclosures that demonstrate you provided permission for the creditor to access your credit report.

Communication Records : Request copies of any correspondence or communication between you and the creditor regarding the inquiry. This may include emails, letters, or notes documenting your interactions with the cre
ditor.

Internal Records : Ask the creditor to provide internal records or notes related to the inquiry, including any decision-making processes or reasons for initiating the inquiry.

Identity Verification : If identity theft is a concern, request verification measures taken by the creditor to confirm your identity before initiating the inquiry. This may include verification of personal information or identity documents provided during the application process. 
Compliance Documentation : Inquire about the creditor 's compliance with relevant laws and regulations governing credit inquiries, such as the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and Equal Credit Opportunity Act ( ECOA ). 
"

Product: Checking or savings account
Sub-issue: Deposits and withdrawals
Consumer complaint narrative: I opened an account for XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, a Florida company, into Truist on XXXX XXXX, 2024, and deposited a check for {$87000.00} into the account. XXXX XXXX was the bank manager that handled the deposit. I was told the check would be processed and funds available in 7-10 days. Beginning XX/XX/XXXX I visited the bank branch at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX to withdraw some of those funds, but was told the check had not cleared yet. On XX/XX/XXXX I was told the funds had cleared but were not available to be withdrawn, without an explanation as to why. Several days later I was told the funds were no longer in the account, but the branch manager was not able to provide an explanation. For the next few weeks I made numerous calls to Truist corporate offices and my local branch, and visited the branch numerous times to ascertain the whereabouts of my funds. In late XXXX I was advised by XXXX XXXX that Truist had declined to open the account and that money I deposited would be returned, but was given conflicting accounts as to how the money would be returned, and when. After repeatedly contacting the corporate and local offices, in early XXXX I was told that the money had been sent via check on XX/XX/XXXX, via regular mail, to my home address, with an explanation of why the account was refused and the reason for the delay. After several weeks of waiting for the check to arrive, which did not happen, on XX/XX/XXXX I asked the bank to cancel the check and issue a new check, and was told by XXXX XXXX XXXX at Truist HQ ( XXXX ) the bank can not cancel checks, but that after 3 months from the supposed mailing date I could claim the loss and petition to have a new check. In early XXXX I received a letter from Truist stating that it had declined to open my account, but included no explanation and no check. On the 3 month anniversary of the supposed issuance of the check ( XXXX XXXX, 2024 ), I contacted the local branch and corporate offices and filed their Declaration of Loss with the local branch. I was told a new check would be issued immediately, and I asked that it be issued by the branch, and was told it would. Following up with emails, calls, and visits daily since that point, I was told on XX/XX/XXXX that the check would instead be mailed to my home address. As of this writing ( XXXX XXXX ), my calls, emails and visits are either ignored, or I am promised that Truist is looking into it, and will respond to me by the end of the day, but I have never received an update or a status of the missing funds. The corporate office has contested receipt of my Declaration, though the branch manager has repeatedly confirmed that she received it and provided it to the correct parties at Truist. At this point, 4 months in, I have logged at least 50 phone calls, dozens of visits to the branch, and numerous emails, and have no answer as to where the money has gone.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account information incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
Complaint Details : Account : XXXX XXXX : XXXX I am submitting this complaint regarding inaccurate late payments that are reported on my credit file maintained by TRANSUNION. I believe these late payments are erroneous and do not accurately reflect my payment history. 

Nature of the Complaint : 1. Inaccurate Reporting : The late payments listed on my credit report are inaccurate. I have consistently made my payments on time, as I have been enrolled in autopay for all my accounts.

2. Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : The inaccurate reporting of these late payments violates my rights under the FCRA ( 15 USC 1666 ( b ) ), as they misrepresent my creditworthiness.

3. Potential Violation of Fair Debt Collections Practices Act ( FDCPA ) : The reporting of false late payments may also constitute a violation of the FDCPA, which protects consumers from misrepresentation regarding their accounts. 4. Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) : I ass
ert that the reporting practices violate the TILA, which mandates accurate reporting of credit information.

Additionally, the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically sections 15 U.S. Code 1681i and 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2, mandates that credit reporting agencies and information furnishers correct any inaccurate or incomplete information in credit reports and ensure the maximum accuracy of information contained in consumer files.

Furthermore, under the FCRA, articles 616 and 617 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681n and 1681o ) outline the civil liability for willful and negligent noncompliance, respectively. These provisions provide for damages, including actual damages, attorneys fees, and possible punitive damages, for failure to comply with the Act 's requirements.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/year> Subject : Formal Complaint Regarding Inaccurate Late Payment Reporting on Credit Report Dear CFPB, I am writing to formally dispute and escalate an issue regarding inaccurate late payment reporting on my credit report for the account with XXXX  XXXX, account number XXXX, as reported by TransUnion . Despite submitting XXXX previous requests for correction on XX/XX/year> and XX/XX/year>, the information remains incorrect, constituting a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ). 
Evidence of Error : In reviewing the two-year payment history provided by TransUnion, a 30-day late payment is inaccurately noted for XX/XX/year>. However : Payment records confirm that the payment was made within the grace period. 
No delinquency notices were issued for this period.

The reported 30-day late payment violates 15 U.S.C. 1681i, which requires credit reporting agencies to ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information in consumer files.

As stipulated by 15 U.S.C. 1666b, creditors must provide periodic statements at least 21 days before the payment due date. The failure to correct this error suggests non-compliance with these legal requirements.

Legal Violations : FCRA : 15 U.S.C. 1681i mandates that credit bureaus investigate disputes thoroughly and correct inaccuracies. The persistence of this error demonstrates a failure to fulfill this obligation.

TILA : The inaccurate reporting undermines the Truth in Lending Acts aim to ensure fair and accurate disclosures to consumers.

PAANL : The Protection Against Non-Payment of Obligations Act further reinforces the necessity of providing accurate and timely statements to avoid penalties to consumers, which was not adhered to in this case. 
Desired Resolution : I am requesting the following corrective actions : Immediate removal of the inaccurate 30-day late payment notation for XX/XX/year>. 
Written confirmation of the correction from TransUnion.

Verification of the updated report to ensure the information reflects my actual payment history accurately.

If this issue is not resolved promptly, I will escalate my complaint to include filing additional complaints with the CFPB and other relevant agencies, and I may explore legal remedies to address the harm caused by this error. 
Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. Please confirm receipt of this complaint and provide a timeline for resolution. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Furthermore, it is imperative that you notify TransUnion and XXXX to delete this information from my credit report immediately. The account in question is detailed and Unauthorized Accounts include the following : XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX  ( Original Creditor : XXXX  XXXX XXXX ) XXXX, XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX  XXXX. In addition, I am requesting for a copy of the 1099-C filed for the charged-off debt. These creditors must provide this to me, as the consumer, or you will be neglecting to comply with FEDERAL law. This leaves me no choice but to assume that you have neglected to comply with FEDERAL law by not filing a 1099-C as mandated. Consequently, I am compelled to inform you that I will report { insert creditor } to the IRS for potential tax fraud using Form 3949-A if prompt action is not taken. As per IRS regulations, a canceled debt of {$600.00} or more necessitates the filing of a 1099-C form by federal or government agencies, or applicable financial entities. Failure to comply with this requirement constitutes tax fraud, a serious offense that I will not hesitate to report to the IRS. It is essential to understand that a canceled debt is considered ordinary income by the IRS. Consequently, any failure to file a 1099-C form, or any attempt to conceal such actions, constitutes inaccurate reporting. Income is not to be included on a credit report, and any such inclusion violates consumer laws and regulations. Your company 's actions are in clear violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 USC 1681s-2, which outlines the responsibilities of furnishers of information to consumer reporting agencies. Under this statute, it is prohibited to furnish inaccurate information knowingly or with reasonable cause to believe it is inaccurate. It is imperative that you take immediate steps to rectify this situation by deleting the inaccurate information from all consumer reporting agencies. Failure to comply will result in legal action being pursued, including holding { insert creditor } accountable for willful noncompliance under 15 USC 1681n ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ). This statute stipulates that any person who willfully fails to comply with FCRA requirements may be liable for damages sustained by the consumer. Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative: I am writing to formally dispute the reporting and handling of account, as it contains several violations of my rights under federal law. Specifically, under 15 U.S.C. 1681 Section 602 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I have the right to privacy, which has been violated by furnishing or sharing my account information without my express written consent. Additionally, 15 U.S.C. 1681 Section 604 ( a ) ( 2 ) states that a consumer reporting agency can not furnish account information without my explicit written instructions, which I have not provided. Furthermore, per 15 U.S.C. 1681a paragraph ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ), transactions improperly reported that do not meet consumer reporting standards should be excluded from my consumer report. Additionally, under 15 U.S.C. 1666b, a creditor may not treat payments on a credit card account under an open-end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose unless proper notice is mailed to the consumer at least 21 days before the due date. To my knowledge, I did not receive any such notice or statement. Lastly, 15 U.S.C. 1637b requires that creditors provide clear and timely disclosures of payment terms, which I did not receive in relation to this account. Based on these violations, I demand the immediate removal of all late payments associated with this account from my credit report, written confirmation that any improperly included transactions have been removed, and proof that all required notices and disclosures were properly sent.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Regarding Re-Insertion of Previously Deleted and Unverifiable Debt I am filing this complaint against Experian, XXXX, and the debt collector XXXX  XXXX XXXX regarding the improper re-insertion of a previously deleted and unverifiable debt on my credit report. 

The account in question is XXXX  XXXX XXXX ( Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX account number XXXX. 
This account was originally submitted to my credit report by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Original Creditor : T-Mobile ). 

Following a dispute, this account was deleted from my credit report because it was found to be inaccurate or unverifiable. 
A few months later, XXXX  XXXX XXXX submitted the same debt, and both Experian and XXXX reinserted the account on my credit report without conducting a proper investigation or notifying me as required by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ).

FCRA Violations : This situation involves potential violations of the FCRA, specifically : Re-Insertion of Deleted Information ( FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( B ) ) : A consumer reporting agency can not reinsert deleted information unless the furnisher certifies its accuracy, and the CRA conducts a reasonable investigation. To my knowledge, no certification or investigation occurred.

Failure to Notify ( FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( B ) ( ii ) ) : If reinserted, the CRA must notify me in writing within 5 business days. I received no such notification.

Failure to Investigate Disputes ( FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ) : Both CRAs failed to conduct a reasonable investigation before re-adding this account.

The improper re-insertion of this unverifiable debt has caused harm to my credit score and overall financial standing. The failure of Experian and XXXX to comply with the FCRA has also caused undue stress. 


The attached documents demonstrate the following timeline : XXXX. In my credit report pulled in XX/XX/year>, XXXX XXXX XXXX was listed as reporting the debt. 

XXXX. In my subsequent credit report pulled in XX/XX/year>, the entry for XXXX XXXX XXXX had been removed from my credit report. I also received formal notice from the credit bureaus confirming the deletion of this account. 

XXXX. However, in XX/XX/year>, XXXX XXXX XXXX submitted the same account to both Experian and XXXX, and the debt was reinstated on my credit report. This was done without any notification to me or an investigation by the credit bureaus, as required by law.

Today, the again acknowledged that I do not have to pay property taxes, and that they owe me a nearly {$8000.00} refund. But they have no answers for me on when and how that will happen. They again tell me that they will stop the monthly draft for tax escrow payments, but this has been ongoing for 6 months now, and they are still taking money for property taxes that I do not have to pay. I am told every time I call that they are going to notate the information, pass it up the chain, and make sure it is taken are of. Every time I call they say the same thing. I ask them to call me to keep me updated and they tell me they do not contact customers. Then, like clockwork, I receive my monthly mortgage statement that includes a property tax escrow payment.

Product: Vehicle loan or lease
Sub-issue: Loan balance remaining after the vehicle is repossessed and sold
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear [ Recipient Name or To Whom It May Concern ], I am writing to formally file a complaint regarding improper handling and reporting of a vehicle repossession debt, in violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and related consumer protection laws, including 15 U.S. Code 1681b, 1681n, and 1681o.

Summary of Issues Failure to Remove Debt Balance After Sale : After my vehicle was repossessed and sold, the balance of the debt was not adjusted or removed as required. Despite the sale, the remaining balance has continued to be inaccurately reported.

Resale of Debt and Duplicate Reporting : The original debt was subsequently sold to another lender, and both the original and new debts are being reported on my credit file as active, resulting in a duplicate entry that significantly impacts my credit score. 

Lack of Proper Notice and Validation : I have not received proper notice, validation, or documentation of the debt 's accuracy from either the original creditor or the subsequent debt buyer. 

Violations of Consumer Protection Laws 15 U.S. Code 1681b : Credit reports must be accurate, and lenders must have a permissible purpose to report debts. The duplicate reporting of this debt and its inaccuracies violate this requirement.

15 U.S. Code 1681n : The continued reporting of incorrect debt balances and duplicates suggests willful noncompliance with the FCRA.

15 U.S. Code 1681o : At the very least, the handling of this debt reflects negligent noncompliance, causing significant harm to my credit standing.

Uniform Commercial Code ( UCC ) 9-610 and 9-611 : The sale of repossessed property requires creditors to provide notice of sale and ensure commercial reasonableness. If proper notice was not given, this could constitute another violation.

Impact on Credit and Financial Standing These actions have resulted in : Significant damage to my credit score.

Denial of credit opportunities due to the false portrayal of my financial obligations.

Emotional distress caused by the financial uncertainty and frustration of dealing with repeated inaccuracies.

Consumer complaint narrative: To whom it may concern : According to the FCRA, I have the right to dispute any information on my credit report that I believe is not correct. I reserve the right to dispute any information that I deem to be inaccurate. I won't stand for any misinformation being associated with my name and financial history. If there's something on my credit report that doesn't seem right, you can bet that I'll be taking action to get it removed.I can not recognize or accept the allegation of delinquency without factual proof. There must be some sort of evidence to back up the claim. Otherwise, I can not and will not recognize or accept the allegation. According to federal and state law, you must report any allegations with the greatest compliance and accuracy possible.You should not report any claims that you know or should know are not in compliance with regulations and the law. If you do report such claims, you could be subject to fines or other penalties. Furthermore, reporting claims that you know are not in compliance could damage the reputation of your company.I am writing to inform you that you need to make sure all your claims are factual and certified before reporting them. This is required by the Metro 2 reporting standard. I request that you provide evidence to support the existence of the account and evidence that the account was used for a permissible purpose. Please provide any documents or records you may have that can help corroborate the account and it's permissible purpose.I am giving you 30 days to investigate the matter and determine whether it is still being reported accurately and in compliance with regulations. If it is not, I want it removed from the report.I hereby authorize you to take whatever steps are necessary to correct my credit. Please send me physical proof of any actions taken on my behalf. I appreciate your help in making sure my credit is in good standing.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am requesting CFPB intervention to secure the immediate removal of an inaccurate and unverifiable account on my credit report, held and reported by Experian. This account has been repeatedly disputed without adequate verification, in clear violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Despite multiple requests for investigation and correction, the credit bureau has failed to comply with the thorough and reasonable verification requirements under the FCRA, relying solely on automated and inconsistent responses. 
Inconsistency Reporting : I have identified inconsistencies in the information for this account across all three major credit bureau reports. The discrepancies suggest that the reported information is inaccurate and does not meet the FCRA 's accuracy standards, warranting immediate corrective action. 
Legal Basis and Violations of the FCRA 1. Inaccuracy and Lack of Verification : According to the FCRA, credit bureaus must maintain accurate and verifiable information in credit reports. In this case, the credit bureau has shown a lack of diligence in verifying this account, relying solely on automated systems like e-OSCAR to respond to my dispute. This type of system does not meet the reasonable verification standard required by law, especially in a recurring dispute that significantly impacts my credit history and score. 
XXXX. Inconsistencies Across Credit Bureaus : Upon reviewing my reports from the three major credit bureaus, I have found inconsistencies in how this account is reported. These discrepancies indicate systemic errors in the handling and verification of information by Experian, which further underscores the lack of accuracy and FCRA compliance. 

References to Relevant Case Law To support my complaint, I cite the following legal precedents that reinforce the obligation of credit bureaus to conduct thorough and reasonable investigations : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX ) : This ruling establishes that credit bureaus must conduct reasonable investigations and can not rely solely on automated responses when a consumer disputes the accuracy of reported information. 
XXXX v. XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX Cir. XXXX ) : The court held that credit bureaus must go beyond data provided by the creditor and conduct additional verification when accuracy is in question. 
XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) : This case emphasizes the responsibility of information furnishers and credit bureaus to conduct exhaustive, non-superficial investigations under the FCRA. 
These cases consistently establish that credit reporting agencies must take reasonable steps to ensure the accuracy of information in credit reports and can not rely on automated responses when accuracy is challenged.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service

Consumer complaint narrative:
I WAS LEAD TO believe by the advertising of this company called CRYPTO.COM that it allows the patron to control, invest, deposit or withdraw funds such as bitcoin companies like XXXX  or XXXX XXXX. These two companies are developed and mined in the United States. I found out later, after I invested my money that CRYTO.COM is a foreign company base out of XXXX. They take your money, charge enormous fees and seize your money and do not allow the patron to invest in the bitcoin of their choice. Then they make it almost impossible to make withdraws back to your Bank account as your given ultimatums to sign their forms after you have already made several deposits. Then they seize your money for 180 days so they will use the patrons money to make money for themselves at interest rates very high and invest the patrons money in risky bitcoin. Then if their is a loss in the invest ment the patron losses their money, but if their is a large profit Crypto.com keeps the profit for themselves on a daily bases and pay the patron only 10 % on any funds left in their account aAT THE END OF THE 180 days, So you are lead to believe you have control of your own funds, that is, until the deposit is made then you basically lose all control of your invested funds and receive a Debit /Visa card in the mail two weeks later that you can not withdraw any funds from until 180 days later. 

So you have no control of your invested money and trying to get help or speak to a real person about your problem is difficult at best. After about 20 tries with the number they give and going through a difficult set of questions im told i will receive a phone call back or an ema I l of some type investigating the problem. 
However if you say to the machine that you are a new customer wanting to invest money, ha, well after about a 30 minute hold time your put through to a young man who speaks broken English only knows how to say " NO ''. 

He said my money was locked away and I could not withdrawn Any funds until 180 days later because he said the money was, " Stake funding ''. 

However, if their are any losses from the. investments of your funds you lose your money, as the money seems to deplete slowly at times and jumps back and forth- up & down. 

This company named CRYPTO.COM makes money regardless of the patrons losses or gain. So say at the end of the 180 days your {$5000.00} investment is down to say {$1500.00}. They promise to pay you 10 % of that balance for using your money!. And the young man said their was no way I could invest my own money or get my original investment of {$5000.00} back just days after I tried using their complicated format which leads the patron into unwittingly allowing CRYTO.COM full control of your money to invest or spend your money on reckless investments, which can lead to the loss of your entire funds. I feel like this is a new start up company and do not yet have the platform to invest anyone 's money. 
I really believe this company should be sanctioned from doing business in the United States as Older investors or military personnel could invest in this company that imitates an established investment brokerage company. 

Then when they are deployed and need their funds they would not have the ability to withdraw their funds. The funds would either tied up for 180 days or gone because of risky uneducated investing by novice unregistered brokers. Why? Because their bitcoin crypto platform is either not properly maintained or this company is seeking older novice investors or military personnel to use and scam the profitable high interest rates paid by high dollar XXXX 's!!!!

Product: Checking or savings account
Sub-issue: Banking errors
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to file a formal complaint against MidFirst Bank, which has subjected me to a series of deeply troubling and unethical practices that have caused significant financial and emotional harm. I am currently battling XXXX XXXX, which has made an already difficult situation even more unbearable. The following is a summary of my experience : Unjust Closure of My Claim : After I filed a legitimate claim, MidFirst Bank closed it within one business day without providing any explanation or documentation. This lack of transparency and accountability left me deeply frustrated. To my dismay, the bank later reopened the claim without my consent or involvement, further exacerbating the situation. 

Denial of Communication and Gaslighting : When I contacted customer service to seek clarification, I was met with outright denial. The representatives insisted that my claim had never been closed, which left me feeling completely gaslighted, as though my experience and concerns were of no importance to them. 

Disrespectful and Inhumane Treatment : During one phone call with a representative, who was aware the call was being recorded, I was subjected to laughter and mockery when I explained the distress I was facing, including my financial struggles and the very real threat of homelessness and frostbite. I had hoped for empathy from a professional institution, but instead, I was met with ridicule and a complete lack of compassion. 

Unnotified Account Closure : My account was closed suddenly, without any prior notice or communication from the bank. This left me unable to access the funds I desperately needed, including money to pay my rent. When I attempted to deposit cash directly into my account, I was refused, which resulted in additional fees and left me overdrawn with no means of resolving the situation. 

Discriminatory Treatment : The banks staff treated me with hostility and disdain, behavior which I believe to be discriminatory and unprofessional. This treatment has left me feeling not only financially destitute but also emotionally shattered, as if my dignity and well-being no longer matter to the institution. 

XXXX XXXX : In addition to the above, I am battling XXXX XXXX, a condition that has made dealing with this situation even more distressing. The emotional toll of this experience, combined with the physical toll of my XXXX, has left me feeling isolated and powerless. 

MidFirst Banks actions have not only caused significant financial harm but have also led to an emotional crisis. Their refusal to follow established procedures, coupled with their treatment of me as less than human, has shattered my trust in the banking system. I am seeking your intervention to investigate the matter and hold the bank accountable for its misconduct.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, NV XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, IA XXXX Subject : Follow-up Complaint Against ChexSystems, XXXX for FCRA XXXX XXXX Complaint # XXXX ) To Whom It XXXX Concern, This letter serves as a follow-up to my previous complaint ( Complaint # XXXX ) against ChexSystems, XXXX regarding their failure to comply with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) in relation to the fraudulent information reported by Bank of XXXX and XXXX Bank on my ChexSystems report XXXX Despite my previous complaint and the evidence provided, ChexSystems has failed to resolve the issue adequately. 

Background I am disputing fraudulent accounts linked to identity theft that occurred in XXXX, XXXX, XXXX years ago. I have submitted a valid FTC Identity Theft Report. 

However, ChexSystems has : - Labeled my dispute as frivolous and failed to investigate thoroughly. 
- Refused to block fraudulent trade lines despite the clear evidence of identity theft. 
- Requested unreasonable documentation ( a police report from XXXX authorities or a law enforcement-signed FTC Identity Theft Report ), which is not feasible for me to provide. 

Unreasonable Demands for Documentation - ChexSystems ' request for a police report from XXXX XXXX XXXX Police or a law enforcement-signed FTC Identity Theft Report is unreasonable, as the identity theft occurred outside of the XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX. It is impractical for a XXXX XXXX XXXX to sign an FTC report or provide a local police report for an international incident. This is a burden on consumers that should not be required, especially when an FTC Identity Theft Report is already available. 

FCRA XXXX ChexSystems actions continue to violate the FCRA in the following ways : Failure to Conduct a Reasonable Investigation ( FCRA 611 ) : - The company failed to reinvestigate properly, relying only on the information from the reporting institutions.

- Failure to Block Fraudulent Information ( FCRA 605B ) : ChexSystems has not acted on the FTC report and continues to require unnecessary documentation.

Failure to Ensure Accuracy ( FCRA 607 ( b ) ) : - The company has not ensured the accuracy and completeness of my consumer report, despite the evidence provided. 

Harm Caused The unresolved issues with my report continue to negatively impact my ability to open new financial accounts and have caused emotional and financial stress.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account status incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint regarding XXXX key issues involving inaccurate information that Truist Bank reported to the credit bureaus. These errors have significantly impacted my credit score and directly affected my ability to qualify for a Small Business Administration ( SBA ) loan that is essential for my business operations. Despite multiple attempts to resolve this with Truist Bank over the past XXXX months, I have not received any reasonable explanation or corrective action. Below is a detailed summary of the issues, including the actions I have taken and Truist 's responses. 
XXXX. Inaccurate Reporting of an Active Account as " Closed '' On or around XX/XX/year>, I discovered that XXXX of my active accounts with Truist Bank had been incorrectly reported as " closed '' to the major credit reporting agencies ( XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX ). This is factually incorrect because the account is still active, in good standing, and I continue to use it regularly. 
My Actions : I contacted Truist Bank as soon as I discovered this error. 
I provided clear, undeniable proof that the account was active and in use, including : Account statements showing regular activity and ongoing use. 
Screenshots and transaction records confirming the account is open and functional. 
Truist 's Response : Truist responded with a letter stating that " the disputed account information is accurate as reported '' and that " there are no changes necessary. '' This response was incorrect and dismissive, as the evidence I provided clearly showed that the account is still active and in use. 
Despite my efforts to escalate the matter, Truist has failed to correct the status of the account, which remains inaccurately reported as " closed '' on my credit report. 
Impact of This Error : This false reporting has caused a significant drop in my credit score, impacting my ability to obtain financing for my business. 
As a result, I was unable to qualify for an SBA loan that was critical for expanding my business operations. 
This delay has caused serious financial harm to my business and has put me in a position where I am unable to meet my business goals. 
XXXX. Refusal to Remove a Late Payment from a Secured Credit Card The second issue relates to a misunderstanding regarding an expired secured credit card that had a XXXX balance. After the card expired, I was unaware that an annual fee was still owed, as it was not clearly communicated by Truist. This led to a late payment being reported on my credit report. 
My Actions : As soon as I became aware of the balance, I made the payment in full immediately. 
I reached out to Truist Bank to request a " goodwill adjustment '' for the late payment. I explained that : The card had expired, and I believed I owed nothing, as the balance was XXXX. 
I had a strong history of on-time payments with Truist. 
I made the payment as soon as I realized the mistake. 
Truist 's Response : Truist issued a response stating that " the information you are disputing was furnished correctly '' and that they would not remove the late payment from my report. 
They did not acknowledge my long history of responsible payments or the goodwill request I made to have the late payment removed. 
I requested clarification of their policy on charging annual fees after a secured credit card expires, but Truist did not provide any explanation or documentation in response. 
Impact of This Error : This late payment was reported to all three major credit bureaus, causing a further drop in my credit score.

This, in combination with the false closed account status, has significantly limited my ability to access financing, particularly an SBA loan essential to my business operations.

The inability to secure this financing has caused serious financial hardship for my business, delaying important projects and creating unnecessary financial strain.

Summary of My Requests Correct the inaccurate " closed '' status of my active account and report it as " active '' to all credit bureaus.

Reconsider the removal of the late payment from my credit report, taking into account the context and my long history of responsible payment behavior.

Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern, My name is XXXX XXXX, and I am contacting you regarding an unauthorized hard inquiry that LIGHTSTREAM ( Bank ) initiated on my credit report, dated XX/XX/year>. I did not authorize this inquiry, nor have I ever applied for credit or initiated any relationship with your organization. 

Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( f ), it is unlawful for any entity to access a consumers credit report without a permissible purpose. Since I have neither provided consent nor engaged in any transactions with LIGHTSTREAM ( Bank ) that would justify this inquiry, this constitutes a violation of the FCRA.

FCRA Violations : 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( f ) Prohibits unauthorized access to a consumer 's credit report without explicit authorization or a legitimate business purpose.

15 U.S.C. 1681n Allows for statutory damages of up to {$1000.00} per violation, in addition to punitive damages for willful noncompliance.

15 U.S.C. 1681o Provides for recovery of actual damages caused by negligent noncompliance. 
The unauthorized inquiry by LIGHTSTREAM ( Bank ) has negatively impacted my credit report, potentially affecting my ability to secure credit and leading to undue stress and inconvenience.

My Demands : Immediate Removal of Inquiry : I demand the removal of the unauthorized inquiry from all credit reports where it appears.

Compensation for Statutory Damages : In accordance with the FCRA, I am entitled to {$1000.00} as statutory damages for this violation. I am willing to accept this amount to resolve the matter amicably. 
Agreement with Non-Admittance Clause : I am open to signing an agreement where LIGHTSTREAM ( Bank ) does not admit to wrongdoing, provided that my demands are met in full. 
Notice of Litigation Costs : Should LIGHTSTREAM ( Bank ) fail to resolve this matter within 30 days, I will have no choice but to pursue legal action to enforce my rights under the FCRA. If litigation becomes necessary, I will also seek recovery of actual damages, statutory damages, punitive damages, and attorney fees. Below is an estimated breakdown of litigation costs that your organization may incur : Litigation Expense Estimated Cost Attorney Fees ( Pre-Trial ) {$10000.00} - {$15000.00} Court Filing Fees {$500.00} Discovery Costs ( Depositions, etc. ) {$5000.00} - {$7500.00} Expert Witness Fees ( if applicable ) {$3000.00} - {$5000.00} Travel and Miscellaneous Expenses {$2000.00} Total Estimated Litigation Costs {$20000.00} - {$30000.00} By addressing this matter now, LIGHTSTREAM ( Bank ) can avoid the unnecessary expense of litigation and potential reputational harm. 

Correspondence Request : For privacy and security reasons, I request that all correspondence regarding this dispute be conducted exclusively via email at XXXX. I do not feel safe corresponding by phone or traditional mail. 

Supporting Documentation : Enclosed, please find : A copy of my government-issued identification for verification purposes. 
A copy of the relevant credit report showing the unauthorized inquiry by LIGHTSTREAM ( Bank ).

Resolution Timeline : Please confirm receipt of this letter and respond with a resolution within 30 days of receiving this dispute. If no resolution is reached within the specified timeframe, I will escalate this matter as outlined above. 

I trust LIGHTSTREAM ( Bank ) will address this matter promptly and in good faith to avoid further complications. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Mortgage
Issue: Applying for a mortgage or refinancing an existing mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
As a first time home buyer, I was looking for a house in XXXX. I ended up with XXXX XXXX and they routed me to one of their preferred lenders US Bank. I went with them for pre-approval for signing the purchase agreement with the builder in the month of XXXX. I was given initial disclosure on the loan estimate on XX/XX/XXXX though their promised lender credit missing. For every question I asked, there were no clear explanation given on credits not being applied. The interest rate offered for my credit score was 3.875 % In the month of XXXX, they re-opened my loan file. I kept asking them for the new interest rate and the revised loan estimate to do rate shopping. The lender never gave the revised loan estimate and stopped me from rate shopping. They said my credit score would drop and I would not be eligible for the loan program. Inspite of that I went ahead with rate shopping with one of the other preferred lender of the builder XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX with my initial disclosure form US bank. Immediately US bank ordered the appraisal without giving me any room for rate  discussion. I found out XXXX was offering good MI for 3.25 % interest rate. US bank said they can give the same interest rate but never bothered about the MI and also said I will lose my appraisal amount. On XX/XX/XXXX I got the Loan estimate from XXXX and gave it to US bank to check if they can beat the rate and MI. On XX/XX/XXXX, US bank came up with loan estimate with 3.125 % interest rate still with high MI. So I decided to proceed with XXXX and inform the builder the same. XXXX repriced the rate and gave back lot of credits so less Cash to close with a difference of $ XXXXmonth on MI from US bank. In the mean time, US bank kept me in immense stress everyday by not replying emails and answering calls. They said they can not pull the credit report again. If they pull it, then would be able to match XXXX   MI.To keep me with US bank, they promised they will give 2.875 % interest rate so that they can match the XXXX MI as US bank MI couldn't be changed.

This is when US bank started with the plot. They changed the loan program from 97 % conventional to Home possible from XXXX XXXX.I never knew that it has a income limit. Later understood it was a plot to hook me up with a wrong program under lucrative interest rate. I dropped from XXXX and informed the builder I will be going with US bank. US bank again started playing the games on the loan estimate. Without my consent, they charged points to bring down the rates to 2.875 % and the rate was locked. US Bank management didn't agree to give me back the charged amount in the closing costs. Cash to close kept creeping up and they didn't heed to any of the closing costs concerns. 

As the bank was preparing all the documents for the closing date XXXX XXXX, On XX/XX/XXXX there was a sudden inquiry in my credit report. I called equifax to see who made the query. They said it was made by US bank. And it was done with no prior information and without my consent. I asked US bank why don't they fix the MI then, since they have latest report. I kept the file in pending status. I was informed the file will be ready on Monday which is the closing date.

I asked my wife to take off from her work. There was no reply from US bank on Monday other than underwriter is still looking into the file.No response to emails or calls as usual to keep us under immense stress. I asked my wife to take another day off hoping that it will be completed the next day. There was no response and finally Tuesday evening and said I am no longer eligible for the loan program because of the income limit. So they have to give the interest rate as on date with higher MI than before. I was in deep distress since they said rate lock is not valid under the old program. They said they will check with their management. 

They never responded back till Friday. I informed my apartment that I will move out in the weekend. They had a new tenant signed for my rest of the lease, so I didn't have any rent obligation for the rest of the lease. With the delay going on closing the loan, I was forced to change the move out date. The Apartment office called me and said, they lost the tenant with change in dates, so its my obligation to pay the rent for the rest of the months. 

I decided to check with XXXX if they went with right Loan program. They said they have gone with correct loan program and they are still with same interest rate and same MI.I was happy to move with them. Even then US bank instead of giving the promised rate, asked me to cancel XXXX application so that they can close the house with promising any any change in the interest rate/MI/Closing costs. 

Somebody should stop these kind of unethical practices of US bank and compensate me for the losses and all the stress I have gone through.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
" The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence, which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system.

So whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of my privacy with my consumer report, since I control what is listed and what is not. I am writing to you regarding a debt that your agency claims I owe. In accordance with my rights under federal law, specifically IS USC 1692g of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I am requesting that you provide me with written validation of this debt. 
This includes, but is not limited to, the following information : 1. The amount of the debt.

2. The name of the original creditor.

3. A detailed explanation of the debt, including any interest, fees, or other charges.

Under 15 USC 1692g, I am entitled to receive this validation before I can consider
any payment. Until you provide this information, I am requesting that all collection activities cease.

Additionally, I would like to draw your attention to 15 USC 1681q of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), which prohibits the use of false pretenses to obtain consumer credit information. 
Any attempt to falsely claim a debt or to misrepresent the details of the debt would be a violation of this statute and could result in legal consequences for your agency. 
Please treat this letter as a formal dispute of the debt in question. 
Furthermore, I am requesting that you cease all communication with me regarding this matter until you have provided the requested validation. All future communications should be in writing and sent to the address listed above. 
I expect to receive this validation within 30 days of the date of this letter. Failure to provide proper validation will result in my pursuing all available legal remedies to protect my rights. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter

Time and effort spent disputing the false account. 
Emotional distress from dealing with inaccurate credit reporting. 

Under the FCRA and FDCPA, I am entitled to statutory damages of up to {$1000.00} per violation, in addition to actual damages for financial harm and emotional distress. Based on these violations, I am demanding a settlement of {$2000.00} for the harm caused by your unlawful reporting practices. 

Next Steps I request that XXXX remedy this issue within XXXX  days of receiving this letter by : XXXX. Paying the requested settlement of {$2000.00} XXXX. Immediately removing the inaccurate account from my credit report.

Pursuing legal action under the FCRA and FDCPA, where I may seek additional damages, including punitive damages for willful noncompliance.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I was out of the country in XXXX, the day of the XXXX of XXXX I was in an incident where I was XXXX, assaulted, and all my belongings were removed, to include a silver necklace, silver bracelet, a gold guess watch, a white gold/white gold with three diamonds ring, a white gold with a ruby stone ring, my US passport , a hat, a back pack with earbuds, glasses, and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, my wallet that contained my California ID , my ATM card from Wells Fargo , a Credit Card from Wells Fargo , and a credit Card from XXXX. 

I was unfortunately XXXX  during my birthday celebration, I was found XXXX  on the streets by the local police and was taken to a nearby hospital, upon waking up ( about 8 - 10 hours later ) I opened my eyes to be found in a hospital bed, not knowing how I got there. 

The Hospital did a XXXX XXXX  and determined that I was XXXX, the report from the hospital talks about how and what condition I was found I mentioned this as this is the reason for the complaint against Wells Fargo, during the time I was on the hospital and after with no phone, no money, and access to my accounts, the people who XXXX  me got into my bank accounts ( business XXXX XXXX, XXXX, personal Account, and my Wells Fargo Credit Card, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX ) and drained my accounts to XXXX in less than 24 hours. I was not able to get back into the states until I was able to get an emergency passport from the US Embassy in XXXX XXXX. 

Upon my arrival in XXXX XXXX, the very first thing I did was to visit my local bank on XX/XX/year>, where I filed multiple complaints for fraudulent activity. 

I showed up at the branch, and while I waited to be seeing, I also was on the phone filing my claims, ( I probably spend over 3 hours at the branch ) Ive explained my situation to the person on the phone ( multiple people ) and to the banker ( XXXX XXXX ). My bank accounts were all drained ( {$16.00}, XXXX from my business account, {$1400.00} from my personal account, $ XXXX from my credit card ), and there numerous transactions back and forth between my credit card, personal account, and business account. 

It was determined that indeed there was fraudulent activity, and the branch requested copies of the reports which were rendered and provided to the branch ( a copy of my police report, hospital report, copy of my emergency passport ) to only find out on the XXXX of this XXXX that the claims department never received the full story and never received any of my reports. 

On this day my bank accounts and credit card were closed, and new accounts ( business and personal ) and credit card were open. This was on XXXX of XXXX, Ive left with the instructions that the bank will open an investigation. Come the XXXX, I could not access my online banking, and was asked to go back to the branch so they can verify me. I was not able to get into the branch until the XXXX of XXXX and unfortunately there was not much to be done as the department that could help me was closed and was asked to come back on Monday. I came back and that was another lengthy visit to the branch as I was somehow flagged in the system as XXXX  and therefore I had no access to my online banking. The banker at the branch spent a lot of time trying to get an answer for me and was not able to get anywhere and the branch manager got involved. It took over 12 people to get my situation figured out, there was a huge lack of incompetence at the customer service level, where we were being bounced back between tech, XXXX, and online department. As a matter of fact, the branch manager was also frustrated with the lack of service from her own company and filed several complaints on my behalf. Nevertheless, my only access was finally granted, and now it was a matter of waiting on the response from their investigation into my numerous claims. 

As the days went by, I had not received any new ATMs for my personal and business, or even a new credit card. I came to find out again someone dropped the ball as those never requested to begin with, again the level of incompetence and attention to detail to my matter and or case. Now, all these are the least of my worries, I was very surprised to see correspondence from the bank saying that they did their investigation and found that the transaction was authorized and therefore did not find any fraudulent activity. I immediately called customer service to inquire as to why they closed the case and came to find out that one they will not re-open and two they had never received the details of information I had given to numerous people over the phone or at the branch level and said they never received the documents, banking up my case. 

I feel that they have not done their due diligence and investigated this matter as if they should or give this the level of importance that they should be. To begin with they could clearly see that the activity that took place on the XXXX has never happened on my account, to completely clear my account to zero and not just my personal also my business. If someone was truly investigating this with the back up documentation and with the type of activity they would clearly see this was fraud and my money should be protected. Never have I done in less than 24 hours ( probably even less than that ) have Ive done one wire transfer, nine XXXX transaction, moving money from my personal to business, from my personal to my credit card, from my business to my personal, looking at ways to just drained my account. 

As a consumer, and a victim of fraud, being XXXX, and assaulted, I am requesting some help and assistance in recouping what was taken from me, and at the minimum a fair review and investigation. 

I am requesting a further and in-depth review, and for all my money, if not some, to be returned to me under the protection and insurance that the bank has for its customers. The bank has been unresponsive, with lack of competence and little to no attention to this matter.

The Fair Debt Collection Practices Act was created to ensure that laws and procedures are in place to protect consumers from abusive, deceptive, and unfair practices by debt collectors. In this case, the company has violated 15 U.S. Code 1692f, which prohibits debt collectors from using unfair or unconscionable means to collect a debt. Specifically, they can not collect any amounts that arent explicitly authorized by the agreement or allowed by law. Additionally, the company has violated 15 U.S. Code 1692e, which prohibits the use of false, deceptive, or misleading representations in debt collection efforts. This includes using deceptive methods to collect a debt or gather consumer information. Moreover, they are forbidden from contacting consumers at inconvenient times or places, or engaging in behavior that harasses or abuses consumers. 

In this case, the company has harassed me by claiming I owe a debt that I do not recognize as my responsibility. They have also contacted me at inconvenient times and places, in violation of the law.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Information belongs to someone else
Consumer complaint narrative: These are not my accounts. This is the 2nd time that I have had to dispute this information. Please follow the laws of the FCRA ... ..a ) Block. Except as otherwise provided in this section, a consumer reporting agency shall block the reporting of any information in the file of a consumer that the consumer identifies as information that resulted from an alleged identity theft, not later than 4 business days after the date of receipt by such agency of ( 1 ) appropriate proof of the identity of the consumer ; ( 2 ) a copy of an identity theft report ; ( 3 ) the identification of such information by the consumer ; and ( 4 ) a statement by the consumer that the information is not information relating to any transaction by the consumer. ( b ) Notification. A consumer reporting agency shall promptly notify the furnisher of information identified by the consumer under subsection ( a ) of this section ( 1 ) that the information may be a result of identity theft ; ( 2 ) that an identity theft report has been filed ; ( 3 ) that a block has been requested under this section ; and ( 4 ) of the effective dates of the block. ( c ) Authority to decline or rescind. ( 1 ) In general. A consumer reporting agency may decline to block, or may rescind any block, of information relating to a consumer under this section, if the consumer reporting agency reasonably determines that ( A ) the information was blocked in error or a block was requested by the consumer in error ; ( B ) the information was blocked, or a block was requested by the consumer, on the basis of a material misrepresentation of fact by the consumer relevant to the request to block ; or ( C ) the consumer obtained possession of goods, services, or money as a result of the blocked transaction or transactions. ( 2 ) Notification to consumer. If a block of information is declined or rescinded under this subsection, the affected consumer shall be notified promptly, in the same manner as consumers are notified of the reinsertion of information under section 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( B ) of this title. ( 3 ) Significance of block. For purposes of this subsection, if a consumer reporting agency rescinds a block, the presence of information in the file of a consumer prior to the blocking of such information is not evidence of whether the consumer knew or should have known that the consumer obtained possession of any goods, services, or money as a result of the block. ( d ) Exception for resellers. ( 1 ) No reseller file. This section shall not apply to a consumer reporting agency, if the consumer reporting agency ( A ) is a reseller ; ( B ) is not, at the time of the request of the consumer under subsection ( a ) of this section, otherwise furnishing or reselling a consumer report concerning the information identified by the consumer ; and ( C ) informs the consumer, by any means, that the consumer may report the identity theft to the Bureau to obtain consumer information regarding identity theft. ( 2 ) Reseller with file. The sole obligation of the consumer reporting agency under this section, with regard to any request of a consumer under this section, shall be to block the consumer report maintained by the consumer reporting agency from any subsequent use, if ( A ) the consumer, in accordance with the provisions of subsection ( a ) of this section, identifies, to a consumer reporting agency, information in the file of the consumer that resulted from identity theft ; and ( B ) the consumer reporting agency is a reseller of the identified information. ( 3 ) Notice. In carrying out its obligation under paragraph ( 2 ), the reseller shall promptly provide a notice to the consumer of the decision to block the file. Such notice shall contain the name, address, and telephone number of each consumer reporting agency from which the consumer information was obtained for resale. ( e ) Exception for verification companies. The provisions of this section do not apply to a check services company, acting as such, which issues authorizations for the purpose of approving or processing negotiable instruments, electronic fund transfers, or similar methods of payments, except that, beginning 4 business days after receipt of information described in paragraphs ( 1 ) through ( 3 ) of subsection ( a ) of this section, a check services company shall not report to a national consumer reporting agency described in section 1681a ( p ) of this title, any information identified in the subject identity theft report as resulting from identity theft. ( f ) Access to blocked information by law enforcement agencies. No provision of this section shall be construed as requiring a consumer reporting agency to prevent a Federal, State, or local law enforcement agency from accessing blocked information in a consumer file to which the agency could otherwise obtain access under this subchapter.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Issue: Managing, opening, or closing your mobile wallet account
Consumer complaint narrative:
I opened an account with coinbase in order to purchase and store bitcoins. After purchasing bitcoins, I was able to safely store them in a digital wallet and, more securely, in a digital vault. 
In order to verify withdrawal transactions from the vault that I had created, I was asked to list a secondary e-mail address as confirmation. I have since lost access to this secondary e-mail address and have not been able to withdrawal my funds from the digital vault to my digital wallet on coinbase. 
I have e-mailed them numerous times asking if this issue can be resolved. In reply, I was told that they would be able to safely transfer my funds from my vault to my wallet and that they were working on the issue. It has been over 3 months now and I am still waiting for them to resolve this issue.

Subject : Third Complaint to CFBP : Experians Non-Compliance with Section 605C of the Fair Credit Reporting Act Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), I am filing this third complaint regarding Experians repeated failure to comply with Section 605C of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Despite my multiple submissions of the required documentation as a victim of human trafficking, Experian continues to deny my request to block adverse information from my credit file.

Specifically, I have provided : A self-attestation letter signed by both myself and an authorized officer from an authorized agency.

A victim determination letter, also signed by myself and the authorized agency.

These documents have been submitted to Experian on three or four separate occasions. While both XXXX and XXXX accepted the same documentation and blocked the adverse information as required under Section 605C, Experian has refused to do so. This has caused significant inconsistencies across my credit reports and continues to harm my financial standing. 

Experian has repeatedly sent me identical, automated responses, despite my compliance with all legal requirements for exercising my rights under the FCRA. It appears there has been no meaningful human review of my case, yet the only denial reason they give is for me to submit a victim determination letter even though I have sent it to them on numerous occasions I respectfully request that the CFPB : 1. Investigate the methods and tools Experian is using to determine its denial of my request to block adverse information.

2. Require Experian to conduct a human review of my case, as their automated responses fail to address the merits of my documentation and circumstances.

3. Ensure Experian complies with its obligations under Section 605C of the FCRA, as both XXXX and XXXX have already done. 

As a victim of trafficking, I should not be subjected to this repeated and unjust denial of my rights, especially after providing all required documentation multiple times. I urge the CFPB to intervene and hold Experian accountable for its obligations under the law. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

To Whom it may concern, I am writing to formally request the removal of unauthorized inquiries and any unfavorable credit marks from my credit report, which I believe are the result of a data breach involving my personal information. As a victim of this breach, I assert my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and request that you investigate and remove these unauthorized inquiries and inaccuracies immediately.

Upon reviewing my credit report, I discovered several unauthorized inquiries and/or negative marks that I did not initiate, in addition to XXXX accounts that are currently in a collection status should be removed from my credit report. 

I suspect that the inquiries are the results of a data breach which has compromised my personal and financial information, and the inaccurate account statuses for LVNV Funding LLC and XXXX XXXX which are both being reported inaccurate. 

The items in question include : XXXX. Unauthorized Inquiries : a. XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX XXXX  b. XX/XX/XXXX, XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX Unfavorable Credit Marks  ( Collections ) a. LVNV Funding LLC- opened XX/XX/XXXX. 
b. XXXX XXXX opened XX/XX/XXXX. 

As a result of these unauthorized inquiries and data breaches, my personal information was accessed without my consent and was likely used to generate these unauthorized inquiries and potentially alter my credit status. Under the FCRA and 15 USC 1681 credit law, I have the right to dispute inaccurate information or fraudulent information on my credit report and request that such information be removed. 

I respectfully request the following : XXXX. Immediate Removal of Unauthorized Inquiries : Please remove any inquiries that were not authorized by me. These inquiries were likely the result of identity theft or a data breach. 
XXXX. Correction of Unfavorable Credit Marks : Any accounts or marks that were negatively impacted by the data breach should be corrected or removed, as they were not caused by any action of mine. 
XXXX. Investigation and Documentation : Please conduct a thorough investigation into the source of the unauthorized inquiries and credit marks and provide me with the written documentation confirming the result of your investigation. 
XXXX. Fraud Alert of Credit Freeze : I also request that a fraud alert or credit freeze be placed on my credit file to prevent any further unauthorized access while this matter is being resolved. In addition to this, I am also requesting a copy of the original signed contract ( s ) or agreement ( s ) that created the alleged debts, a complete and accurate account statement detailing the debt, including any payments made and charges added, and any other supporting documents providing that I owe tha alleged debts. 

Enclosed are copies of documents that support my claims, including a copy of my credit report highlighting the unauthorized inquiries and negative marks. 

Please conduct a full investigation in accordance with the FCRA and notify me of your findings and any corrective actions taken. I expect a resolution within the XXXX period required by law. Should you require any additional information or documentation from me to facilitate this process, please let me know. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your timely response and the removal of the inaccurate information from my credit report.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
