I asked them to submit me the investigation for the bankruptcy and confirm from original creditor and they still haven't provide the information on the XXXX  that was discharged from : Name : XXXXXXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> Section 611 of the FCRA ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ), which outlines the process for disputing the accuracy of information. 

Results of the Reinvestigation : The CRA must provide you with the results of their investigation in writing. If the investigation confirms the accuracy of the information, they must include a summary of the investigation.

Access to the Report : If you request it, the CRA must provide you with details about the investigation, including the contact information of the original creditor or data furnisher who verified the disputed information. 

Section 623 of the FCRA ( 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ) : This section outlines the responsibilities of information furnishers ( including original creditors ) : Subsection ( b ) : If a furnisher receives notice of a dispute from a CRA, they are required to : Investigate the dispute. 
Review all relevant information provided by the CRA. 
Report the results of the investigation back to the CRA. 
Correct or delete inaccurate or unverified information.

Follow-Up : I continued to follow up with Experian to seek updates on the status of their investigation. As of today, I have not received a detailed explanation or evidence supporting their verification of these accounts. 

Request for Detailed Investigation : I have requested detailed insights into the credit verification process by Experian, including steps taken, identity verification methods, the involvement of original creditors, and a comprehensive investigative report. 

Desired Resolution I request that the CFPB facilitate the following outcomes in collaboration with Experian : Immediate correction or deletion of the disputed accounts from my credit report based on verified investigation results.

Assurance that my rights under the FCRA are respected and upheld throughout this process.

Guidance on further steps, including legal options, if Experian fails to comply with federal regulations regarding credit report accuracy. 
Additional Information Given the lawsuits recently filed against Experian by the CFPB on XX/XX/XXXX, it is imperative that Experian engage in transparent practices and comply with the required standards of consumer protection and credit reporting.

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Charged too much interest
Consumer complaint narrative:
Elan Financial Services, the provider for my business XXXX through XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXas unjustly charged me {$70.00} in interest on XX/XX/XXXX. This XXXX XXXX on Purchases fee is dated/posted XX/XX/XXXX, yet it did not appear on my XXXX bill which last transaction was posted XX/XX/XXXX. They slipped in this unjustified charge without me seeing it. I discovered it over last weekend when I happened to log in online to look at recent charges. Elan is determined to get some interest from me since for the past 2 years 10 months I have had this business Visa through them, I have always paid my balance off each month in full. Never has there been yet even {$1.00} balance left unpaid. 
I called Elan on this wrong interest charge yesterday. XXXX XXXX XXXX said it was for XXXX days late on the XXXX bill payment that was due XXXX XXXX. Let me explain that this was still unjustified. First, let me note the fact, as my previous statements revealed, that they did the same thing to me in XX/XX/XXXX with an unjustified Interest charge of {$70.00}, when my payment was not late. They were hoping that charged wrongfully slipped in that I would not catch. But I did catch it and I called then about that interest charge, and the XXXX waived it and credited back to me. If it was a justified charge, they would not have credited back to me. Now 13 months forward, they did the same thing but this time they did not waive it. Why is it unjustified? CSRs claim was it was based on the payment be late 3 days. But she admitted it was received on Mon. XXXX XXXX. So XXXX XXXX should not be counted as a day. Second, the day before is a Sunday, and XXXX is closed on Sunday. Sunday should not be counted either, for this is penalizing customers for the business being closed on Sunday! Thirdly, the fact is, I mailed this bill by XXXX on Monday XXXX XXXX. And it should have arrived by XXXX. It is clear that XXXX is trying to get some unjustified interest money from me. Lastly, the balance of this XXXX bill due XXXX XXXX was {$1600.00}. It plain wrong to charge {$70.00} of interest for a bill the could have been 2 days late ( but XXXX not even have been late and this could be a sheer corruption charge. And this corruption needs to be reported to the CFPB. 
After this gets settled, I will be securing credit with another financial institution and canceling this account with XXXX.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX # XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/scrub> 2025 XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, MO XXXX Subject : Formal Dispute of Student Loan Due to FERPA Violation and Unauthorized Third-Party Access Dear XXXX Loan Servicing, I am writing to formally dispute the validity of my student loan ( s ) due to a violation of my rights under the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act ( FERPA ), 20 U.S.C. 1232g. FERPA strictly prohibits the disclosure of student educational records without written consent, yet I have reason to believe that my personal and financial records were unlawfully accessed by unauthorized third parties, including XXXX XXXX andXX/XX/XXXX) -related entities. 

Upon investigation, I have found that : 1. Unauthorized Third-Party Access : My personal and financial student records appear to have been improperly accessed, shared, or utilized by individuals and/or organizations with whom I did not consent to share my information. This includes entities affiliated with XXXX XXXX andXX/XX/XXXX 


2. Breach of Privacy Rights : I was never informed of, nor did I consent to, the release of my educational data to these third parties. This is a direct violation of FERPA regulations.

3. Compromised Loan Agreement : If my student loan was issued or influenced by parties who illegally obtained my educational data, then its legitimacy and enforceability are in serious question.

Requested Actions : In light of this FERPA violation and unauthorized third-party access, I demand the following immediate actions : A complete audit and review of my student loan records, including how my data was obtained and whether it was improperly shared.

A written response within 30 days acknowledging my dispute and detailing the steps you will take to remedy this violation.

If my records were accessed in violation of FERPA, I demand the immediate cancellation and discharge of my student loan ( s ) as they were obtained under legally questionable circumstances.

If this matter is not resolved promptly, I am prepared to escalate my complaint to the U.S. Department of Educations Family Policy Compliance Office ( FPCO ), file a formal legal complaint, and pursue further action against the involved parties.

I expect a prompt and fair resolution to this issue. Please provide a written response by XX/XX/year>2025. You may contact me at XXXX or XXXX if you require further details. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt is not yours
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/year> Credit Collection Serv XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Dear Credit Collection Serv, I am writing in response to this you regarding the alleged debt referenced as account number XXXX. I hereby formally dispute the validity of this debt under my rights pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692c, and request that you provide proper validation.

Under 15 U.S.C. 1692c, I demand that you cease all further communication with me regarding this matter, except for the purpose of providing written validation of the alleged debt as required by law. Please note that any further communication beyond this purpose may constitute a violation of FDCPA and result in legal action. 

To properly validate this debt, I request the following : 1. Proof that I owe the debt, including the name and address of original creditor.

2. A detailed account of the alleged amount, including all interest, fees, and charges applied.

3. Documentation proving that you have the legal authority to collect this debt.

Until proper validation is provided, I request that all collection efforts cease. 
Additionally, I request that you refrain from reporting this disputed debt to any credit reporting agencies. Failure to comply with this request may also constitute a violation of my rights under the FDCPA.

Please respond to this letter within 30 days of receipt. I will retain a copy of this letter and your response for my records. Should you fail to provide the requested validation, I reserve the right to file a complaint with the Federal Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), As well as pursue any other remedies available to me under the law. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Issue: Unauthorized transactions or other transaction problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
I, XXXX XXXX XXXX, declare and attest under penalty of perjury under the laws of the State of California, including false statements, perjury, and claims estoppel, that the following statements and events are true, accurate, and correctly stated without any omission or misrepresentation. I make this statement to the best of my knowledge and abilities and do not do so under duress or to unjustly gain any products or services mentioned or itemized in the attached evidence : Unauthorized Charges : I have identified unauthorized charges on my credit card accounts. I have not received any products or services corresponding to these charges. I did not sign up for, approve, or knowingly allow anyone to use my credit cards for these transactions. 

Lost/Stolen Device : One of my two personal telephones was recently lost or stolen while traveling. I have no idea who has it but did notice, according to the device activity, that someone has accessed the device while it was not in my possession. I keep two devices, one for work and one for personal use. While I use a password manager, LastPass, to securely store my passwords, I try to keep my PIN numbers memorized. However, having access to my phone would allow someone to circumvent two-step authentication by receiving text messages. It appears that most of the online charges were made with a debit card, which does not require the PIN. 

Viruses and Malware : Several viruses and malware were discovered and quarantined by the antivirus software on my computer, which was syncing with my phone. 

XXXX Account Breach : My XXXX account was also taken over. The perpetrators attempted to list items and make purchases under my name, directing these activities to my XXXX account, which they also accessed. XXXX noticed these unauthorized activities immediately and locked them out of my account. I do not know the details of what they did on XXXX during the period they had access or how XXXX became aware of the breach, but I am surprised that no banks alerted me or questioned the out-of-pattern transactions that XXXX noticed immediately. 

Mailbox Break-In : My mailbox was broken into and has since been repaired. See the attached photo of the mailbox destruction. I have no idea how or why they managed to do this or why they would target my mailbox. It is strange because a few times there has been a strange person sitting in the hallway outside of my apartment. When I asked him what he was doing there, he said his girlfriend kicked him out. This seems very sketchy to me. The building is a secure building and requires a key for every door and the elevators. You can not access my floor without a key, the same with the mailbox area. I have never seen him before and know many of my neighbors. 

Immediate Actions : Upon discovering the unauthorized charges, I immediately checked all my credit card accounts, made a list of all the unauthorized charges, and began the process of canceling the affected credit cards. Based on recommendations, I have also created new email addresses, reset all passwords, and performed factory resets on all my devices to prevent further unauthorized access. 

Reporting and Legal Compliance : I have reported these unauthorized charges to my credit card companies and relevant authorities as promptly and efficiently as possible given the circumstances. I have acted to the best of my abilities in addressing this issue and have followed the prudent course of actions prescribed by law. 

Legal Rights and Timeliness : Considering that I am within the 60-day period from the date of the statements containing the unauthorized charges, and given the extenuating circumstances in my life, including moving and being involved in a contentious legal matter, I can not be held liable for these charges. According to the Fair Credit Billing Act ( FCBA ), 15 U.S.C. 1666, and California Civil Code 1747.50, I have reported these unauthorized charges within the legally required timeframe. The case law, such as Regulation Z, 12 C.F.R. 226.12 ( b ), supports that I am not liable for unauthorized use if I notify the issuer within a reasonable time after learning of the loss or theft of the card. Additionally, the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) and Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) provide guidelines that protect consumers from being held liable for unauthorized charges if reported within the stipulated time frame. 

Bank Fraud Protection Guarantees : I am aware that several financial institutions, including XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX XXXX XXXX, offer fraud protection guarantees which assure that consumers are not held liable for unauthorized transactions if reported promptly. I have adhered to these policies by reporting the unauthorized charges as soon as they were discovered, thereby invoking the protection guaranteed by these institutions. 

XXXX XXXX  XXXX and cerulean bank both found in my favor. XXXX XXXX XXXX decided to collude with XXXX aka Skrill a payment processor and forged evidence. XXXX submitted the forgery to XXXX XXXX  XXXX who with me identified that it was fraud on XXXX XXXX part. XXXX admitted this and indicated they colluded with XXXX and XXXX. They proceeded to immediately refund the transactions after we caught them. They were dispicable to do this. I will never trust that company again. 

XXXX then tried to make it appears as they were attempting to refund the transactions to my XXXX account ; however, it was not known to me until later that they were colluding with XXXX because when I asked XXXX to refund the money to an account I had control of as the prevailing law dictates they refused. They then stopped talking to me and became very hostile. They attempted three times to refund the transactions, but it was no real because they knew XXXX was going to block them and not permit the refund. 

XXXX after being found out rather than make things right because they had taken such server actions against me decided to double down. They closed the account and declined to allow the refunds to be returned from XXXX. they froze and liquidated assets and caused sever distress and forced me to take over XXXX in losses from the fact that stocks and crypto were down when they forced the sales. that is absolutely horrific and nearly drove me to XXXX I was unable to pay bills or even access any of my money because of what these companies did. As it turns out this was all related to various data breaches and the company knows what they were doing was wrong and they knew that bad actors had been compromising their systems for months.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally file a complaint against Experian Information Solutions , Inc. for violating the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically FCRA Section 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) and other relevant provisions related to the mishandling of consumer credit data. 

Upon reviewing my credit report, I discovered that Experian Information Solutions XXXX Inc. accessed and/or sold my personal credit information without my consent or a permissible purpose as outlined under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). This unauthorized action has negatively impacted my financial privacy and may have exposed me to potential risks such as identity theft, unsolicited financial offers, or other unauthorized uses of my personal data. 

FCRA Violations Experienced : 1. Unauthorized Sale/Access of My Credit Information Under FCRA Section 604 , consumer reporting agencies are prohibited from selling or sharing credit information without a permissible purpose ( e.g., employment screening, credit applications, insurance underwriting ). I have discovered unauthorized inquiries and/or data sharing related to my credit file, which I did not authorize. 
2. Failure to Conduct Proper Investigations ( FCRA Section 611 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) I disputed inaccurate information with Experian, but instead of conducting a reasonable investigation, the company failed to provide proper documentation or remove the incorrect data, violating my rights under FCRA Section 611. 

According to FCRA Section 604, consumer reporting agencies and third parties may only access or sell consumer reports for specific permissible purposes, such as : Employment screening Credit applications Insurance underwriting Account review by a current creditor I did not authorize or initiate any transaction that would justify this inquiry or data sale. Therefore, I am requesting the CFPB to investigate this matter and take appropriate action for violating my rights under the FCRA.

USAA does not have any local branches where I live and the only means of banking I can do with them is via their mobile application. I've been a customer with USAA for over XXXX  years and have never had any issues using the mobile application or completing necessary banking transactions like depositing checks. The amounts of the checks differed, with XXXX being a union payroll check for {$150.00}, a class action settlement check for {$10.00}, and a financial aid check for {$5300.00}. I deposited all three, following USAA 's instructions and adding required notation on the back of each check. Once completed, I was notified that the financial aid check 's total amount would not be immediately available, with a little less than half being held while the check cleared. As stated previously, USAA has no local branch in my state and as they are my primary banking institution, I have no immediate course of action to remedy if something doesn't work out. In addition, this is not the first financial aid check I've deposited with USAA from the same educational institution. This is, however, the first time a deposit failed to post. I discovered on XX/XX/year> that the union payroll check and financial aid checks were both rejected by USAA. No reason was given for why the checks were rejected and USAA stated that we ( my wife and I ) were fully responsible for any fees associated with the rejected checks. Further, USAA stated that any hazard or liability born by using their mobile deposit system rested solely on us, the end user.

Issue: Identity theft protection or other monitoring services
Sub-issue: Received unwanted marketing or advertising
Consumer complaint narrative: My personally identifiable information was breached intentionally when USAA ( United Services Automobile Association ) acted in an unfair, deceptive or unlawful way to obtain information regarding my husband who passed in XX/XX/XXXX. Specifically, XX/XX/XXXX, I received an unsolicited, short " generic form '' letter from USAA Survivor Relations Team offering " premature '' condolences ( I didn't contact them whatsoever ), for additional services they offered ; executors, trustees, etc. This is a shocking revelation from an insurance company I only have auto/homeowners insurance with. Deeply troubled by USAA 's heartless, deceptive invasion of my privacy, I contacted USAA Survivor Relations Team to speak with the originator of the letter : " XXXX XXXX '' only to be transferred to " XXXX '' ( call center ) who informed me that in tandem with the Social Security Office they were contacted by SSA as a courtesy to inform USAA my husband died? That when a spouse or family member dies USAA works with the Social Security Office who shares software data with USAA to report the deaths of loved ones. I informed them that this was an invasion of my privacy and very insulting, unlawful and just a underhanded scheme by USAA to " upsell '' estate products, ( says it in the letter ) At no time did I contact USAA to disclose my husband 's passing. For what reason? I'm the military member, not him, and I'm still handling details of his death which has prevented me from notifying pertinent people or companies who have a need to know! After attempting to explain to someone ( call center ) " XXXX '' who could care less about a devastated, " grieving widow '' who needs no reminders after several months of trying to move forward, I realized that this was plain " FRAUD. '' In addition, USAA supervisor, " XXXX XXXX '' confirmed that she and other USAA employees have access to the Social Security website for the purpose of data sharing of passed USAA members to send out survivor letters? I find this practice disgusting, reprehensible and fraudulent, all in the name of " upselling '' USAA products. I feel that if a relationship between USAA and Social Security does exist for this purpose, then both needs to be investigated for transparency procedures and FRAUD!!!

I am requesting immediate corrective action to remove or amend the disputed accounts, as Experian 's inaction violates federal law and my rights as a consumer.

I met XXXX XXXX on a dating app, XXXX, around XX/XX/2022. He claimed to be XXXX XXXX XXXX, of XXXX XXXX and lived in XXXX XXXX from the age of XXXX to his late XXXX ( approximately ). He also claimed to manage a team of several people to sell medical equipment ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ) for XXXX, in the XXXX area and has a house in XXXX, XXXX  and XXXX XXXX, XXXX 

We started texting on the phone, but switched to an app called XXXX, based on his suggestion. He said that its the app he uses to talk to his family in XXXX XXXX and thus, wanted to use it to message me. As conversations continued, he mentioned that he enjoyed investing and wanted to share that with me. I expressed how uncomfortable I am with investing since Im not very familiar with it. He continued to pressure me into investing my savings in bitcoin, with his guidance. He sent me to specific website, using coinbase and XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX The website and transactions appeared legitimate since I saw transactions change my account balance in real time. ( Unbeknownst to me, the website url changed to XXXX XXXX After several weeks, he said that the stable node ended so I should withdraw my funds to my coinbase wallet. After completing his instructions on XX/XX/2022, the sites customer service ( XXXX  ) told me that I am not able to receive my capital gains until I make a tax payment to the IRS of {$110000.00} within 7 working days or I will face penalties and possible time in prison. I was very confused as I didnt expect to produce so much income in a short amount of time. After discussing the matter with XXXX, he explained that this is a normal process and that I have nothing to be concerned with. As someone that wants to believe in a man that claimed to be in love with me, I quickly gathered more money for the tax payment that I was told I am obligated to pay. We spoke over the phone ( through the XXXX XXXX ) so he could further gain my trust. He is soft spoken with an XXXX XXXX 

After transferring the money to avoid possible penalties and time in prison on XX/XX/2022, the sites customer service stated that they can not release my funds until they receive an additional {$50000.00} security deposit because of anti-money laundering ( AML ) regulations. After receiving the request for the security deposit, I tried to determine the legitimacy of the transaction even further and have not received responses from XXXX XXXX or the exchanges customer service. Furthermore, XXXX has since deleted the chat history in XXXX. He does not respond to his phone number ( XXXX ) that Im assuming is a virtual phone line and does not allow blocked numbers to call a phone number associated with his name in the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 

I notified XXXX on XX/XX/2022. 
I reported the fraud scam to the FBI on XX/XX/2022 and then updated them on XX/XX/2022 in their XXXX website. 
I reported the fraud scam to the XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/2022. 

I have made claims with XXXX XXXX Bank regarding the wire transfers on XX/XX/2022. 
I reported the matter to Coinbase and Coinbase XXXX on XX/XX/2022, only to have my Coinbase account locked on XX/XX/2022. Additionally, I spoke with Coinbase 's Customer Service over the phone on XX/XX/2022 and was told that Coinbase can not take any action to assist me with the matter without being mandated by the federal authorities.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Issue: Trouble accessing funds in your mobile or digital wallet
Consumer complaint narrative:
I opened a Venmo account in XXXX XXXX I tried to transfer my Venmo balance of {$380.00} to my bank account on XXXX XXXX XXXX but the transfer was cancelled by Venmo and my Venmo account was frozen. I contacted Venmo on XXXX XXXX XXXX by filling out a help request form on their website. I received email instructions on what to do to unfreeze my account which included sharing a photo of a bank statement with any personal information obscured. They asked for a bank statement from an account ending in numbers that did not match mine. I replied to that email explaining that I do not have a bank account ending in those numbers. They asked that I share a photo of a bank statement for the account that I had tried to link to my Venmo account. I called Venmo using the phone number listed in the app to verify that the emails were authentic, and the person I spoke to verified their authenticity and explained that they couldn't help me over the phone and I needed to follow through with the steps outlined in the emails. I shared a photo of the bank statement from the account I had tried to link to my Venmo. This is the email I got in response : " Thank you for sending us your ID. 

While we encourage the use of Venmo, we must ensure all users abide by our User Agreement. After reviewing your inquiries and account activity, we have found that your actions and activity have been in violation of this agreement. 

As a result, your account has been permanently deactivated and we regret to inform you that we can no longer offer you the Venmo service. We do not make these decisions lightly, and when we do, it is to help improve the safety of the Venmo community. Note that creation of a new account will not change this decision. 

The funds in your account will be held for up to 180 days for loss prevention purposes. We will contact you at the email address on file with your Venmo account should these funds be available for transfer in the future. 

If you have questions regarding this decision, please note that we do not divulge our decision-making criteria in order to protect the systems that monitor activity on Venmo. '' They would not explain what " actions and activity '' violated the User Agreement. I can not help but wonder if there was some kind of fault with Plaid that links bank accounts to Venmo since they were asking for documentation related to a bank account that is not mine. I can understand their freezing my account if I was the victim of fraud, but I can not understand how there is nothing I can do to get my {$380.00} besides waiting 180 days with only the possibility that Venmo will make it available for me to transfer. I do not wish to continue using Venmo 's services. I don't trust them, and my experience with them has been miserable. I just want to be able to transfer my {$380.00} into my bank account.

Consumer complaint narrative:

DELETE THESE NEGATIVE ACCOUNTS - 4. Bankruptcy Fraud and Misreporting Case # XXXX ( XXXX XXXX  Bankruptcy ) : Filed XX/XX/XXXX, and dismissed/closed.

Your verification of the bankruptcy via the court is false, violating 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) and 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ) ( B ) ( iii ). 

XXXX. Unverified Charge-Off Accounts and Reporting Fraud Multiple charge-off accounts, including XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX remain unverified and fail to meet Metro 2 compliance standards.

These transactions violate 15 U.S.C. 1681a, which excludes certain items from consumer reports.

ALL INQUIRIES 15 U.S.C 1681 Section 602 A stated I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681 Section A, section 2, states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish an account without my written instructions. 

XXXX5 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ) Section states : No consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following information items : Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions and crimes which antedates the report by 7 years.

15 U.S.C 16815-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information creating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Secured Party XXXX XXXX XXXX # XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA [ XXXX ] Last XXXX SSN : XXXX | XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX 's Fraud Victim Assistance Department XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, PA XXXX Experian XXXX Department XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX TX XXXX XXXX XXXX Department XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX GA XX/XX/XXXX Subject : Final Demand for Fraud Investigation, Validation, Verification, and Cease-and-Desist Regarding Alleged Debt and Inaccurate Reporting To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally dispute and demand immediate resolution regarding fraudulent, inaccurate, and unverifiable information reported under my Social Security Number ( SSN ). This letter also serves as a final demand for validation, verification, and cessation of all related activities under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA, 15 U.S.C. 1692g ), Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681 ), Uniform Commercial Code ( UCC 1-308, UCC 1-103 ), and all relevant consumer protection laws.

Furthermore, I emphasize that the alleged debts, accounts, and related reporting provide no valuable consideration or benefit to me, the beneficiary, or my ministry. Therefore, their reporting constitutes improper conduct, unjust enrichment, and misrepresentation of obligations that lack enforceable standing. 
The reporting and collection of unverified and fraudulent debts, misuse of my SSN, and inaccuracies in my credit report require immediate resolution. This correspondence also demands the disclosure of the method of verification and procedures followed, per 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ) ( B ) ( iii ).

Violations and Key Legal Points 1. Violation of Privacy Rights and Fraudulent Credit Reporting Unauthorized access and use of my SSN without explicit consent violates the Privacy Act of 1974 ( 5 U.S.C. 552a ) and 18 U.S.C. 1028 ( Fraud and Related Activity in Connection with Identification Documents ).

The SSN belongs to the Social Security Administration, and any attempt to collect a debt tied to it without verification is unlawful per 18 U.S.C. 8. 


2. False Claims Act and FCRA Violations The fraudulent reporting of debts and misrepresentation of obligations violate the False Claims Act ( 31 U.S.C. 3729 ), which penalizes false claims and misrepresentations. Any fraudulent claims tied to verification, validation, or reporting violate the False Claims Act ( 31 U.S.C. 3729 ).

Failure to maintain accurate credit reporting procedures constitutes violations under 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) and 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ) ( B ) ( iii ). 

XXXX. Unverified Charge-Off Accounts and Reporting Fraud Multiple charge-off accounts, including XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX remain unverified and fail to meet Metro 2 compliance standards.

These transactions violate 15 U.S.C. 1681a, which excludes certain items from consumer reports.

4. Bankruptcy Fraud and Misreporting Case # XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Bankruptcy ) : Filed XX/XX/XXXX, and dismissed/closed. 

The attached letter from the United States Bankruptcy Court, XXXX XXXX XXXX Georgia ( dated XX/XX/XXXX ) explicitly states that the court does not provide information to credit reporting agencies. 
Your verification of the bankruptcy via the court is false, violating 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) and 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ) ( B ) ( iii ). 

XXXX. Defamation of Character and Identity Theft The misuse of my personal data has caused harm to my financial reputation, constituting defamation of character under applicable laws.

The unauthorized usage and fraudulent reporting tied to my SSA-89 ( Authorization for the SSA to Release SSN Verification ) and SS5-FR ( Application for a Social Security Card ) constitute identity theft, in violation of 18 U.S.C. 1028 and 18 U.S.C. 1028A.

The unauthorized reporting, transfer, or use of my SSN without lawful authority constitutes aggravated identity theft under 18 U.S.C. 1028A.

6. Securities and Commodities Fraud The fraudulent misrepresentation of financial data and unauthorized claims tied to my identity may also constitute securities and commodities fraud under 18 U.S. Code 1348, which penalizes any scheme to defraud in connection with securities and commodities transactions. 

XXXX. Violations Documented by CFPB Findings Attached are detailed CFPB complaints and consent orders against Experian, XXXX, and XXXX  that highlight systemic violations of the FCRA and CFPA in consumer reporting and dispute resolution processes. 

Issues include failure to reinvestigate disputes adequately, improper handling of consumer data, and ongoing misrepresentations in consumer report processing ( see Attachments 1, 2, and 3 for specific details ).

8. Demand for Method of Verification and Procedural Disclosures You are hereby required to provide documentation on : Signed agreements or contracts proving mutual consent.

Complete payment history and proof of the original creditor.

Names and contact details of verifying entities.

Procedures followed in verifying the alleged accounts.

Action to be Taken Immediately 1. Immediate Validation of Accounts Method of Verification a. As required by 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ) ( B ) ( iii ), disclose the method of verification used to report the bankruptcy and other accounts, including : i. Names and contact information of verifying entities. 
ii. Procedures followed to validate the accuracy of the reported information. 
Produce legally enforceable documentation validating the alleged debts. 
XXXX. Correction of Records o DELETE all unverifiable, inaccurate, or fraudulent information from my credit report in compliance with FCRA guidelines.

3. Cessation of Collection and Reporting Activities CEASE all collection, reporting, and communication related to these accounts until proper validation is completed, per 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ).

4. Enforcement via Governing Authorities Due to repeated non-compliance, I have invoked the following agencies to act on my behalf : Inspector General ( Investigates fraud and abuses ) Postmaster General ( Handles mail fraud and identity theft ) Comptroller of the Currency ( Regulates financial institutions ) Criminal Investigation Division ( CID ) ( Handles fraudulent financial activity ) Federal Bureau of Investigation ( FBI ) ( Handles financial and identity fraud ) Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) ( Monitors credit and debt collection ) Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) ( Enforces consumer protection laws ) Legal Action o Pursue remedies under : 15 U.S.C. 1681n : Civil liability for willful noncompliance with the FCRA. 
15 U.S.C. 1692k : Civil liability for FDCPA violations.

18 U.S.C. 1028A : Identity theft penalties.

31 U.S.C. 3729 : False Claims Act penalties.

Seeking Damages o Compensation for : Defamation of character.

Negligent enablement of identity fraud.

Emotional distress and mental anguish.

5. Monetary Damages of {$1000.00} per Violation Per 15 U.S.C. 1681n and 31 U.S.C. 3729, I demand {$1000.00} in statutory damages per violation for each instance of inaccurate or fraudulent reporting, unauthorized access, or failure to validate accounts.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
I disputed inaccuracies on my credit report with Experian regarding the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Account # : ... XXXX ). Despite providing supporting evidence, Experian failed to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation as required by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and violated several of its obligations under the law. Specifically : Failure to Conduct a Reasonable Reinvestigation ( FCRA Section 1681i ( a ) ) : Experian did not adequately address my dispute or verify the accuracy of the information reported.

Failure to Provide Relevant Information to Furnishers ( FCRA Section 1681i ( a ) ( 2 ) ) : Experian did not forward the supporting documents I submitted to the data furnisher.

Failure to Assure Maximum Possible Accuracy ( FCRA Section 1681e ( b ) ) : Experian failed to ensure the information on my credit report was accurate.

Failure to Provide Clear Dispute Results ( FCRA Section 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ) ) : The results letter I received was ambiguous, leaving me uncertain about the outcome of the dispute.

These actions are consistent with the allegations in the recent CFPB lawsuit against Experian ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX ). The lawsuit details systemic failures, including ignoring consumer-provided evidence, mischaracterizing disputes, and over-relying on furnishers ' responses without independent verification. These practices violate both the FCRA and the Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ). Experians actions have caused harm to my creditworthiness and financial stability.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports

Consumer complaint narrative:

According to FCRA and 15 U.S.C. I am A consumer, and I am to be treated with fairly ; without biased observation and/or discrimination I as the consumer have the right to a fair and accurate Consumer Credit Report. 15 U.S.C. ( d ) clearly states that A Consumer Report is defined as follows : ( 1 ) Consumer Report is any written, oral, or other communication of any information by a consumer reporting agency providing information on a consumers credit worthiness, credit standing, credit capacity, character, general reputation, personal characteristics, or mode of living which is used or expected to be used or collected in whole or in part for the purpose of serving as a factor in establishing the consumers eligibility to pay their obligations.

15 U.S.C. 1681 ( d ) ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ) further states the Exclusions of A Consumer Report as the following : The term consumer report does not include any report containing information of transactions, or experiences between ( I ) the consumer and the Person ( ie. banks, credit unions, financial corporations, hospitals, Dealerships etc ) making the report. XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, Credit Acceptance, XXXX XXXX, and XXXX are in Violation Of my rights to a fair and Accurate Consumer File. According to 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( 3 ) ( A ) ( g ) the term File is as follows : When a file is used in connection with information of any consumer, this absolutely means all of the information recorded and retained on that consumer by a consumer reporting agency regardless of how the information is stored. XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX are also in Violation of the FCRA, they are using XXXX means by reporting prohibited transactions and experiences between myself and Furnishers of information. XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, Credit Acceptance, XXXX XXXX Pays XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX to report these prohibited items on my consumer file, RESULTING IN ADVERSE ACTIONS against ( me ) the consumer According to 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( 3 ) ( A ) ( f ) Credit Reporting Agencies refers to any PERSON that, for a fee, dues, or on a cooperative nonprofit basis, regularly participates, fully or partially, in the collection or assessment of consumer credit information or other data about consumers. This is done with the intention of providing consumer reports to third parties, utilizing any means of interstate commerce to prepare or deliver these reports. Furthermore According to 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( a ) ( 5 ) states except as authorized under subsection ( b ) no consumer reporting Agencies may make any consumer report containing ANY ADVERSE items of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than XXXX years. These accounts are reporting ADVERSE ITEMS, without my permission. Additionally 15 U.S. Code 1681 s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) states that A person ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Acceptance, and XXXX XXXX ) shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer ( ME ) to any consumer reporting agency ( XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX ) if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. ( XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, and XXXX XXXX ) can not collect on a discharged debt. This is now considered a certificate of indebtedness per the IRS and income can not be reported. The IRS Clearly defines a charge off as Gross or Ordinary income, INCOME DOES NOT GET REPORTED ON THE CONSUMER REPORT which in fact makes reporting of this account inaccurate!. I never received a 1099-C from ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and Credit Acceptance ) for the cancelled debts in order to file as ordinary income. This is unsatisfactory! ( XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, Credit Acceptance, XXXX XXXX ) has been HEREBY PUT ON NOTICE that they are furnishing incorrect inaccurate information. must also refund the remaining balance of the consumer account upon its termination. Last but not least ( XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, and Credit Acceptance ) This is your 7 day notice to return ALL money due from this consum er account. XXXX Treatment of credit balances ; account termination. ( a ) Credit balances. When a credit balance in excess of { { {$1.00} } } is created on a credit account ( through transmittal of funds to a creditor in excess of the total balance due on an account, through rebates of unearned finance charges or insurance premiums, or through amounts otherwise owed to or held for the benefit of the consumer ), the creditor shall : ( 1 ) Credit the amount of the credit balance to the consumer 's account ; ( 2 ) Refund any part of the remaining credit balance within seven business days from receipt of a written request from the consumer ; ( 3 ) Make a good faith effort to refund to the consumer by cash, check, or money order, or credit to a deposit account of the consumer, any part of the credit balance remaining in the account for more than XXXX months. No further action is required if the consumer 's current location is not known to the creditor and can not be traced through the consumer 's last known address or telephone number. Lastly I have reached out to XXXX XXXX repeatedly concerning this billing error issue to no avail, and have been treated harshly to the extent of being hung up in my face. 15 U.S. Code 16811 ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general if, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall - ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation ; and i ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to dispute the accuracy and validity of a charge-off account that has been reported on my consumer report. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq., I have the right to accurate and complete information in my credit reports. I believe the information regarding this charge-off account is inaccurate and/or incomplete, and I request an immediate investigation into this matter.

Potential Inaccuracies and Issues : 1. Chargeoff with {$0.00} Balance : o The account is marked as Collection/Chargeoff, but the balance is {$0.00}. This is inconsistent with the high credit of {$2400.00} and requires clarification.

2. Account Transferred or Sold : o The comment indicates the account was transferred or sold, but no information is provided about the new creditor or details of the transfer. This makes the report incomplete.

3. Payment History Inconsistency : o The two-year payment history is marked as OK for all months, even though the account status is listed as derogatory and charged off. This is contradictory and inaccurate. 
4. Future Reporting Date : o The " Last Reported '' date is XX/XX/XXXX, which violates the FCRA 's requirement for timely and accurate reporting. 
5. Missing Information : o XXXX and TransUnion : The details for these bureaus are incomplete or missing entirely, which makes the report inconsistent across bureaus. 



XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Potential Inaccuracies : 1. Chargeoff Status with {$0.00} Balance : o The account is listed as Charged off as bad debt with a {$0.00} balance. If the account was charged off, there should typically be a balance or further clarification on the transfer or resolution.

2. Missing Information on Transfer : o The comment Purchased by another lender lacks details. The new lender or purchaser should be listed, and this must be clarified in the account report.

3. Credit Limit Reporting : o A credit limit of {$0.00} is inconsistent with the reported high credit of {$5000.00}. This discrepancy may indicate inaccurate or incomplete data.

4. Future Reporting Dates : o The " Last Reported '' date is XX/XX/XXXX, which is acceptable, but discrepancies in other accounts often show future dates that need careful review. 
XXXX. Incomplete Payment History : o The two-year payment history is blank, even though the account was open and reported as active until XX/XX/XXXX. This incomplete reporting violates FCRA Section 607 ( b ), which mandates accurate and complete information.

Applicable Legal Basis for Dispute 1. Verification Requirement ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) : - The FCRA mandates that all disputed information be verified within 30 days of a consumers dispute. If the information can not be verified, it must be corrected or deleted.

2. Obligation of Accuracy ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ) : - Consumer reporting agencies must ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information in consumer reports. The inaccurate or unverifiable information regarding the charge-off account violates this requirement.

3. Re-Aging of Debt ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c ) : - The FCRA prohibits re-aging of old debt. If the date of first delinquency is inaccurately reported, the charge-off may appear on my credit report longer than the allowed 7 years.

4. Validation of Debt ( Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, 15 U.S.C. 1692g ) : - Under the FDCPA, if the debt is being collected by a third party, I have the right to request validation of the debt, including proof of ownership and the amount owed. If the creditor or collection agency can not validate the debt, it must be removed.

Upon reviewing my credit report dated XX/XX/year> I identified the following inaccurate item ( XXXX ) : XXXX. Midland Credit Managem Account Number : XXXX Inaccuracy : The account has not been validated nor has the supposed credit grantor/ debt buyer provided me or the credit bureau with proper documentation stating I owe this debt. Debt amount is wrong, supposed debt is Being reported as OPEN violating law 15 usc 1692e ( a ). These inaccuracies have caused me financial harm, denial of credit, increased interest rates, emotional distress, etc. 

XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Inaccuracy : The account has not been validated nor has the supposed credit grantor/ debt buyer provided me or the credit bureau with proper documentation stating I owe this debt. Debt amount is wrong, supposed debt is Being reported as OPEN violating law 15 usc 1692e ( a ). These inaccuracies have caused me financial harm, denial of credit, increased interest rates, emotional distress, etc. 


I have asked XXXX to request documentation and have yet to receive adequate and explanation of investigations. Therefore I request removal immediately. As I have been denied a formal and relevant investigation or explanation. 

Under the FCRA, credit reporting agencies are required to ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information they report. Furthermore, if a CRA negligently fails to comply with its obligations, it may be held liable for any damages sustained, as outlined in 15 U.S.C. 1681o.

Please respond to this dispute in writing within 30 days of receiving this letter, as required by law. If this matter is not resolved to my satisfaction, I reserve the right to pursue legal action under the FCRA for negligent noncompliance. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. If you require any additional information, I can be reached at XXXX or at XXXX Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Investigation took more than 30 days
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally dispute the reporting of the closed credit card account referenced below, which is inaccurate and in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 ). The account in question is being reported incorrectly by XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax, and I demand that it be immediately deleted from my credit reports. 

Account Information : Account Number ( redacted for security ) : XXXX Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Type : Credit Card Current Status : Closed ( by creditor due to inactivity ) High Balance : {$580.00} ( XXXX and XXXX ) ; {$500.00} ( Equifax XXXX Last Verified : XX/XX/year> Date Opened : XX/XX/year> to XX/XX/year> Date Closed : XX/XX/year> Balance Owed : {$560.00} Payment Status : Late 60 Days Discrepancies and Violations : Inaccurate Reporting of Credit Limit Under the FCRA ( 15 U.S.C . 1681c-2 ), a credit reporting agency is prohibited from reporting any credit limit for accounts that are closed, yet this account continues to report a {$500.00} credit limit despite being closed. This is a clear violation of the FCRA, as the credit limit reported is no longer relevant after the account has been closed.

Failure to Correct Reporting of Account Status The account is marked as " Closed '' and the creditor 's remarks indicate that the account was " canceled by credit grantor due to inactivity. '' However, the account is still being reported with incorrect late payment information. Under FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), when an account is disputed, the creditor must correct the inaccuracies within 30 days of receiving the dispute. This account contains several incorrect and outdated details, including the reporting of late payments ( 60 days late ), which should not be on a closed account if it was paid off. 

Inaccurate Payment History The account is reported as being 60 days late across all three bureaus, even though the last payment was made on XX/XX/year> for XXXX and XXXX, and XX/XX/year> for Equifax. This inconsistency in reporting dates suggests an error or reporting delay and is misleading. 

Failure to Properly Verify Account Information The failure of XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax to ensure the accounts information is accurate violates FCRA Section 1681i, which mandates that they must correct or delete inaccurate information when the dispute is validated. The creditor has not properly verified the account details, as evidenced by the inconsistencies between the three reporting agencies.

Credit Reporting Post-Account Closure FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) requires that the information reported is accurate, complete, and up-to-date. Reporting an account as open with a credit limit of {$500.00} when the account is closed and no longer active is a misrepresentation and is a violation of my consumer rights under the law.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX ). Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute the debt referenced above, which you are attempting to collect on behalf of collections XXXX XXXX account # XXXX date opened XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX account # XXXX date opened XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX account # XXXX date opened XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX account # XXXX XX/XX/XXXX I believe this debt is not mine and is a result of fraudulent activity. I request that you immediately investigate and remove all accounts related to this matter. 

Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I am entitled to dispute debts that I believe are incorrect or fraudulent. I have reviewed my records thoroughly and have no knowledge or recollection of any account associated with this debt. This appears to be a case of mistaken identity or fraud, and I demand a full investigation into this matter. 

Please take the following actions : Provide Documentation : I require that you provide written verification of this debt, including a copy of the original agreement or contract bearing my signature and any other relevant proof that this debt is legitimately mine. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX Efforts : I demand that all collection activities, including phone calls, letters, or any further communication regarding this debt, cease immediately until you can provide clear evidence that this debt belongs to me. 

Remove from Credit Report : If this account is being reported on my credit report, I request that it be removed immediately unless you can provide sufficient documentation to prove my responsibility for this debt. 

Failure to provide proper validation and evidence of this debt, or failure to remove this fraudulent account, will leave me no choice but to pursue legal action. If this matter is not resolved promptly and to my satisfaction, I will take appropriate steps, including filing a lawsuit for violations of my rights under the FDCPA and FCRA. Additionally, I will seek damages for any harm caused to my credit and any emotional distress caused by your collection efforts. 

I request a response within 30 days of receipt of this letter. Should you fail to validate this debt or remove it from my credit report, I will not hesitate to escalate this matter to the appropriate legal authorities, including the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and my states Attorney Generals office.

FORMAL COMPLAINT REGARDING SYSTEMATIC FCRA VIOLATIONS AND FAILURE TO PROCESS IDENTITY THEFT DISPUTES Date : XX/XX/XXXX RE : Repeated Failures to Comply with FCRA Identity Theft Provisions Complaint Against : Experian, XXXX, and XXXX DOCUMENTATION OF SYSTEMATIC FCRA VIOLATIONS I. Timeline of Dispute Submissions Since XX/XX/XXXX, I have submitted seven ( 7 ) separate sets of identity theft documentation to Experian, XXXX, and XXXX ( " the CRAs '' ) through the following methods : - Certified mail submissions : 6 separate mailings - Online portal submissions : 6 separate uploads- Most recent submission : XX/XX/XXXX II. Legal Requirements Under FCRA Pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2, the CRAs are required to : 1. Block fraudulent information within 4 business days of receiving identity theft documentation 2. Notify furnishers of the blocked information 3. Provide documentation supporting the validity of disputed accounts when requested 4. Prevent the reappearance of previously blocked fraudulent information III. Documented Violations The CRAs have systematically failed to meet their statutory obligations in the following ways : A. Failure to Block Information- Failed to block fraudulent accounts within the mandated 4-day timeframe - Allowed previously blocked accounts to reappear on credit reports- Continued reporting disputed information without proper verification B. Failure to Provide Documentation - Failed to furnish requested validation documentation - Failed to provide evidence contradicting submitted identity theft documentation - Failed to demonstrate proper investigation of disputes C. Supporting Evidence Provided 1. Police report 2. Two ( 2 ) FTC Identity Theft Reports 3. Two ( 2 ) CFPB complaints 4. Documentation proving physical impossibility of account creation during period of : XX/XX/XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX ( location outside USA ) IV. Impact and Damages The CRAs ' systematic failures have resulted in : - Ongoing credit report inaccuracies- Necessity to retain legal counsel - Financial hardship - Inability to conduct normal financial activities - Time and resource expenditure in repeated dispute submissions V. Prior Attempts at Resolution Multiple attempts have been made to resolve these issues through : - Direct communication with each CRA - Online dispute processes- Phone communications- Written correspondence - Regulatory complaints VI. Legal Representation Due to the CRAs ' continued non-compliance with FCRA requirements, I have retained civil rights counsel to pursue appropriate legal remedies. This retention was necessitated by the CRAs ' systematic failure to fulfill their statutory obligations under FCRA.

REQUEST FOR IMMEDIATE ACTION I hereby demand that each CRA : 1. Immediately block all identified fraudulent accounts 2. Provide written verification of all disputed accounts 3. Implement procedures to prevent reappearance of blocked items 4. Furnish copies of all documentation used to verify disputed accounts 5. Provide written confirmation of compliance with these requests All communication regarding this matter should be provided in writing to my address of record and I request that the response including validating documentation be emailed to me to the email address on record at each credit bereau.

Consumer complaint narrative:
" I was shocked and devastated to see credit inquiries without my knowledge. I have reached out to the creditors to ask the following but they have FAILED to provide such.

Inquiry Details : Ask the creditor to provide specific details about the inquiry, such as the date it was made, the purpose of the inquiry and the type of credit product or service associated with the inquiry.

Application Documentation : Request copies of any credit applications or other documents related to the inquiry. This may include application forms, agreements, or disclosures that you would have completed or received when applying for credit.

Authorization Documentation : Ask the creditor to provide evidence of your authorization for the inquiry. This could include signed consent forms, agreements, or disclosures that demonstrate you provided permission for the creditor to access your credit report.

Communication Records : Request copies of any correspondence or communication between you and the creditor regarding the inquiry. This may include emails, letters, or notes documenting your interactions with the creditor.

Internal Records : Ask the creditor to provide internal records or notes related to the inquiry, including any decision-making processes or reasons for initiating the inquiry.

Identity Verification : If identity theft is a concern, request verification measures taken by the creditor to confirm your identity before initiating the inquiry. This may include verification of personal information or identity documents provided during the application process.

Compliance Documentation : Inquire about the creditor 's compliance with relevant laws and regulations governing credit inquiries, such as the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and Equal Credit Opportunity Act ( ECOA ).

"

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Information belongs to someone else
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute certain entries on my credit report that violate my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically under 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( c ) and 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2. My review has identified unauthorized inquiries and inaccurately or improperly reported collection accounts. I request that these be removed immediately to ensure compliance with federal law. Unauthorized Inquiries : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  These accounts have been inaccurately reported and should not negatively reflect on my credit report. The continued reporting of these accounts as collections is misleading and harmful, and it violates my rights under the FCRA. 
Legal Basis for My Request : The FCRA ensures the accuracy, fairness, and privacy of consumer credit information. The unauthorized inquiries and erroneous collection accounts listed above are clear violations of the following points : 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( c ) : Permissible purposes of consumer reports, restricting access only to those with legitimate authorization.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( b ) : Responsibility of furnishers to correct and update information after receiving a dispute. 
15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : Ensuring maximum possible accuracy of the information contained in consumer reports.

Additionally, the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) has issued clear guidance on these matters, as referenced in FTC Report XXXX. Failure to promptly correct these errors may not only violate the FCRA but could also be subject to penalties under the same law.

Request for Resolution : I respectfully request that the unauthorized inquiries and collection accounts outlined in this letter be promptly investigated, and, if found to be inaccurate or unauthorized as I have indicated, removed from my credit report. Please provide written confirmation of the actions taken within 30 days, as required by law.

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. Failure to comply with these requests may result in further action to enforce my rights under the FCRA.

Formal Complaint Willful Noncompliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1681n ) Regarding False Reporting of XXXX XXXX  Account # XXXX I am submitting this complaint regarding the false and willful reporting of a XXXX XXXX  account ( # XXXX ) on my credit report by [ insert the credit bureaus in question, e.g., XXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion ]. The account in question is completely inaccurate and baseless, as I have no existing child support case or obligation. The reporting of this account not only damages my credit standing but also directly violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically under sections related to the duty to report accurate information and conduct reasonable investigations. 

Under 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ), credit reporting agencies are required to maintain reasonable procedures to ensure the accuracy of information on consumer reports. By allowing this erroneous account to appear on my report, the credit bureaus have failed in this statutory obligation. Furthermore, their failure to remove this account after I previously disputed it indicates a lack of reasonable reinvestigation under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ).

Additionally, the willful and reckless nature of this reporting constitutes a violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681n, exposing the credit bureaus to liability for damages, statutory fines, and attorneys fees. The reporting of this account also creates unwarranted financial harm, as it misrepresents my creditworthiness and undermines my ability to access credit, housing, and other necessities.

I am requesting the CFPB to investigate this matter thoroughly and hold the credit bureaus accountable for their blatant disregard of federal law. Specifically, I ask that : This XXXX XXXX account ( # XXXX ) be permanently deleted from my credit file across all reporting agencies. 
The credit bureaus provide documentation of their procedures and investigations into this account as required under the FCRA. 
The CFPB impose appropriate penalties on the credit bureaus for their willful noncompliance with the law.

Below, XXXX detail the sequence of events and the impact of these actions.

Timeline of Events 1. Unauthorized Deposit ( XX/XX/year> ) : An unauthorized deposit of {$9300.00} was made into my Bank of America checking account ( Account No. XXXX ) via a check issued by a company called XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. I have no knowledge of or affiliation with this company, nor was I expecting any such transaction. 
XXXX. Account Flagged and Hold Placed ( XX/XX/year> ) : Bank of America flagged the deposit as suspicious and placed a hold on the funds. 
XXXX. Account Closure ( XX/XX/year> ) : Without providing notice or an opportunity to dispute the matter, Bank of America unilaterally closed my account. Upon inquiry, I was informed that the deposit was the reason for the closure. 
XXXX. Complaint to North Carolina Department of Justice ( XX/XX/year> ) : I filed a formal complaint with the North Carolina Department of Justice ( DOJ ) under reference number CP-24-05228, outlining my lack of involvement in the transaction. The DOJ attempted to contact XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX but received no response, which confirmed that the company was likely fraudulent and engaged in criminal activity. 
XXXX. False Report to XXXX : Despite my efforts to address the issue, Bank of America submitted a report to XXXX, falsely labeling me as committing fraud. 
XXXX. Rejection by XXXX XXXX  ( XX/XX/year> ) : As a result of the XXXX report, XXXX XXXX  denied my application for a new account. Their communication explicitly stated that the denial was due to the fraudulent report originating from Bank of America in XX/XX/year>. 

Impact of These Actions Exclusion from Banking Services : The false report has caused multiple financial institutions to reject my applications for new accounts, leaving me without access to essential banking services.

Credit Score Damage : My credit score has been reduced to XXXX, further limiting my financial opportunities. 
Reputational Harm : The false fraud label has severely impacted my personal and professional reputation. 
Business Disruption : The lack of access to banking services has disrupted my business operations, causing financial losses and emotional distress.

Violations Bank of Americas actions violate my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, which require financial institutions to : 1. Ensure the accuracy and verifiability of information reported to consumer reporting agencies.

2. Conduct thorough investigations before taking actions that harm their clients.

3. Provide due process and the opportunity to dispute allegations before submitting reports. 

XXXX has also failed in their responsibility under the FCRA to ensure that the information they collect and report is accurate, complete, and fair.

Requested Actions 1. Conduct a thorough investigation into Bank of Americas handling of this case and their report to XXXX. 
XXXX. Require XXXX to remove the false report from their system.

I recently reviewed my credit report and found a discrepancy involving an account that I believe is incorrect. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681i, I am entitled to dispute any inaccuracies or incomplete information. 

The specific item in question is listed as XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX, on my credit report, which I believe to be inaccurate. I am requesting that you investigate this issue and correct any errors immediately. 

According to 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2, as a furnisher of information to the credit reporting agencies, you are required to report accurate and complete information. If any of the information provided by you is found to be inaccurate, you are obligated to correct it or notify the credit reporting agency to delete or update the entry.

Additionally, under 15 U.S.C. 1692g, I request that you provide the necessary documentation to validate the debt in question. Specifically, I would like to see proof that this debt is mine, including a copy of the original agreement, account history, and any supporting documents that substantiate the claim made in my credit report. 

If this matter is not resolved or if you do not respond within the legally prescribed timeframe, I will take further action to protect my rights. This may include filing complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ). 

Please be advised that I am exercising my rights under the FCRA to ensure that my credit report is accurate and fair. I expect a written response within 15 days of your receipt of this letter, as required by law. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt resolution of this issue. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Disputed Account Removal and Verification of Debt Request for Deletion from Credit Report To : All Credit Bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX, Transunion ) I am writing to notify you that I recently disputed two charge-off accounts listed under my name with XXXX XXXX XXXX on my XXXX credit report. After the dispute process, XXXX completed its investigation on XX/XX/year>, and completely deleted the accounts from my XXXX report. 

The disputed accounts in question were for the following amounts : {$590.00} account : XXXX {$760.00} account : XXXX As per the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically Section 611, I am entitled to request the removal of any unverifiable or incorrect information from my credit report. Since XXXX has completely removed these charge-off accounts due to their inability to verify the debt, I believe it is in violation of consumer protection laws for these same unverifiable accounts to remain on my records with your agency. 

Given that XXXX has deleted these accounts due to their inability to verify the debt, I request that you conduct a thorough investigation into the matter and remove these unverifiable accounts from my credit report within 30 days or less. The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) mandates that you correct or delete any unverifiable information within a reasonable time frame. Failure to comply with this request could result in legal actions. 

I would also like to remind you of the following legal protections under the FCRA : Section 611 of the FCRA : If any information is disputed by the consumer, the credit reporting agency must investigate the claim and, if the information can not be verified, must remove it from the consumers report within 30 days. 
Section 616 and 617 of the FCRA : If you willfully or negligently fail to comply with the requirements of the FCRA, I am entitled to pursue legal action, which may include suing for damages, as well as seeking statutory damages of up to {$1000.00} for willful violations.

Section 605 of the FCRA : The removal of unverifiable debt is not only a right but a requirement. If information is found to be inaccurate or unverifiable, it must be deleted promptly. 

Therefore, I respectfully request that you remove the two charge-off accounts from my credit report within 30 days due to their unverifiable nature. Should these accounts not be removed in the required timeframe, I will not hesitate to take legal action and will explore all available options to protect my rights under federal law. 

Please confirm the removal of these accounts in writing or by updating my credit report as soon as the investigation is complete. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your swift response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Seeing this, I spoke to an agent regarding 1 : Revoking autopayment and 2 : Refunding the amount that was taken. I was assured on this phone call that the money would be back in my account by the next day. The next day, as the agent said, the money was back in my account. I called on XX/XX/XXXX about this, I spoke with a supervisor of the " credit card department ''. This supervisor told me that this collection was part of their " double processing '' policy, which I was not informed of before in any previous calls. This supervisor stated that it was no fault of the company that I was misinformed and that unfortunately there was nothing I could do about it but that I would receive the money back on the following Monday, XX/XX/XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX, the amount was still not refunded. I called Chase for the third time seeing this. In this call, I spoke to a low management agent who stated that he will " do something about this, '' after leaving me on hold for five minutes I was told, " I can not do anything about this I will have to transfer you to the *PaymentsXXXX department in order to push your refund processing. '' Hearing this, I was confused as in the previous call I was transferred to the " Credit Card '' department ; seemingly there is no cohesiveness, communication, or attentiveness in this company. Even so, I let the call be transferred. Here I spoke to a " Payments Supervisor '' named XXXX. Here she told me again about the " double processing policy. '' At this point, I asked the supervisor to read me the policy in which this double processing was included, she stated that she in fact could not read any policy as there was no physical copy and it was a part of " chase internal affairs. '' In all my calls with Chase, they have shown no accountability for their actions and have had little to no answers. Since XXXX, any and all collections made from my account were UNAUTHORIZED, as I turned off autopayment. My account has had a negative balance since XX/XX/XXXX, I can not use my card OR my bank account as a result of this all. The collections made are a violation of my consumer rights.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Was not notified of investigation status or results
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute a collection account placed on my credit report by Eastern Account System. I have not received any prior notification about this debt, which constitutes violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Specifically : 1. FCRA Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ), which provides consumers the right to dispute inaccurate information on their credit reports. W

ithout receiving proper notification of this debt, I was denied my right to dispute its accuracy. 2. FCRA Section 623 ( a ) ( 3 ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 3 ) ), which requires furnishers of information to notify consumers about the negative information reported to credit reporting agencies. Eastern Account System did not provide me with the required notice within the legally mandated timeframe.

As I track all my mail using a mail picture system, I am confident that no such notification was sent by Eastern Account System. This failure to notify me of the collection account denied me the opportunity to dispute the debt in a timely manner, as provided by the FCRA. 

I am requesting a complete validation of the debt, including : Documentation showing my identity and signature on any contractual agreement that allegedly led to this debt.

A detailed breakdown of the origin and history of the debt, including the name and contact information of the original creditor.

Please consider this letter as a formal dispute under the FCRA, and I request that Eastern Account System validate the debt or remove the collection account from my credit report immediately. I expect a response within the 30 days required by law.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law
Company: Eastern Account Systems of Connecticut, Inc.
