Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account information incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate late payment entries on my credit report regarding my account with XXXX  XXXX ( Account # XXXX ). These late payments appear to be reported in error, as the account is marked as XXXX across all bureaus and there is no valid evidence to support these entries. This is a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and my rights as a consumer. 

Details : Account Name : XXXX  XXXX # XXXX Late Payments : The account is marked as Current across all three credit bureaus, yet late payments are reported inconsistently : XXXX : Reports 30 days late ( XX/XX/XXXX ) and 60 days late ( XX/XX/XXXX ). 
XXXX : XXXX 30 days late ( XX/XX/XXXX ) and 60 days late ( XX/XX/XXXX ). 
Equifax : XXXX 30 days late ( XX/XX/XXXX ), 60 days late ( XX/XX/XXXX ), and 120 days late ( XX/XX/XXXX ). 
This is a major discrepancy because : The Payment Status is listed as Current. 
The Past Due amount is {$0.00} across all bureaus, meaning no payments were late or owed. 
2. High Credit Discrepancy : XXXX and XXXX : List the High Credit as {$510.00}. 
Equifax : Lists the High Credit as {$0.00}, which is incorrect and inconsistent with other bureaus. 
3. Future Reporting Dates : XXXX and XXXX : " Last Reported '' date is XX/XX/XXXX. 
Equifax : " Last Reported '' date is XX/XX/XXXX. 
Reporting dates in the future violate FCRA Section 607 ( b ), which requires timely and accurate reporting. 
XXXX. Date Last Active : XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX. 
XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX. 
Equifax : XX/XX/XXXX. 
These discrepancies suggest inaccuracies in the account activity information. 
XXXX. Payment History Contradictions : The Payment History shows late payments for specific months ( XXXX, XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX ), even though the account status is listed as Current with no past due amounts. 




Violation of Consumer Protection Laws : Violations of 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( FCRA ) : 1. 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : Credit reporting agencies are required to ensure maximum possible accuracy of consumer information. Reporting late payments on a current account violates this standard. 
2. 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : I have the right to dispute any inaccurate information on my credit report. The bureau must conduct a reasonable reinvestigation to verify its accuracy.

3. 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) : If the disputed information can not be verified as accurate, it must be promptly deleted or corrected.

4. 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : Information furnishers, such as creditors, are prohibited from knowingly reporting inaccurate information.

5. 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( b ) : Upon receiving notice of a dispute, the furnisher must investigate, review relevant information, and report its findings to the credit bureaus.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Regarding Inaccurate Late Payment on Credit Report Complaint Details : I am submitting this complaint regarding inaccurate late payment that is reported on my credit file maintained by Transunion. I believe this late payment is erroneous and do not accurately reflect my payment history. 

Nature of the Complaint : XXXX. Inaccurate Reporting : The late payment listed on my credit report is inaccurate. I have consistently made my payments on time, as I have been enrolled in autopay for all my accounts. 
2. Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : The inaccurate reporting of this late payment violates my rights under the FCRA ( 15 USC 1666 ( b ) ), as they misrepresent my creditworthiness.

3. Potential Violation of Fair Debt Collections Practices Act ( FDCPA ) : The reporting of false late payment may also constitute a violation of the FDCPA, which protects consumers from misrepresentation regarding their accounts.

4. Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) : I assert that the reporting practices violate the TILA, which mandates accurate reporting of credit information.

Additionally, the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically sections 15 U.S. Code 1681i and 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2, mandates that credit reporting agencies and information furnishers correct any inaccurate or incomplete information in credit reports and ensure the maximum accuracy of information contained in consumer files.

Furthermore, under the FCRA, articles 616 and 617 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681n and 1681o ) outline the civil liability for willful and negligent noncompliance, respectively. These provisions provide for damages, including actual damages, attorneys fees, and possible punitive damages, for failure to comply with the Act 's requirements.

Requested Resolution : I request that Transunion conduct a thorough investigation into this matter and remove the inaccurate late payment from my credit report. I ask that all such entries be updated to reflect my true payment history of 100 % on-time payments.

I expect to receive written documentation confirming the removal of this entries within 30 days of this complaint submission. Failure to resolve this issue may lead to further action to protect my rights as a consumer. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

I submitted formal dispute letters to both Experian and XXXX on XX/XX/year>, regarding multiple inaccuracies on my credit report. These disputes were not my first attempts to address these issues. In my most recent dispute, I explicitly requested : 1. Verification of the accuracy and validity of the accounts, including supporting documentation from the original creditors. 


2. Evidence of proper investigation into each disputed item, as mandated by the FCRA.

3. Removal of unverifiable, inaccurate, or incomplete accounts and inquiries from my credit report.

4. Confirmation that any outdated or incorrect personal information, such as previous addresses or names, was deleted. 



Instead of conducting thorough investigations and providing the requested documentation, Experian and XXXX responded with generic form letters that did not resolve the inaccuracies or address my concerns. The disputed items include accounts and inquiries I do not recognize or that contain errors such as incorrect balances, dates, and statuses. 

The lack of proper investigation and resolution has negatively impacted my credit score, causing harm to my financial opportunities. Moreover, their failure to adhere to Metro 2 compliance guidelines and FCRA obligations demonstrates systemic shortcomings in their dispute resolution processes. 

As of today, the disputed information remains on my credit report, and I have not received any detailed documentation or an updated report reflecting the corrections I requested. This negligence is unacceptable, and I am seeking the CFPBs assistance to ensure that Experian and XXXX fulfill their legal obligations to investigate and correct inaccuracies promptly.

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Attempted to collect wrong amount
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear ( Debt Collector ) I recently received a debt collection notice from your office. I am writing to verify that you have contacted the correct individual and to request that you provide documentation confirming this.

Please supply me with a copy of any contract or agreement signed with your company or the original creditor.

In accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I request the following information : 1. The name and address of the original creditor and the current creditor. 2. Verification of the debt amount you are seeking to collect, including evidence that a contract exists creating the amount you claim is owed. 3. Documentation of all assignments showing the transfer of the debt from the original creditor to the current creditor. 4. Proof that the original creditor securitized the debt. 5. Documentation showing the assignments of the debt from the original creditor to the s
ecured trust and then back to the original creditor.

Please cease and desist from collecting on this debt until you have provided validation of the debt.

Additionally, I request that you do not access my credit report or report anything to my credit bureaus. I dispute the validity of this debt amount, and this dispute should be reflected on my credit report if you have already reported this debt.

Permissible Purpose Please state your permissible purpose for accessing my credit information. I dispute your right to do so.

Notification to Other Collectors I dispute that I owe this debt to you. Should you transfer this debt to another collector, please inform them of my dispute regarding the validity of this debt.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Regarding Inaccurate Late Payment on Credit Report Complaint Details : I am submitting this complaint regarding inaccurate late payment that is reported on my credit file maintained by Transunion. I believe this late payment is erroneous and do not accurately reflect my payment history. 

Nature of the Complaint : XXXX. Inaccurate Reporting : The late payment listed on my credit report is inaccurate. I have consistently made my payments on time, as I have been enrolled in autopay for all my accounts. 
2. Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : The inaccurate reporting of this late payment violates my rights under the FCRA ( 15 USC 1666 ( b ) ), as they misrepresent my creditworthiness.

3. Potential Violation of Fair Debt Collections Practices Act ( FDCPA ) : The reporting of false late payment may also constitute a violation of the FDCPA, which protects consumers from misrepresentation regarding their accounts.

4. Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) : I assert that the reporting practices violate the TILA, which mandates accurate reporting of credit information.

Additionally, the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically sections 15 U.S. Code 1681i and 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2, mandates that credit reporting agencies and information furnishers correct any inaccurate or incomplete information in credit reports and ensure the maximum accuracy of information contained in consumer files.

Furthermore, under the FCRA, articles 616 and 617 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681n and 1681o ) outline the civil liability for willful and negligent noncompliance, respectively. These provisions provide for damages, including actual damages, attorneys fees, and possible punitive damages, for failure to comply with the Act 's requirements.

Requested Resolution : I request that Transunion conduct a thorough investigation into this matter and remove the inaccurate late payment from my credit report. I ask that all such entries be updated to reflect my true payment history of 100 % on-time payments.

I expect to receive written documentation confirming the removal of this entries within 30 days of this complaint submission. Failure to resolve this issue may lead to further action to protect my rights as a consumer. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Charged too much interest
Consumer complaint narrative:
The complaint seeks monetary compensation. Attached is evidence that Celtic Bank through its affiliate Continental Finance intentionally generates bogus charges on both of my Celtic Bank credit card accounts. These charges grossly exceed the Military Lending Act of a MAPR of 36 % I have incurred significant financial losses because of this illegal conduct. As described in 10 USC 987, I am seeking restitution to cover my Losses 1. Acct # ending in XXXX XXXX credit cards 2. Acct # ending in XXXX XXXX credit card To protect our active-duty service members and their families, Congress declared that any violation of the XXXX renders that loan void from inception. 10 U.S.C. 987 ( f ) ( 3 ).

Accordingly, all of Agreements to a covered members that contain an MAPR that exceeds 36 percent are void, must be rescinded with restitution paid for all amounts.

I discovered that two credit cards provided to me by Celtic Bank violates The Military Lending Act, 10 U.S.C. 987, and the company refuses to address the matter in accordance with 10 USC 987. The law and statute were not followed by Celtic Bank through their affiliate Continental Finance. I am protected from predatory lending by Celtic Bank because of my borrower status under the Military Lending Act. 
All Active-duty service members and their dependents are Covered Borrowers as defined by 32 C.F.R. 232.3 ( g ) ( 1 ).

I allege Celtic Bank violates the MLA in at least six ( 2 ) separate ways : ( 1 ) Surpassing the 36 % Military Annual Percentage Rate ( MAPR ) statutory rate cap.

( 2 ) Non-compliance with MLA disclosure requirements.

Celtic Bank refusal to adhere to current law and statute, regarding this matter requires Celtics Bank immediate attention. As an internal remedy I request the deletion of the legally voided account from my credit report, the voiding of the contract, and the immediate return of all payments made to Celtic Bank, pursuant to 10 USC 987.

By suppressing the MLA 36 % cap, Celtic Bank has violated the MLA by not incorrectly including fees in its APR and surprising payment that generate an MAPR exceeding 90 %.

Celtic Bank combined made restitution for {$1300.00}. See attached statements.

Celtic Bank is required by 10 USC 987 to make restitution by refunding all payments made against the voided accounts and void the contract in their inception.

PNC BANK CARD SERVICES PNC Bank Card Services was tasked with validating the records associated with this account but failed to do so. The requested information included : A copy of the agreement granting authority to collect on this alleged debt.

A signed agreement where I explicitly agreed to pay the creditor.

Details of any insurance claims filed by the creditor regarding this account.

Documentation of any judgments obtained by the creditor related to this account.

The name and address of the alleged creditor.

The name associated with the alleged debtor.

The alleged account number.

The address on file for the alleged debtor.

The total amount of the alleged debt.

The date the alleged debt became payable.

The date of the original charge-off or delinquency.

Verification that the debt was assigned or sold to the collector.

A complete accounting of the alleged debt.

Details of the commission the debt collector would earn if collection efforts succeeded.

The method used to verify and validate this information.

None of this information was provided. Additionally, PNC Bank Card Services manipulated data originally present in my file. The attached documents show that the initial account was linked to " XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX. '' After this information was confirmed to be fraudulent, PNC Bank Card Services altered the document file to " XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX. '' This missing information, combined with the deliberate manipulation of my consumer data for corporate benefit, constitutes violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and consumer rights laws, specifically 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ), which pertains to the treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information.

Because the information required for account accuracy validation has been manipulated and is, therefore, invalid, PNC Bank Card Services is obligated to delete the account and any related connections to my personal information.

The agreement bearing my signature stating that I have agreed to assume the debt 3. Valid copies of the debt agreement stating the amount of the debt and interest charges 4. Proof that the Statute of Limitations has not expired 5. Complete payment history on this account along with an accounting of all additional charges being assessed or disputed 6. Show me that you are licensed to collect in my state ; and 7. Your license numbers and Registered Agent If your office fails to reply to this debt validation letter within 30 days from the date of your receipt, all instances related to this account must be immediately deleted and completely removed from my credit file. Moreover, all future attempts to collect on the said debt must be ceased. 

Your non-compliance with my request will also be construed as an absolute waiver of all claims to enforce the debt against me and your implied agreement to compensate me for court costs and attorney fees if I am forced to bring this matter before a judge. 


Thanking you, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
This is my final notice regarding your ongoing noncompliance with federal credit reporting laws. I previously disputed the accuracy and legitimacy of several items on my credit report, yet your agency has failed to act in accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ).

Your violations include : Failure to validate the debt as required under 15 USC 1692g ( Section 809 ( b ) ).

Continuing communication after a certified cease-and-desist request, violating 15 USC 1692c ( Section 805 ( c ) ).

Harassment under 15 USC 1692d ( Section 806 ). Recently, I received notice that your investigation wa
s complete, but the disputed accounts remain on my credit report. These accounts are not only inaccurate but were never authorized by me. No valid contract exists, and I have not provided any written consent for the reporting of these accounts, as required under 15 U.S. Code 1681b. 

I demand that the following items be deleted immediately from my credit report :

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Took or threatened to take negative or legal action
Sub-issue: Threatened or suggested your credit would be damaged
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX [ XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX ] [ XXXX GA, XXXX ] [ XXXX ] [ XXXX ] [ XX/XX/year> ] **RentDebt Automated Collections** XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX TN XXXX Subject : **Debt Validation Request Account Number : XXXX Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally request validation of the debt referenced above as required by the **Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), Section 809 ( b ) **. I recently noticed this collection account on my credit report, and I do not recognize or agree with the debt. Therefore, I am exercising my right to request detailed information about this account to verify its legitimacy. 

Requested Information : 1. **Validation of the Debt** : - A copy of the original agreement or contract that shows I am legally obligated to pay this debt.

- A complete breakdown of the amount owed, including the original balance, interest, fees, and any other charges.

2. **Proof of Ownership** : - Evidence that RentDebt Automated Collections is authorized to collect this debt, including documentation showing a transfer or assignment of the debt from the original creditor.

3. **Details About the Original Creditor** : - The name and address of the original creditor ( XXXX XXXX ), as well as any account numbers or other identifying details related to the original agreement. 

4. **Debt Reporting Details** : - Clarification of why this account appears with a 1-Month Term and discrepancies in dates ( e.g., date opened vs. past due date ). 

Under the FDCPA, you are required to cease collection activity, including reporting the account to credit bureaus, until you provide this information. If you can not validate the debt, I ask that you immediately stop collection efforts and remove this account from my credit report. 

Please also ensure that all further communication regarding this matter is in writing. 

Important Notes : This letter is not an acknowledgment or acceptance of the debt, nor is it a promise to pay. It is a formal request for validation to confirm the debts legitimacy. 

I request that you provide the requested information within **30 days of receiving this letter**, as required by law. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your response. 

Sincerely, [ XXXX ] All rights reserved

Please send evidence your authorization to do business or operate in the state of Tennessee. 5. Please evidence proof of the alleged debt, including specifically the alleged contract or another instrument bearing my signature. You have fifteen ( 15 ) days from receipt of this notice to respond. Your failure to respond, on point, in writing, hand signed, and in a timely manner, will work as a waiver to any and all of your claims in this matter, and will entitle me to presume that you sent your letter ( s ) in error, and that this matter is permanently closed. Best Regards

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate information on my credit report. This dispute is submitted under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681i, which requires credit reporting agencies to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation of disputed items.

Recent findings by the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) have brought to light significant concerns regarding Experian 's failure to conduct proper investigations. Specifically, in a lawsuit filed against Experian, the CFPB alleges that the company engaged in sham investigations, violating consumer protection laws by failing to meet its obligations under the FCRA.

As per 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), Experian is required to conduct a thorough and reasonable reinvestigation of disputed items within 30 days. Furthermore, under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ), any information found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable must be promptly deleted or corrected. Failure to adhere to these requirements constitutes a violation of federal law. 

I hereby request that Experian : XXXX. Conduct a thorough reinvestigation of the following disputed accounts or items : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Provide me with all documentation used to verify the accuracy of the disputed information. 

XXXX. Correct or delete any information that can not be verified or is inaccurate, as mandated by law. 

Given the recent CFPB findings, I expect Experian to handle this dispute with the utmost seriousness and compliance with legal standards. 

If Experian fails to comply with its obligations under the FCRA, I will not hesitate to escalate this matter to the CFPB and pursue any necessary legal action to protect my rights.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Attempted to collect wrong amount
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern : I am writing due to the negative marks you've made on my credit file. I would be willing to accept this debt if it were mine and upon Validation and Proof of Claim but it's not mine and there's no way that you can validate it. I'm sure you are aware of the provisions of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) so let it be known that I am requesting full validation of this debt. I am requesting proof that I am indeed the party you are asking to pay this debt, and that there is some contractual obligation which is binding on me to pay it. I request that you stop contacting me by telephone and restrict your contact with me to writing only, and only when you can provide adequate validation of this alleged debt. To refresh your memory on what constitutes legal validation, here is a list of the required documentation : Complete payment history, the requirement of which has been established by XXXX v XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ; XXXX XXXX. App. LEXIS XXXX. Please provide verification by line item ( with an explanation of each item such as when the purchase took place, how much the item was, were th goods received, when were the goods received, etc. ) for the entire amount you say I owe obtained directly from the Original Creditor.

Date of Last Activity My full, complete and correct social security number that may help to identify me as the correct person you are trying to collect from. 
Agreement that bears the signature of the alleged debtor wherein he agreed to pay the original creditor. 
The obligation between you and I that allows you to collect on the alleged debt and any transactions between your company that binds me to an agreement to pay your company any money that you claim I owe. Proof of photo identification ( i.e., driver 's license, state identification card, or other government issued identification card ) that was presented to you at the time of incurring this debt. 
Letter of sale or assignment from the original creditor to your company. I'm sure you know, under FDCPA Section 809 ( b ), you are not allowed to pursue collection activity until this debt is validated. You should be made aware that in XXXX v. XXXX XXXX, XXXX. Civ XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ), the court XXXX ruled that reporting a collection account is, indeed, considered collection activity. You should also note that this is not a request for " Partial '' Validation but rather, it's a request for EVERYTHING listed here in order to constitute full and sufficient validation of this debt. 
XXXX While I prefer not to litigate, I will use the courts as needed to enforce my rights under the FDCPA and other statutes. I look forward to an uneventful resolution of this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Experian, I am writing to formally dispute the inaccurate accounts listed on my Experian credit report, which I believe were not properly investigated in accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Despite my previous requests for validation and resolution of these discrepancies, it has come to my attention that a proper investigation was not conducted into the accuracy of these accounts. As a result, I request that you immediately remove these accounts from my credit report. 
On XX/XX/year>, the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) filed a lawsuit against your organization under Docket Number XXXX for violations related to the improper handling of consumer disputes, including the failure to conduct thorough and accurate investigations into consumer credit report discrepancies. Given the pending legal action and the clear indication of your failure to comply with the FCRAs investigation requirements, I respectfully request the immediate removal of the affected accounts from my credit file. 
As outlined in the CFPB lawsuit, your failure to properly investigate disputed information violates my consumer rights under federal law. As you are aware, the FCRA mandates that credit reporting agencies conduct a reasonable investigation upon receiving a dispute, and provide verified results in a timely manner. The failure to adhere to these provisions has caused significant harm to my creditworthiness, and I insist on the removal of the inaccurate accounts until such time as a proper investigation can be conducted. 
Please consider this letter a formal dispute and demand for resolution under the FCRA. I expect your prompt action in this matter. Kindly notify me in writing of the results of your investigation and confirm the removal of the disputed accounts from my credit report. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt is not yours
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB, I am submitting this complaint regarding Midland Funding for significant violations of federal consumer protection laws, including the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), as well as actions related to identity theft. 

Background 1. Fraudulent Account : The account in question is not mine. I am the victim of identity theft, and any claims that I owe this debt are fraudulent. 
2. Failure to Notify or Provide Verification : Midland Funding claims they mailed correspondence to me on XX/XX/year>, but I never received any such communication. This lack of notice and verification violates my rights under the FDCPA. 
XXXX. Violation of Cease-and-Desist Request : I explicitly requested Midland Funding to cease all communication and media activity regarding this fraudulent account. While they claimed they would cease contact, they continue to report negatively on my credit report. This is in direct violation of the FDCPA. 
4. Illegal Purchase of Account : If this account were legitimate ( which it is not ), Midland Funding violated my rights by purchasing an account without my knowledge or consent, which is illegal under federal law. Whoever sold the account is also in violation for unauthorized use and sale of my personal information, constituting identity theft. 
5. Data Breach Contribution : The breaches at XXXX and XXXX have further exacerbated the identity theft issue, allowing my information to be misused in this manner. 

Applicable Laws and Violations 1. Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) Unverified Reporting : Under the FCRA ( 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ), companies are prohibited from furnishing inaccurate or unverified information to credit reporting agencies. Midland Funding has reported a debt without verifying its validity or ensuring it is accurate.

Failure to Investigate Disputes : The FCRA requires a thorough investigation of disputes. Midland Funding failed to conduct a proper investigation or provide evidence of the accounts legitimacy. 
Damaging Credit Reporting : Their continued reporting of this fraudulent account has harmed my credit profile without proper documentation or verification, violating my rights under the FCRA. 

2. Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) Failure to Provide Debt Validation : Midland Funding failed to provide proof of the debt upon request, violating FDCPA requirements under 15 U.S.C. 1692g. 
Violation of Cease-and-Desist Request : Despite agreeing to my request for a cease and desist, Midland Funding continues to report negatively to credit bureaus, violating 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ). 
Unfair and Deceptive Practices : By pursuing a debt resulting from identity theft, they are engaging in unfair and deceptive practices prohibited under 15 U.S.C. 1692d-f.

3. Identity Theft and Privacy Protections Illegal Use and Sale of Information :
Midland Funding and the original creditor, whoever they may be, violated my rights under privacy laws by buying and selling my information without consent. This constitutes identity theft under the Identity Theft and Assumption Deterrence Act ( 18 U.S.C. 1028 ). 
Data Breach Contribution : The XXXX and XXXX breaches, which enabled my personal information to be accessed and misused, highlight systemic issues that require investigation and enforcement. 

I have disputed with XXXX and XXXX several times and no one has yet to remove this account as it doesnt belong to me. 

Also the reason I may not have received the letter on XX/XX/XXXX is because you may have the wrong address!!!! My whole credit file is incorrect! And with having my identity stolen the thief may not have the right address

XXXX XXXX inconsistent accounting, misleading credit reporting, and excessive post-repossession fees have created an unfair financial burden on me. I demand a full investigation, removal of unjustified charges, correction of my credit report, and a full breakdown of my alleged balance. 

XXXX. XXXX XXXX Misrepresented My Loan Balance & Payments XXXXXXXX XXXX own documents claim I made {$46000.00} in payments. However, after reviewing line-by-line transactions, it is clear that {$8500.00} of these payments were reversedmeaning my actual payments total only {$30000.00}. 

Breakdown of Payments vs. Reversals : Total Payments Recorded by XXXX : {$46000.00} Total Reversed Payments ( Returned/Cancelled ) : {$8500.00} Actual Payments Made : {$30000.00} Original Loan Balance : {$39000.00} Charged-Off Balance Claimed by XXXX : {$24000.00} Major Issues : XXXX included reversed payments XXXX their records, inflating my total payments to make it appear I still owe more than I should. 
Even after I paid over {$30000.00}, XXXX still claims I owe nearly {$25000.00}, which does not align with basic loan math. 
Failure to properly credit payments violates the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), which requires clear disclosure of how payments are applied. 

XXXX. XXXX Charged Excessive and Unjustified Repo Fees After repossessing my vehicle, XXXX XXXX piled on thousands of dollars in unexplained fees, including : {$530.00} ( XX/XX/year> ) {$530.00} ( XX/XX/year> ) {$290.00} ( XX/XX/year> ) {$110.00} ( XX/XX/year> ) {$30.00}, {$28.00}, {$110.00}, {$260.00} ( XX/XX/year> ) {$8200.00} ( XX/XX/year> ) A massive charge with no breakdown or explanation {$1300.00} ( XX/XX/year> ) Key Issues : XXXX has not provided a detailed breakdown of these fees or whether they were disclosed in my original loan agreement. 
They failed to show how much my repossessed vehicle was sold for, and whether that amount was properly deducted from my balance. 
It is illegal to continue adding interest after repossession, yet XXXX balance appears to be inflated even after the car was seized. 

XXXX. XXXX is Reporting False Information to Credit Bureaus ( FCRA Violation ) XXXX XXXX is reporting inaccurate and misleading information about this loan, violating the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ).

Misrepresented Payment History : Payments that were reversed or never cleared were still included in their total calculations. 

XXXX. XXXX Violated Federal Consumer Protection Laws Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) Violations Failure to accurately disclose how payments were applied Unclear reporting of balance calculations Charging excessive fees without proper itemization Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) Violations Reporting false and unverifiable data to credit bureaus Failing to correct identity errors and payment discrepancies Unfair and Deceptive Acts or Practices ( UDAP ) Violations Inflating loan balances with post-repossession charges and misapplied payments Lack of transparency in repossession procedures and deductions.

Sub-issue: Investigation took more than 30 days
Consumer complaint narrative:
Experian Information Solutions , IncXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX Subject : Formal Dispute Regarding Delayed Credit Report Investigation Dear Sir or Madam, I am writing to formally dispute the delayed handling of my credit report investigation in accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). As a consumer, I am entitled to accurate and timely responses to disputes regarding inaccuracies in my credit file. However, I have encountered significant delays in the resolution of my concerns. 

On [ XXXX XXXX, XXXX ], I submitted a dispute regarding [ specific information in your credit report, e.g., an incorrect account, inaccurate payment history, or unauthorized inquiries ]. Despite the FCRAs requirement for Experian to complete its reinvestigation and provide results within 30 days, I have yet to receive a resolution or written notice of the investigations findings as of today, [ XXXX XXXX, XXXX ]. This constitutes a clear violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), which mandates timely processing of consumer disputes. 

The lack of timely communication and resolution has caused me considerable inconvenience and potential harm to my financial standing. To address this issue, I respectfully request : A detailed explanation for the delay in resolving my dispute. 

Immediate completion of the reinvestigation and correction of any inaccurate information in my credit report. 

Confirmation of the reinvestigation results, including what changes, if any, were made to my credit report. 

Enclosed, you will find copies of all relevant documentation, including my initial dispute letter, supporting evidence, and any subsequent correspondence for your reference. Please consider this as a formal request to expedite the resolution of this matter. 

Failure to comply with the requirements outlined in the FCRA may compel me to seek assistance from the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) or pursue other legal remedies to ensure my rights as a consumer are protected. 

I trust that Experian will take this matter seriously and address my concerns promptly. I look forward to your response within the next 15 days. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this important matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally file a complaint against XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, regarding their improper debt collection practices and violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, claiming that I owe a debt to XXXX in the amount of {$450.00}. However, I have never received any official communication or letter directly from this collection agency, and the information presented in the document contains false and unverifiable details. Specifically : Incorrect Address : The document lists an address ( [ XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, MD XXXX ] ) that does not belong to me. 

Incorrect Account Information : Upon contacting XXXX, I was informed that the phone number attached to this alleged account is XXXX, while the document provided by the collection agency lists XXXX. This discrepancy demonstrates that the account information referenced is not accurate or associated with my XXXX account. 

Failure to Validate the Debt : Upon contacting XXXX directly, I was informed that they could not validate or confirm the debt presented by the collection agency. 
These discrepancies indicate potential violations of federal laws, as outlined below : Failure to Validate Debt Properly ( 15 U.S. Code 1692g ) : Debt collectors are required to provide accurate and sufficient validation of a debt upon request. The collection agency failed to contact me directly, and the information in their communication is false and unverifiable.

Misrepresentation ( 15 U.S. Code 1692e ) : The FDCPA prohibits debt collectors from using false or deceptive means to collect a debt. Providing incorrect information about the address and account details constitutes a clear violation of this provision.

Inaccurate Information Furnished to Credit Reporting Agencies ( 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2 ) : If this debt has been reported to credit bureaus, it violates federal law, as furnishers are prohibited from reporting inaccurate or unverifiable information.

This collection agency is engaging in unfair and misleading practices, and their actions are causing unwarranted stress and confusion. I respectfully request that the CFPB investigate this matter and take appropriate action against XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, for their violations of federal law.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Personal information incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently disputed an incorrect address listed on my credit report and provided clear evidence of my current address. Despite this, the credit bureau refused to remove the incorrect XXXX, Texas address, claiming it was linked to an account I hold with XXXX. To address this issue, I contacted all companies reporting on my credit file to confirm the accuracy of their information. Each company, including XXXX, verified that their records were up-to-date and did not include the incorrect address. 

I then requested the credit bureau to provide evidence linking the disputed address to any account. Upon reviewing the information provided by the credit bureau, I verified this with XXXX, which confirmed that they do not have any account or record associated with a XXXX address. This clearly shows that the credit bureau failed to conduct a proper investigation, as required under FCRA 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ), which mandates a reasonable reinvestigation of disputed information.

In addition to the address dispute, I challenged inaccuracies regarding account statuses, incorrect open/close dates, and accounts that were not opened by me. To safeguard my identity, I placed a security freeze on my credit report, notified the bureaus of potential identity theft, and filed a police report pursuant to FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ), which outlines procedures for handling identity theft disputes.

Despite taking these steps, the credit bureau continues to mishandle my case. When I called and specifically requested to speak with the fraud department, I was transferred to the general information services team multiple times, delaying any meaningful resolution. This failure to provide adequate support violates FCRA 607 ( b ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ), which requires credit reporting agencies to maintain maximum possible accuracy in consumer reports. 

While XXXX conducted a thorough and proper investigation of their records, the credit bureau has failed to remove the incorrect address and rectify other disputed inaccuracies. Their failure to properly investigate and correct these errors is a direct violation of their obligations under FCRA 611 and 605A, which addresses the need for heightened standards when fraud or identity theft is involved.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

She stated she was reopening the claim and provided a claim number. I missed a call from an agent a few days later and made multiple return called and voice messages that were never returned. I called the fraud line again on XX/XX/year> and that's when they notified me the XXXX site had a limited time to view the delivery picture, I had taken a screen shot with the photo, tracking number, and supposed date of delivery so I was instructed to fax the photo in, I also included a photo of the front door of my residence with my drivers licenses for verification to compare. I was instructed to allow 48 hours to review. I called back on XX/XX/year> to follow up and was notified it was never reviewed but a note would be added to my account to view as a priority and that it would take up to 10 business days, which is not what was previously stated. I called back XX/XX/year> where I was told the case was never reopened unlike previously stated and there was a memo that the fax containing my pictures was unlegible. A note was added to my account to review since the document contains pictures for comparison, not text, and to please contact me at my number to discuss. Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Texas, XXXX XX/XX/year> Experian XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX Subject : Request for Investigation and Dispute of Charge-Off Under 15 U.S.C. 1681i Dear Sir or Madam, I am writing to formally dispute the charge-off account appearing on my credit report under the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681i. This section of the FCRA mandates that credit reporting agencies conduct a thorough and reasonable investigation upon receiving a dispute regarding the accuracy or completeness of information on a consumer 's credit report. 

The charge-off in question is inaccurate and/or unverifiable. Under the FCRA, you are required to : Promptly initiate an investigation into the disputed information. 
Verify the accuracy of the information with the furnisher or delete the disputed information if it can not be verified. 
Provide me with the results of your investigation within 30 days from the date of this dispute. 
If you find that the charge-off can not be verified as accurate, I demand that it be permanently removed from my credit file. Furthermore, I request that you send me a corrected copy of my credit report reflecting this change. 

Additionally, I would like to remind you that failure to comply with the obligations set forth under 15 U.S.C. 1681i may result in civil liability under 15 U.S.C. 1681n and 1681o, including the recovery of damages and attorneys fees. 

I have attached a copy of my government-issued identification and proof of address to facilitate your investigation. Please notify me promptly if you require any further information to process my dispute. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to receiving your response and resolution within the required timeframe. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : 15 U.S.C. 1681i - Procedure in Case of Disputed Accuracy ( a ) Reinvestigations of disputed information ( 1 ) Reinvestigation required If the completeness or accuracy of any item of information contained in a consumer 's file at a consumer reporting agency is disputed by the consumer and the consumer notifies the agency directly of such dispute, the agency shall : ( A ) conduct a reasonable reinvestigation to determine whether the disputed information is inaccurate and record the current status of the disputed information, or delete the item from the file within 30 days of receiving the dispute. 
( 2 ) Prompt notice of dispute The consumer reporting agency shall provide notification of the dispute to any person who provided the disputed information. The notice shall include all relevant information regarding the dispute that the agency has received from the consumer.

( 5 ) Deletion of inaccurate or unverifiable information If, after any reinvestigation of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of information is found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall promptly delete that item of information from the consumers file or modify that item of information, as appropriate. 

( 6 ) Notice of results of reinvestigation ( A ) Following any reinvestigation, the agency shall provide written notice to the consumer of the results of the reinvestigation not later than XXXX business days after the completion of the reinvestigation.

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative:
In ~XXXX XXXX I submitted dispute XXXX for a transaction in the amount of {$180.00} that should have been {$65.00}, and disputing the remaining {$110.00}. This was for a gas station purchases for gas in XXXX. I only purchased gas, I did not authorize a charge for {$180.00}, and the car could not physically hold anywhere close to {$180.00} of gas at the price per liter that the station was charging. Subsequently I read reviews of the gas station showed that the practice of fraudulently overcharging was common. 

Note that my credit card number recently changed. I am providing the current card number in this complaint. If the original card number is required please contact me. 

I provided all of the documentation and proof available to me ( several times ). On XX/XX/XXXX, they denied because I had not provided proof that the correct amount should have been {$65.00}. I called back on XX/XX/XXXX and explained that it was not possible to know the exact correct amount because I was not given a receipt. Furthermore, I had not authorized a charge of {$180.00} and the entire amount should be considered fraudulent ( I had only provided the {$65.00} estimate to try to be fair ). The correct amount is {$0.00} because I had not authorized {$180.00} and {$180.00} is a physically impossible amount of gas to purchase in that car. I purchased XXXX of a tank which is XXXX gallons or XXXX liters and at XXXX pesos per liter XXXX pesos or {$51.00} USD. All my gas purchases in XXXX were for similar amounts of gas at similar prices and were for less than {$70.00}, except this one fraudulent station. Even a full tank could not physically be more than {$75.00}. I did not authorize the {$180.00}, and the entire amount should be considered fraudulent. They agreed and said they would reopen the case. 

I have been receiving statements from my credit card company showing the {$110.00} amount as in dispute, so my belief was that the amount was still in dispute. It turns out that the dispute processor used by the credit card company had not done what they said they would- they did not reopen the case. The amount in dispute of {$110.00} showing my statements appears to be misleading. This still shows on the most recent XXXX statement - 6 months after the disptue processor closed the case and neglected to reopen it. 

I have contacted both companies and they refuse to communicate with each other or handle the situation. A mistake was made but each blames the other and says the power to reopen lies with the other.

Product: Prepaid card
Sub-issue: Confusing or misleading advertising about the card
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Formal Complaint Against Bank of America Dear CFPB, I am submitting this formal complaint against Bank of America for numerous violations of federal consumer protection laws that I have experienced over the past decade. These issues have significantly impacted my financial stability, mental health, and overall well-being. The following outlines the practices and misconduct I have endured : 1. Unauthorized Accounts and Services Bank of America has added services to my accounts and opened products without my explicit authorization. These actions resulted in fees and account changes I did not request or agree to.

2. Deceptive Practices The bank repeatedly provided misleading information regarding fees, terms, and conditions of my accounts. For instance, I was not informed of overdraft protection terms, and certain fees were applied without notice.

3. Overdraft Practices I have been charged excessive overdraft fees, including multiple charges for the same transaction. Additionally, I was automatically enrolled in overdraft protection without my consent, causing unnecessary fees to accumulate over time.

4. Improper Handling of Disputes Bank of America failed to investigate disputes involving unauthorized transactions and identity theft in a timely manner. My repeated efforts to resolve these disputes were met with delays, improper conclusions, and violations of legal timelines for dispute resolution. 

5. Discrimination As a single, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, I believe I have been subjected to discriminatory practices. My concerns were dismissed, and I was denied the assistance and accommodations needed to manage my accounts effectively. 

6. Debt Collection Practices The bank attempted to collect debts that were invalid or already settled. These actions caused undue financial stress and exacerbated my existing hardships. 

7. Unlawful Fees Bank of America charged fees for services I did not authorize or request. These charges were inconsistent, unexplained, and financially damaging.

8. Failure to Safeguard Consumer Information Due to the banks negligence in securing my personal information, I became a victim of identity theft. Despite notifying the bank of these issues, my accounts remained unprotected, exposing me to further fraudulent activity.

9. Loan Servicing Errors Bank of America mishandled loan payments by applying them incorrectly and providing me with inaccurate payoff information. This mismanagement caused confusion and financial difficulties. 

10. Violation of Fair Credit Reporting The bank reported inaccurate information to credit bureaus, which negatively affected my credit score. Despite notifying the bank, these inaccuracies were not corrected. 

Consequences of These Violations These practices have caused significant harm, including : Financial instability, resulting in multiple evictions. 

Emotional distress and mental health deterioration. 

An unsafe and unpredictable environment for my child. 

Long-term financial damage due to identity theft and fraudulent activities. 


Request for Investigation and Relief I am requesting that the CFPB investigate these matters thoroughly and hold Bank of America accountable for its actions. I am also seeking restitution for the financial losses and emotional distress caused by their misconduct. 

Enclosed with this complaint are relevant documents and evidence to support my claims. Please let me know if additional information is required. I trust that your office will address this matter promptly and ensure that justice is served. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter

Despite providing evidence to support my claims, Experian has not taken the necessary steps to conduct a proper investigation, which violates my rights as a consumer under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

The inaccurate accounts in question are as follows : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I have submitted disputes for these accounts and provided documentation to prove the information is either inaccurate or unverifiable. However, Experian has either failed to verify the information properly or has responded with generic " verified '' statements without explaining their investigation process or correcting the errors. 

This failure to conduct a reasonable investigation has caused harm t o my credit score and financial well-being, affecting my ability to [ get approved for credit, loans, and housing ]. 

I am requesting the following actions from Experian through the CFPB : 1. Conduct a proper and thorough investigation into the accounts I've disputed. 
2. Provide me with a detailed explanation of the steps they've taken to verify or correct the information. 
3. Remove any inaccurate or unverifiable information from my credit report immediately. 

I am attaching all relevant documents, including certified documents showing I sent it to Experian certified letters, Experian 's responses, and supporting evidence, to this complaint for your review. 

Thank you for your assistance in addressing this matter and ensuring that Experian complies with federal laws to protect consumers like me. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX Please see all attachments
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
Account Number : XXXX I am writing to formally dispute inaccuracies in the reporting of the above-referenced account on my credit report. A review of the details provided by your bureau and those reported by other credit bureaus has revealed several inconsistencies and potential errors that require immediate investigation and correction. 

Discrepancies Identified : Account Type and Details : The account type is consistently listed as " Installment Account '' across XXXX and Experian. However, Experian further categorizes it as a " Secured Loan. '' Please verify and confirm the correct account type and details. 
Balance and Past Due Amount : Both XXXX and Experian report a balance of {$4500.00} and a past-due amount of {$4500.00}. These figures should be verified for accuracy with the creditor, as they may no longer reflect the current account status.

Account Status and Payment Status : The account is marked as " Closed '' with a " Charge-off '' or " Charged off as bad debt '' payment status. Additionally, XXXX includes a comment indicating " Profit and loss write-off, '' which is absent in Experians report. Please investigate whether these designations are accurate and align with the original creditors reporting. 
Last Reported and Date Last Active : XXXX lists the " Last Reported '' date as XX/XX/XXXX and the " Date Last Active '' as the same. Experian, however, reports the " Date Last Active '' as XX/XX/XXXX. These discrepancies must be reconciled and updated with accurate information. 
Date of Last Payment : Both bureaus report the date of last payment as XX/XX/XXXX. Please confirm that this date is correct and corresponds with the creditors records. 
Requested Actions : Conduct a comprehensive investigation with the original creditor or data furnisher to verify the account information.

Update any incorrect or inconsistent details regarding the account type, status, balance, past-due amount, and activity dates. 
Provide a detailed explanation of your investigation, including the evidence used to verify the reported information. 
Legal Obligations : Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), credit reporting agencies are required to ensure the accuracy, completeness, and verifiability of all reported information. Please resolve this dispute and provide me with an updated credit report reflecting accurate data within the legally mandated XXXX period.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Information belongs to someone else
Consumer complaint narrative:
The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system.

So whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of my privacy with my consumer report, since I control what is listed and what is not. In the event that any accounts are reported without my written consent, that is considered identity theft.

This is a violation of both 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2. This leads way to civil liability against the credit reporting agency for negligent and willful noncompliance under 15 U.S. Code 1681n, which allows for {$1000.00} per violation, for account listed without my expressed written consent.

Sub-issue: Information belongs to someone else
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX DateXXXX Comenity Capital Bank XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. 


Acct # XXXX Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX Subject : Cease and Desist Request for Deletion of Collection Account Dear Comenity Capital Bank, I am writing to formally request that you immediately cease all reporting of the collection account associated with my name, which appears on my credit report. This request is made under the privacy protections afforded to me by 15 U.S. Code 6802. I have reviewed my credit report and noticed that your company is reporting a collection account that is inaccurate or incomplete. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I am entitled to dispute any information that I believe to be erroneous. If you do not cease reporting this account, I am formally requesting Proper Validation and Proof of Claim as per the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). I seek comprehensive validation of the alleged debt, including evidence establishing that I am the party obligated to settle this debt and that there exists a legally binding contractual obligation compelling me to do so. For clarity, I request that all communication be limited to written correspondence until adequate validation of the purported debt is provided. To assist you in meeting this request, please furnish the following required documentation : 1. A copy of the original contract or agreement under which the debt arose. 

2. A detailed account statement showing the amount of the debt, including any fees or interest. 

3. Date of Last Activity. 

4. Full, accurate social security number that may help to identify me as the correct person you are trying to collect from. 

5. Documentation confirming that you have the legal right to collect this debt. 

6. Any correspondence related to this account that includes my signature or consent.

I am writing to formally dispute the accuracy and completeness of several items on my Experian credit report, generated on XX/XX/XXXX. As outlined under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ), you are required to conduct a reasonable investigation into any disputed items and provide me with the method of verification ( MOV ) for how each item was validated. Experian has failed to do so and on several of my previous complaints they stated they could not locate my credit report, or that the accounts were accurate but they failed to send me a Method of verification on their investigation and when I call to see if they received my MOV they state they have not its outrageous The following items require immediate investigation and correction or deletion if verification can not be provided : 1.Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX 
Account Number : XXXX Issue : Charged-off status with an outstanding balance of {$100.00} as of XX/XX/XXXX. The account reflects consistent charge-off entries without documentation to validate the debt or proper investigation of prior disputes. 

2.Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 
Account Number : XXXX Issue : Charged-off status with a past-due amount of {$230.00} as of XX/XX/XXXX. This account was previously disputed, yet no method of verification was sent to me. 

3.Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Issue : Charged-off status with a balance of {$960.00}. Despite reporting numerous late payments, Experian failed to validate the accuracy of these derogatory entries when requested. 

4.Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX ( No account number shown on report which is a violation, I have attached my Experian report with proof ) Issue : This account shows two late payments before closure. The investigation results for prior disputes are incomplete, and no method of verification was provided. failure to comply with 15 USC 1666B ( a ) while account was open.

I request that Experian : Verify the Accuracy : Reinvestigate the items listed above, contacting the original data furnishers to obtain documented proof of their reporting.

Provide the Method of Verification ( MOV ) : As per FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 7 ), provide me with the name, address, and telephone number of each furnisher contacted during the investigation.

Correct or Delete : If the items can not be verified within 30 days, you are obligated to delete or correct them under FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 5 ).

Experian has failed to comply with these obligations, I reserve the right to pursue legal remedies, including filing this complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ).

I request that you confirm in writing the permissible purpose under which you accessed my credit report, along with the dates and reasons for these inquiries. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Subject : Dispute of Obsolete/Incorrect Information in My Credit Report Under 15 USC 1681c and Non-Receipt of Form 1099-C Dear Credit Bureau I am writing to dispute inaccurate and potentially obsolete information that appears on my credit report, in accordance with 15 USC Code 1681c of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Specifically, I am disputing the continued reporting of an account that I believe should no longer be included. 

The account details are as follows : Creditor Name :XX/XX/XXXXAccount Number : XXXX XXXX Date of Delinquency/Charge-off/Closure : XX/XX/XXXX Nature of Dispute : The debt in question should have been removed due to the passage of the [ seven-year ] reporting limit under 15 USC Code 1681c. Furthermore, I never received a Form 1099-C for the alleged cancellation of debt, which raises questions regarding the validity and status of this account.

Since I did not receive a Form 1099-C, there is no record that this debt was officially canceled or forgiven. This lack of documentation further supports my belief that the information is either obsolete or inaccurate and should not be included in my credit file. 

I request that you : 1. Immediately remove the outdated or incorrect account from my credit report.

2. Conduct a thorough investigation to verify the accuracy of this information and determine why a Form 1099-C was not issued.

3. Provide me with written confirmation that the disputed information has been removed or corrected once your investigation is complete. 

Under the FCRA, you are required to investigate this matter and correct any inaccuracies or outdated information within 30 days. Please consider this letter a formal dispute. 

I have enclosed a copy of my credit report with the disputed item highlighted, as well as copies of identification documents to verify my identity. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to receiving confirmation that the erroneous information has been removed from my credit report. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
